loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of clothing to sell

loans.name: Pablo Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Pablo Ramón es originario del Municipio de Condega, a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí, reside en su casa propia desde hace unos 18 años junto a su esposa la que se desempeña como maestra y junto a sus 4 hijos.

El señor Pablo Ramón en la actualidad se desempeña como comerciante y su actividad principal es la compra y venta de verduras tales como son las cebollas y las papa, el compra estos productos en las zonas rurales y la distribuyen en los mercados de los pueblos aledaños como es Estelí, Ocotal, Somoto, etc., lo que le genera las ganancias, además el tiene su finca donde maneja su ganado y siembra granos básicos como frijoles y maíz para el consumo, el se dedica a esta labor desde hace aproximadamente unos 20 años, cabe mencionar que estas son sus principales fuentes de ingreso para el sostén de su familia.

 Pablo Ramon se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de 5 novillos para engorde los que serán repastados en su propiedad y luego serán vendidos con un peso mayor y a un mejor precio lo que le generara ganancias al cliente.
texts.en:
Pablo Ramón is originally from the town of Condega, some 35 km north of the city of Estelí. He has been living in his own home for about 18 years together with his wife, who works as a teacher, and with his four children. 

Pablo Ramón currently works as a merchant mainly buying and selling vegetables such as onions and potatoes. He buys the products in the rural areas and distributes them in the surrounding towns of Estelí, Ocotal, Somoto, etc, which generates income. Furthermore, he has a farm where he keeps his livestock and he grows basic grains such as beans and corn for consumption, and has been engaged in this work for about 20 years. It is worth mentioning that these are his main sources of income with which he supports his family.

Pablo Ramon came to the Ceprodel offices to ask for a new loan to buy five calves for fattening which will be grazing on his property and later they will be sold at a greater weight and a better price bringing income in from customers.

loans.use: to buy five calves to fatten for later resale at a higher weight and better price

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina is 61 years old and married with 1 child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Joaquina has run a general store in the Philippines for the past 10 years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, soap, sugar, and groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Joaquina would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Idriss

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Idriss.  He is married and has three children, aged 3, 5 and 10. He has one additional dependent (his wife's younger sister, to assist with her education) who lives with him. 

In 1998, Idriss established his textiles and trimmings business.  He started the business to be self-reliant after dropping out of school. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about LE 2,700,500 every month from this business. 

Idriss would like a loan in the amount of LE 5,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to improve on the sale of linen material, wool and thread. He hopes that this loan will enable him to add stock and improve the profit.

In the future, Idriss plans to increase his business and expand on the sale of trimmings and soft drinks. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and trimmings.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, age 42, established his mobile phone accessories business in 2003. He is an honest man who began his business by selling belts and jeans from his stall, but who now sells mobile phone accessories in order to better cater to his family's needs. He and his wife have three children, ages four, seven, and 15. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to help with the household chores. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,950,000 every month from his business. He travels to Conakry by vehicle monthly.

James would like to request a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. He has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and he will use his new loan funds to improve and increase his stock of mobile phone accessories. 

In the future, James plans to develop his business and move to a shop instead of a stall as well as to buy a piece of land. His goal is to improve his livelihood and his family's standard of living. 

James thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories to offer for sale

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Gina has been buying and selling livestock for one year and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Nazmeen's Group

texts.en:
Nazmeen lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her family. She is the mother of two sons and a daughter. Her husband owns a small general store near the family house. In his store, he sells such general merchandise as biscuits, milk, candies, cold drinks, and chips.

Currently, Nazmeen's husband is in need of purchasing a variety of products for his store, such as ice cream, biscuits, chips, and cold drinks. For this purpose, his wife has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help her husband to increase his net income and savings and better support the family. 

They are both very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products for her husband's general store, such as ice cream, biscuits, chips, and cold drinks

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Mariatu.  She is married and has three children aged three, seven and twelve; two are attending school. In 2005, Mariatu established her ladies' dresses business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband with running the affairs of the home.. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are ladies. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,128,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Mariatu requires a loan in order to buy additional blouses, trousers and slippers. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock. In the future, Mariatu plans to move from a makeshift stall to a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for blouses, trousers, and slippers to re-sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a 57-year-old woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Juana has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

Juana requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy materials for her fishing business. Juana has been in this business for two years. In the future, Juana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Danaya  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 1 enfant vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Heremakono Centre de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce des habillements, des fruits et légumes et de la restauration. 
Magnon, qui est la seule assise devant fait de la restauration et de la vente des fruits et légumes. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  5 chargements de charrettes en bananes  auprès des producteurs dans les villages voisins de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the group Danaya average 36 years of age and one child each, all living in traditional families in the Heremakono Centre district of Bougouni City. The women know one another through ties of community, friendship, and business. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third loan. This group of women does commerce in clothing, fruit & vegetables, and food service. 

Magnon, who is the only one seated in front in the photo, works in food service and in selling fruit & vegetables. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 cart loads of bananas from producers in the Bougouni area. She makes her retail sales at the market and at home. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA that will be used for: investing in her businesses, covering healthcare costs, and repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase bananas

loans.name: Parwin's Group

texts.en:
Parwin, age 45, operates a small, home-based sewing and tailoring business. She has been engaged in this business for the past seven years. She is one of many Iraqi woman who work from home as a result of limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints. She uses her sewing skills to generate a small income so that she can participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. She and her husband have five children.
 
Parwin enjoys her work, creating custom-ordered dresses and other fabric items. She would like to improve her business, specifically the equipment she uses. She would therefore like to request a loan in order to buy an over-machine and an ironing board, which will allow her to create a better variety of products and to offer an improved service to her customers. She has requested the loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor, therefore making them unable to apply for a loan as individuals. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy an over-machine and an ironing board for her sewing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nguermalal Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois qui abrite ce groupe a été créé le 17 mai 2010. Il est composé de 32 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles se sont organisées par affinité, par voisinage. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Aminata (debout à droite sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle a en charge 05 enfants. Elle travaille au poste de santé de leur village. En parallèle elle fait de l'embouche ovine. Elle mène cette d'activité depuis plusieurs années. 

Son prêt va lui permettre d'acheter des moutons pour la poursuite de ses activités et la satisfaction de sa clientèle. 

Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois, which houses this group, was created on May 17, 2010. It comprises 32 women from the same district. They are organized by affinity, by community. Their main work involves small-scale commerce.

Aminata (standing at the right in the photo) is the group's official. She is 44 years old and has five children to support. She works at the health clinic in their village. At the same time, she raises sheep. She has been working at it for several years. 

Her loan will enable her to purchase some sheep for her business for her customers' satisfaction.

Her goal is to be able to meet family needs and to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is a widow who earns a living by cooking and selling banku. She serves it with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce and sells it from her stall at Putubiw, near Cape Coast. Aba has been engaged in this business for 20 years and she uses her income to support her three children. 

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish, ingredients she uses in preparing the banku that she offers for sale. 

She intends to use the new profits from her business to mount a better stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish, ingredients she uses in preparing the banku that she offers for sale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina  operates the provision store in the picture above and she also cooks food to sell at a village called Putubiw near Cape Coast. Some of the foods she cook are 'banku' (fermented corn dough), 'wakye' (beans and rice cooked together), and plain rice with tomato sauce, spicy black pepper and others.  When given the loan she would use it to acquire an additional variety of provisions to sell, as well as tomatoes, beans and rice to enable her to cook in large quantities for resale. She is presently living with four dependents and as a responsible parent, she assists her spouse to provide the daily needs of her family. Any profit  acquired  from her increased income will be used to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a variety of provisions to sell and also tomatoes, beans and rice to enable her to cook in large quantities for resale

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
This is the “Tawopaneh” loan group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner, to request loans to be used to invest in their reprective businesses. They live in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. Each member of the group is seeking a loan in the amount of SLL 500,000.00.
  
Sallay, age 35, is the leader of this group. Sallay sells such items as ginger, corns, beans, margi (an ingredient used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, and salt. She has been engaged in this business for many years now. 

Sallay and her husband have five children. Two are enrolled in primary school, two attend secondary school, and the youngest is not yet of school-going age. 
 
With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy such items as ginger, corns, beans, margi, pepper, and salt to offer for sale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a food vendor. She cooks rice and fish stew for sale at Putubiuw, near Cape Coast. Sarah is married and has six children. She has been in this business for five years now.  She uses her income to support her husband in feeding their children. 

Sarah will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale. With the new profit, Sarah plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale.

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
Melita, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Francisco quien es empleado estatal, fruto de esa unión tienen 3 hijos 18, 5 y 3 años de edad, habitando su propia casa  que compró con mucho esfuerzo.

La actividad que realiza Melita es la fabricación de palitos para helados. Semanalmente acude a su vivienda un señor quien le trae los materiales necesarios para la elaboración de estos productos como triplay, pinturas y otros. La elaboración de los palitos se hace uno por uno de manera manual, los que son usados para helados no se pintan, sin embargo hay otros de mayor medida que son pintados para darles usos didácticos o decorativos. Cuando tiene la cantidad requerida envía sus productos en sacos a otras ciudades y por ello recibe un buen pago. Lleva trabajando en este negocio 2 años y trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana. Eventualmente, vende abarrotes y bebidas las cuales envía a los centros poblados asentados en la ribera de los ríos. 
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos familiares, se siente feliz porque su negocio está creciendo a base de mucho esfuerzo ya que siempre está pensando en todo momento brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. 
Con el monto solicitado 1500 nuevos soles comprará los materiales necesarios como triplay, cuchillas y pinturas para continuar elaborando los palitos de helados.
texts.en:
Melita is 39 years old and she is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman that strives to get ahead.  She is married to Francisco who is a government employee.  They have three children that are 18, 5, and 3 years old.  They live in their own home that they worked very hard to buy.

Malita makes Popsicle sticks.  Each week a man comes to her home and brings the materials she needs, such as plywood, paint, and other items, so that she can create these sticks. She makes them manually, one-by-one.  The ones that are used for ice cream are not painted, however, there are bigger ones that are painted and are used for teaching or as decoration.  When she has the required quantity, she sends her products in bags to other cities and receives payment.  She has been working in this business for 2 years and works with the help of her sister.  

She likes her work because it enables her to earn an income so that she can help pay her family's expenses.  She is happy because her business is growing because of all of her hard work.  She is always thinking about how to improve the quality of life for her children.  With this loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will be able to buy the necessary materials such as plywood, knives, and paints so that she can continue making Popsicle sticks.

loans.use: to buy materials such as plywood, knives, and paints so that she can continue making Popsicle sticks.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
El señor Fidencio tiene 45 años de edad, es casado   vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en la ciudad de Ybycui. Nos cuenta que antes de empezar con el negocio viajó al exterior en busca de mejores oportunidades, gracias a ello pudo juntar un capital importante junto con su señora y decidieron volver al país, con lo cual construyeron su casa y decidieron montar una despensa, gracias al empeño y el trabajo arduo su negocio fue creciendo, hoy en día posee clientela formada gracias a la buena atención y amabilidad con la que atiende a las personas.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, comestibles, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
Sr. Fidencio is 45 years old and married. He lives with his wife and three children in the city of Ybycui. He says that before he started his business he traveled abroad in search of better opportunities. Because of that he and his wife were able to accumulate a significant amount of capital and decided to return to Paraguay. They built their house and decided to open a store with their savings. Thanks to effort and hard work his business has expanded. He now has a steady clientele  because of the good and friendly service he provides his customers.

He is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for his store, such as beverages, groceries, vegetables and other products.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, groceries, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba cooks banku for sale; she serves it with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce at Putubiuw, near Cape Coast.  She is  a married with four children.   

Aba  has been into this business for six years.  She uses her income to support her husband in the general up keep of her family. 

Her loan will be used to  purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing her banku for sale. 

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to get a better stall for the sale of her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her banku for sale.

loans.name: Omer

texts.en: Omer is a 23-year-old, single man from Al- Hodeidah, Yemen. He has a  Bachelor's degree. He has a cosmetics and telephone booth store. Two  years ago, he opened a call center. This center contained some telephone booths and he sold mobile phone recharge cards. Later, he expanded his business and started selling phone accessories and cosmetics. He did really well in his first business. Now, he wants capital to buy more cosmetic products and attract more clients, so he applied for a loan in the amount of 50.000 YER. Omer is really a hard-working person who searches for anything that would make him money.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing more cosmetic products

loans.name: Foyer De La Femme Ndande Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois abritant ce groupe existe depuis le 16 décembre 2011; Il est constitué de dix huit femmes qui habitent le même village et qui mènent diverses activités telles que l'élevage, la couture et le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou l'emprunteur vedette est âgée de 49 ans; mariée elle est mère de six enfants toutes des filles; elle mène une activité de vente de bouillie de mil. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en grand boubou bleu et a levé la main gauche.


Elle se ravitaille en mil pour les besoins de son activité dans les marchés environnants 


Son prêt lui servira à acheter du mil en grande quantité pour mener à bien sa vente de bouillie et ainsi se faire beaucoup de revenus. 

Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices renforcer son épargne afin d'obtenir un prêt plus consistant.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois, which houses this group, was created on December 16, 2011; it comprises eighteen women who live in the same village and who do diverse work, such as livestock farming, sewing, and small-scale commerce.

Ms. Fatou is the featured borrower. She is 49 years old, married, and the mother of six children, all girls. She has a business selling millet porridge. In the photo, she is the one standing at the right dressed in a nice blue 'boubou', and her left hand is raised.

She resupplies herself with millet for business purposes from area markets. 

Her wish is to use her profits to bolster her savings, so as to obtain a more substantial loan.

loans.use: to purchase millet to make porridge to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte sells children and ladies clothing at Putubiw, near Cape Coast.  She is married and has three children; her husband is a farmer.  

Charlotte has been selling children and ladies clothing for six years. She and her husband pay their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to buy children and ladies clothing to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy children and ladies clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Group

texts.en:
Pictured here is the “Tawopaneh” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Ibrahim, age 35, is the leader of this group. His wife works as a trader of goods, and they have three children, all of whom are attending primary schools. Ibrahim bakes and sells bread to earn an income, and he has been engaged in his business for 15 years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy bread-baking materials like flour, yeast, and sugar in large quantities in order to be able to bake greater quantities of breads to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy bread-baking materials like flour, yeast, and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba  sells rice porridge, and she serves the porridge with bread at  Putuubu  near  Cape Coast.  She is married to a driver   and has three children.  

Araba  has been selling rice porridge for six years now.  She uses her income to assist her husband  to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees.  Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice and flour to prepare her porridge and  bread for sale. With the new profit,  Araba will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and flour to prepare her porridge and  bread for sale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, age 35, owns a posho-mill, which is a mill that grinds wheat or maize into flour. In addition, she sells cereals. She has been engaged in these ventures for the past 12 years and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. She and her husband Tobias have three children, ages 11, 14, and 16. The family lives in the Katito area of the western region of Kenya.
 
Alice is requesting her second loan with Kadet Ltd. She will use her loan funds to repair her posho-mill and to buy another stock of cereals to offer for sale. She intends to apply her anticipated profits toward the education of her children, particularly to pay school fees.

Her dream is to expand her business and become a fresh produce supplier. She also hopes to modernize her posho-mill from diesel-powered to electricity-powered.

loans.use: to repair her posho-mill and to buy another stock of cereals to offer for sale

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a food vendor; she cooks wakye (rice and beans cooked together) and plain rice with tomato sauce and spicy black pepper. She sells it at a nearby school at Putubiw, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana. She is married.  

Her loan will be used to purchase bags of rice, beans, and other vegetables, to increase her sales. 

The new profit will be reinvested back into the business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, beans, and other vegetables to increase sales at her food stall.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes sells gari. Gari is  a staple food made from cassava. She has been selling gari  for seven years now. She is married to a farmer and has five  dependents. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of her children.  

Agnes needs this loan to purchase bags of cassava to prepare her gari to sell. With the new profit from her loan, Agnes plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cassava.

loans.name: Ndiaya's Group

texts.fr:
Ce Banc Villageois existe depuis le 16 décembre 2011; le groupe PC 02 est constitué de vingt neuf femmes qui habitent le même village et qui mènent diverses activités telles que l'élevage, la couture et le petit commerce.

Madame Anta l'emprunteur vedette est âgée de 33 ans; elle est mariée sans enfant; elle mène une activité de couture depuis un an. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée tout en bleu couverte d'un châle et a levé la main gauche.


Elle se ravitaille au marché de  Ndande en tissus,fils, rubans etc....



Avec son prêt elle souhaite acheter des tissus pour une valeur de  55000 F pour confectionner des draps et habits à revendre afin de gagner plus de revenus.


Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices renforcer son épargne et ouvrir une mercerie.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was created on December 16 2011. The group PC 02 consists of 29 women who live in the same village and conduct various activities such as animal husbandry, sewing and small trade. 

Mrs. Anta, age 33, is the featured borrower from this group. She is married without children. She has been working as a seamstress for a year. In the photo, she can be seen standing on the right dressed in blue and wrapped in a scarf, with her left hand raised.  

She stocks up on fabrics, thread, ribbons, etc. at the market of Ndande.

She will use her loan to buy 55,000 F worth of fabrics to make bed sheets and clothing, which she will sell to bolster her income.

She will use her profits to boost her savings and open a notions store.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make clothing for sale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a food vendor; she cooks rice and fish stew for sale at Putubiuw, near Cape Coast. She has been in this business for ten years. Sarah is married and has four children.  

She uses her income to support her husband in feeding their children.  

Ekua  will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook and then sell. With the new profit, Ekua plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook and sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
In 2005, Daniel established his spare parts business, selling clutches, fan belts, brake oil, engine oil, bearings, brake pads, brake liners, carbon brushes, etc. He began his business because he dropped out of school because of sponsorship.  His father sent him to a garage to acquire knowledge in vehicle maintenance. After specializing in it and accumulating some amount of money, he opened a spare parts shop.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, Daniel earns about 2,200,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 6,000,000 SLL. Daniel has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy clutches, fan belts, brake oil, plugs, carbon brushes, etc.

In the future, Daniel plans educate his children, acquire a bigger shop and to become an international businessman. This loan will help him to generate more income. Daniel is a very hardworking and devoted man with good vision. He thanks ARD for improving his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy auto spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Oumou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe constitué de deux femmes qui habitant le même village et qui mènent diverses activités telles que l'élevage, la couture et le petit commerce font partie du même banc villageois.

Madame Oumou l'emprunteur vedette est âgée de 37 ans; c'est une femme  mariée sans enfant ; elle mène une activité de petit commerce de produits agricoles, elle fait aussi de l'aviculture. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite vêtue en mauve tachetée de blanc et a levé la main gauche.


Elle s'approvisionne en arachide, niébé, mil.....au marché de leur localité.


Avec son prêt elle souhaite acheter des poulets pour l'aviculture, de l'arachide et du niébé pour ainsi se faire plus de revenus à la vente.


Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices renforcer son épargne afin d'obtenir un prêt plus élevé et s'assurer un meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
This group is composed of two women living in the same village and having diverse work, such as livestock farming, sewing, and small-scale commerce. The women belong to the same 'banc villageois'. 

Ms. Oumou, the featured borrower, is 37 years old; she is a married women without children. She has a small business selling farm produce. She also raises poultry. In the photo, she is the one standing at the right dressed in a white-speckled mauve outfit, and her left hand is raised.

She stocks up on peanuts, black-eyed peas, millet… at the market in their town. 

With her loan, she would like to purchase some chickens for livestock farming, some peanuts, and some black-eyed peas, so as to earn more sales income. 

She would like to use her profits to bolster her savings, ultimately to obtain a larger loan, and to ensure a better future for herself.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and various farm produce to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, margi, dried fish, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, age 22 and unmarried, is a farmer. His family members are also farmers and are dependent on the income they generate from agriculture. He lives with his family in a small village called Kofradan near Jenin. Kofradan is famous for being a strong agricultural village in Palestine. The people there cultivate a variety of types of vegetables on their farmland.
 
Ali is known for his strong personality and adaptability. For the past three years, Ali has been working in an Internet cafe in the village. He purchases Internet accounts from Palestinian Telecommunications and sells these to his clients in Kofradan. This has been a profitable project and provides him with a second source of income.

Ali is requesting a youth loan from FATEN, which he will use to cover the cost of purchasing additional Internet accounts. This will meet the growing customer demand for Internet accounts, and the investment will increase his sales and improve his income.  
 
Ali is photographed in the Internet cafe where he works.

loans.use: to purchase additional Internet accounts in order to increase the clientele of his Internet cafe

loans.name: Tiburcia

texts.es:
La Señora Tiburcia  es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es soltera, ella se dedica al comercio hace más de dos años, tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad.
Ella es una persona que se destaca por querer trabajar y salir adelante por medio de su trabajo, se esfuerza siempre para poder salir adelante y así poder ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, panificados, hortalizas y demás para poder surtir su despensa y seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en: Tiburcia is a single woman from the city of Curuguaty.  She has been in business for more than two years, running a grocery store which is well stocked with all kinds of essential goods.  She is a person who stands out on account of her desire to work and succeed through her business.  She always strives to achieve success so as to help her family.  She is seeking this loan to stock her store with drinks, baked goods, vegetables etc. so that she can maintain her sales.

loans.use: to buy drinks, baked goods, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Isatu I

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Isatu. She is married and has four children, aged 4, 7, 11 and 13 years. In 2001, Isatu established her essential drugs business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. 

Isatu would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy essential drugs for her drug store. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 370,000. In the future, Isatu plans to educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy essential drugs for her drug store.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Benkadi  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 3 enfants vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de tissus, de boissons non alcoolisée et de la restauration. 
Maïmouna, qui est la seule assise devant fait de la restauration. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 200 kilos de mil, 1 sac de sucre et quotidiennement du lait dans les villages voisins de Bougouni et à Bougouni ville. Elle effectue ses ventes (plats alimentaires) au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the group Benkadi average 34 years of age and three children each, all living in traditional families in the Heremakono Nord district of Bougouni City. The women know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan. This group of women does commerce in fabrics, soft drinks, and food service. 

Maïmouna, who is the only one seated in front in the photo, works in food service. She intends to use her loan to purchase 200 kg of millet, a bag of sugar, some milk daily in the villages neighboring Bougouni and in Boubouni City. She makes her sales retail (dishes of food) at the market and at home. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used for: investing in her business, covering healthcare costs, and repaying the loan.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Khardiata's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été créé le 16 décembre 2011. Ledit groupe est composé de 22 femmes issues du même quartier elles s'activent dans le petit commerce et le maraîchage.

 Madame khardiata l'emprunteur en vedette est âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 03 filles. Elle fait le commerce de produits d'art qu'elle achète en ville et revend au niveau de son village aux touristes qui viennent dans la zone. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillé en bleu et levé sa main gauche.

 Son prêt lui permettra de développer son activité, de renforcer son épargne et de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' encompassing this group was created on December 16, 2011. The group comprises 22 women from the same district who are active in small-scale commerce and in market gardening. 

Ms. Khardiata, the featured borrower, is 29 years old, married, and the mother of four children, of whom three are girls. She does commerce in art, which she purchases in town and resells in her village to tourists in the area. In the photo, she is the one standing at the right dressed in blue, and her left hand is raised. 

Her loan will enable her to develop her business, bolster her savings, and meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase art

loans.name: Astar's Group

texts.en:
Astar is 32 years old, and a hard-working, independent woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan, with her husband, two daughters and son. All of the children are students. Her husband is a government employee, and his income is insufficient to meet the household expenses. So to help her husband, since 2010 Astar has been running a beauty salon in her house.

She wants to purchase some more cosmetic products like lipsticks, nail polishes, facial creams and makeup kits, for her beauty salon. For that reason, Astar, as a member of a six-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Upon getting a profit, first of all she will repay the loan amount to Kiva, and then she wants to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too congested. She hopes that her business will grow more, and she is very much thankful to both Brac Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 25 years old, single and works as a nurse at a local hospital. His salary is low and not high enough to cover his costs. He has purchased an apartment and is applying for this loan to cover the cost of completing its construction, including installing a kitchen and some decorations. He is requesting a loan for $1,500 from FATEN to cover the costs of this work, which will give him a suitable home and improve his living standards. Here we see Mohammad inside his apartment.

loans.use: to complete construction of his apartment.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school.  She has a business selling yellow bananas and has been in this business for eight years, selling to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. Besides these yellow bananas she also generates additional income through selling onions and tomatoes.  She has applied for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,500,000 from MCDT-SACCO    to buy more bunches of yellow bananas. 

Pauline works six days a week at the market and at home. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of bunches of yellow bananas. She is aspiring of selling only on wholesale and also aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses  include electricity food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of yellow bananas

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, alegre y muy amable, le gusta los retos. Convive con Carlos quien es comerciante, fruto de esa unión tienen 2 hijos, Kelvin de 20 y Dumer de 9 años de edad, viven instalados cómodamente en su propia casa la cual construyeron con mucho esfuerzo.

El negocio que tiene Lilia es un restaurante donde vende desayunos, bebidas heladas entre otros.  Atiende a sus clientes con platos variados de la región como “juanes”. Por el momento alquila el local en el que trabaja pagando un precio cómodo que le permite tener un mayor margen de ganancias. Complementa sus platillos con refrescantes bebidas naturales, gaseosas o cervezas. Lleva más 2 años en ese local atendiendo a sus clientes con el apoyo de su hermana. 
Considera rentable su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas. Recuerda que se inició con la venta de jugos, luego pasó a la venta de comidas en una mesa ambulante hasta que pudo juntar el dinero necesario para alquilar un local cómodo. Viendo el progreso de su negocio tiene deseos de comprar el local que por el momento alquila ya que es una zona comercial, y en el que espera seguir creciendo.  Este es el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP. Por tanto agradece el financiamiento y al confianza que ponen en ella para acceder a su pedido para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues cuenta con su apoyo permanente.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mesas y sillas para mejorar la comodidad de sus clientes, comprará también los víveres e ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
37-year-old Lilia is an enterprising, happy, and very kind woman who likes challenges.  She lives with Carlos who is a merchant, and from this relationship they have two children; 20-year-old Kelvin and 9-year-old Dumer.  They live comfortably in their own home which they built with much effort. 

The business that Lilia has is a restaurant where she offers breakfast, cold drinks, and other items.  She takes care of her customers with assorted dishes from the region, like "juanes".  For the moment she rents the place where she works by paying an affordable price which allows her to have a higher margin of profit.  She complements her plates with refreshing natural drinks, sodas, and beer.  She has spent more than two years at this location, tending to her customers with the help of her sister.

She believes her business is profitable because it has brought her much personal and financial satisfaction.  She remembers that she began her business with the sale of juices, later moving on to the sale of food with a traveling table until she could find the money needed to rent a comfortable place.  Seeing the progress of her business, she has the desire to buy the place that she currently rents because it is in a commercial zone and she hopes to keep growing there.  

This is her third loan with the MFP institution.  Therefore, she is grateful for the financing and the confidence that they have placed in her by accepting her request so that she can accomplish her goals.  On the other hand, she says that she feels good with her communal bank because she has their permanent support.  She will invest the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles in the purchase of tables and chairs to improve the comfort of her customers.  She will also buy the supplies and ingredients that she needs to prepare her meals.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs as well as ingredients that she needs to prepare her food.

loans.name: Maradi

texts.en: Maradi is 30 years old. She is from a small village in the Kvareli district where she lives with her husband and parents. Her mother works as a nurse and earns a monthly income. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 milk cows, a calf, and a horse. They also have a 1-hectare vineyard and 1.3 hectares of agricultural land, where they grow maize. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. Maradi is a very hard-working young woman who has rich experience in her business. She has requested a loan to renovate the family's house. After renovating the house, their living conditions will improve. Maradi awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 35 years old. She is married to Robert and they come from Kakamega County. They have been blessed with two children, ages 12 and 7. 

Ruth sells cereals, a business she has been engaged in for the last four years. She comfortably makes an income of KES 8,700. Ruth is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more cereals for her business. She will use the anticipated profits to start a retail shop and to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to run a successful business and to leave a legacy for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for her business.

loans.name: Sullay

texts.en:
Sullay, aged 34, is married and has two children, aged one and four. In 2007, Sullay established his spare motor parts business which includes tires, brake pads, fan belts, batteries, windscreens, inner tubes, motor oil, etc. He began doing business for his mother when he was a small boy. When he became mature, he started his own business. 

Sullay has a special interest in business because the income he gets from this business is used to provide his family's livelihood.  It is from his business proceeds that he has bought a car and two pieces of land. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Sullay requires a loan in order to buy lift pumps, oil filters, universal joints, and brake kits. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 350,000. 

In the future, Sullay plans to complete his house from the proceeds of the business. By adding to his present capital, he will be able to maximize profits and continue to support his children's education. Increase in the cost of stock is affecting his business and competition is also high, but he offers quality products, so he gains more customers.

loans.use: to pay for spare motor parts for his business, including lift pumps, oil filters, universal joints, and brake kits.

loans.name: Memsu Group

texts.en:
Matina is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in Makeni city, 33 years ago. She is married to an accountant, and the couple has three children, who are attending primary and secondary schools. Matina sells clothes and jewelry. She has been doing this business for eight years. 

With the help of this loan, Matina and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and, consequently, improve upon their living conditions. Matina will use her share of the loan (SLL 1,400,000) to buy a large quantity of clothes and jewelry to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes and jewelry, to add to her current stock

loans.name: Vitali

texts.en:
Vitali is 48 years old. He lives in Zestaponi District with his mother, wife, and a daughter. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Vitali requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is his wife’s salary working as a saleslady at the local grocery store. It makes a total of 250 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Vitali requested loan from Credo to start-up family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. this start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Vitali will purchase a car. After purchasing a car, he will serve the local people as a taxi driver. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car and work as a taxi driver

loans.name: Abdelhaleem

texts.en:
Abdelhaleem is a 29-year-old single man; he lives with his family in Beddya village near Nablus in modest to fair living conditions. His family work in agriculture and the income they get isn't much enough to cover all their needs.

For the past one year, Abdelhaleem has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him. He has a good reputation among his clients because of treating them well. 

Abdelhaleem is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of painting the taxi and making some necessary repairs such as changing the taxi mats and mirrors.

This will improve the taxi's condition and increase Abdelhaleem's income.

Abdelhaleem is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To paint his taxi and make some necessary repairs

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is 55 years old and has earned a living for more than 30 years by weaving baskets in the town of Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. This is her sole source of income, and she is requesting a loan to buy the materials she needs to weave more baskets. This material includes buri, a native palm, thread and straw. This loan will allow her to increase her income and meet her goal of expanding her business and making it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy materials for a basket-weaving business.

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en: Fouzia is 39 years old and a widow who earns a living by working hard as a tailor. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two sons and two daughters. Because her husband has passed away, she is solely responsible for looking after her children, and her sons have had to drop out of school. The tailoring services provided by Fauzia are very popular and people like her work. She is requesting this loan to buy more of the materials she needs, including cloth, needles and reels of threads. Even though her sons have had to drop out of school, her goal for the future is to provide a quality education to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is a 40-year-old man from Kvareli District, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, retired parents, and two children, who go to the local school. 

Gia trades fruits and vegetables. He purchases products from wholesalers once a week and sells them in the local market. Along with the above-mentioned income source, Gia’s wife works at the wine factory and gets a monthly salary. All the family members work hard to make some savings and improve the living conditions of the family. 

With the requested loan, Gia will purchase stocks of vegetables and fruits to expand his trading business and sell them for a profit. That will increase his profit. Gia plans to reinvest part of the profit in the same business and the rest will be used in the family.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Fawade

texts.fr:
Fawade est une femme de 40 ans. Elle est membre de banc villageois depuis quelques années. Elle est divorcée et mère de 03 enfants en charge dont une fille. 
Elle  mène comme activité le petit commerce d'habits. Son crédit lui permettra de s'approvisionner en habitant pour mieux développer son activité et accroître ses bénéfices. 
Elle souhaite, à partir des profits réalisés, prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et investir pour leur réussite.
texts.en: Fawade is a 40-year-old woman. She has been a 'banc villageois' member for a few years. She is divorced and the mother of three children to support, including a girl. Fawade has a small-scale business selling clothing. Her loan will enable her to stock up on clothing for developing her business and growing her profits. With the profits earned, she would like to cover her children's schooling costs and to invest in their success.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Laïdou  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 4 enfants  vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sido,  préfecture de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de charbon de bois, de poissons,  de pâte d’arachide et des articles divers. 
Fanta, qui est la seule assise devant fait de la vente de la pâte d’arachide.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 10 seaux de pâte d’arachide auprès des forains les jours des marchés hebdomadaires de Sido. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 55.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, pour les frais de santé, de nourriture et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the group Laïdou average 40 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in the village of Sido, prefecture of Bougouni. The women know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third loan. This group of women does commerce in charcoal, peanut butter, and a variety of goods.

Fanta, who is the only one seated in front in the photo, sells peanut butter. She intends to use her loan to purchase 10 pails of peanut butter from fair-goers when the weekly markets take place in Sido. She makes her sales retail at the market and from home. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 55,000 francs CFA that will be used for: investing in her business, covering healthcare costs, and paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase peanut butter

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 48 years old, a married woman, and a mother of four children, from Panglao, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 20 years, together with her husband.

Jesusa wants to take a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing materials. With these materials, they will be able to improve their fishing business and catch more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Jesusa hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money, for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing materials

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business of a retail shop, selling all commodities.  

She has applied for a loan of 1,700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, jerrycans of cooking oil and boxes of soap. She has been in this business for six years, selling to all categories of people, but on a retail basis only. Besides this retail shop business, she also hires out her motorcycle to generate additional income. 

She works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda.  She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also buying a plot of land and building her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, jerrycans of cooking oil and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresando Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES PROGRESANDO”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio, productos varios, plantas y masetas, venta de edredones, librería, chicharroneria.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su Tía que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta papa; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, ya que le generaba buena remuneración.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa) que adquirirá de los mercados de la Ciudad de El Alto por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones del área de salud.
texts.en: The "MUJERES PROGRESANDO" (Advancing women) communal bank is about to begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Panamericana.  It is made up of ten members and is led by a board of directors whose treasurer is Sonia.  The businesses run by the communal bank's members are varied and include: cosmetics sales, a local shop, various products, plants and plant pots, duvet sales, book sales and pork crackling sales.  The loan will benefit small microentrepreneurs, one of whom is Sonia. She says that she joined pro Mujer six months ago at the invitation of her aunt who is a member of the organisation.  She currently runs a business selling potatoes and says that she learned the trade on her own initiative as it generated a good income.  The loan which she is now seeking is for capital increase (the purchase of potatoes) which she will buy in bulk from the markets in Ciudad de El Alto and later sell on her stall.  This type of work enables her to generate resources to maintain her home as far as possible, as she is married with two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training on health-related issues.

loans.use: to buy potatoes

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 28-year-old, single man. He lives with his family in Beddya Village, near Nablus.

For the past three years, Issa has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable business and the only source of income for him. He has a lot of loyal clients and, because he is a very ambitious man and has a good reputation among his clients, he is looking, in the future, to open a taxi office of his own.

Issa is requesting a USD 2,000 loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to cover the costs of insuring and licensing the taxi he drives. This will enable Issa to move easily and freely from one area to another, which will help to increase his income and improve his living conditions. Issa is photographed inside his taxi.

loans.use: to pay the costs of insuring and licensing his taxi.

loans.name: Korto

texts.en:
Korto is 40 years old and lives in Ganta, one of the most talked about cities in Nimba County. Nimba County is the second-most populated county in Liberia and is rich in natural resources. Korto is married, and her husband is a businessman. They have three children, ages 5, 8, and 14, who are presently attending school and live at home.

For the past seven years, Korto has been running a shop where she sells rubber dishes (e.g., cups, plates, bowls, spoons, buckets). She makes a lot of profit since she is the only one who sells quality dishes in the local market.

Korto is requesting a loan to purchase dishes (e.g., plates, cups, bowls, spoons, buckets) for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase dishes (e.g., plates, cups, bowls, spoons, buckets) for her business.

loans.name: Jesús Reynaldo

texts.es:
El Señor Jesús Reynaldo vive en un municipio de Managua, es un hombre trabajador, emprendedor y responsable con sus obligaciones labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las siete de la noche, los siete días de la semana en su moto-taxi, el cual ofrece servicio de transporte a los usuarios  de la misma comunidad que lo solicitan.

Solicita el  préstamo a esta  institución para invertir en  la reparación de su casa, lo cual será reforzamiento de paredes y reparación de techo.

este crédito lo invertirá en compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena, hierro, cemento cinz, para su vivienda   de forma que esto le permitirá ir mejorando su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús lives in the municipality of Managua. He is a hardworking, responsible, and enterprising man. With all of his responsibilities, he works in his moto-taxi every day from 6 A.M. until 7 P.M. He offers transportation services to people of the same community.  

He is requesting this loan to invest in home reparation which will consist of reinforcing his walls and repairing his roof. 

He will use this loan to buy construction materials such as sand, iron, cement, etc. so that he will be able to continue improving his and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to improve his housing.

loans.name: Nguermalal Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois abritant ce groupe est créé le 17 mai 2010, Il est composé de trente sept femmes qui se sont unies par amitié habitant le même village et mènent  des activités comme le petit commerce et la couture.

 Madame Anta la responsable est âgée de 47 ans, mariée elle est mère de cinq enfants; elle mène une activité de petit commerce et fait de la couture aussi. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite. 

Elle achéte ses produits (chaussures, habits, parfums, pommades) dans la capitale et revend au niveau de son quartier et au marché. 
Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son commerce afin de se faire un peu plus de revenus. 


Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices renforcer son épargne et soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' which houses this group was created on May 17, 2010. It is composed of 37 women who are united by friendship and living in the same village. Their work includes small-scale commerce and sewing. 

Ms. Anta, the group's official, is 47 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She has a small business and also makes clothing. In the photo, she is the one standing at the right. 

She purchases her goods (shoes, clothing, perfumes, ointments) in the capital and resells them in her neighborhood and at the market. Her loan will enable her to bolster her business in order to make a bit more income. 

She would like to use her profits to boost her savings and to support her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothing, and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Dembagnouma  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 6 enfants  vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Sido,  préfecture de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de mèches et de la préparation vente de beignets. 
Chata, qui est la seule assise devant fait de la vente de beignet à base de mil.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt, 8 sacs de mil auprès des paysans producteurs et 2 bidons d’huile alimentaires auprès des forains les jours des marchés hebdomadaires de Sido. Elle effectue ses ventes de beignets au marché, en ambulant et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, pour les frais de santé, de nourriture et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the group Dembagnouma average 35 years of age and six children each, all living in traditional families in the village of Sido, prefecture of Bougouni. The women know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their eighth loan. This group of women does commerce in hair extensions and in the making and selling of beignets.

Chata, the only one seated in front in the photo, sells beignets made from millet. She intends to use her loan to purchase 8 sacks of millet from peasant producers and 2 containers of cooking oil from fair-goers when the weekly markets take place in Sido. She makes her beignets sales at the retail level at the market, from home, and by going door to door. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 65,000 francs CFA that will be used for: investing in her business, covering healthcare costs, and paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for making and selling beignets

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school/college fees for his children.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en: Victo is the widowed mother of four children, two of whom attend school. She also takes care of additional family members. For the last six years, she has earned a living by working as a tailor and selling her goods on a retail basis. She earns additional income by selling piped water. She sells her goods at a local market, and is applying for a loan for 1,700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of cloth, thread and an electric sewing machine. Her major business challenges include transportation and the seasonal nature of the demand for her products. Her goal for the future is to own a tailoring school and employ two girls to help her with her tailoring work. She resides in her own house where her family has no access to piped water but has electricity. Her major monthly expenses include food and electricity.

loans.use: to buy more materials for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Neema Group

texts.fr: Madame  Muyengo  est présidente  de l’association d’affaire Neema,  âgée de 42 ans, mariée à un enseignant d’une école  primaire, mère de 8 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente vend le sucre en détail au marche centrale de la ville. Elle avait débuté  ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari avant de bénéficier du crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir à acheter 4 sacs  de sucre afin de renforcer son stock. Ainsi, elle remercie l’IMF Hekima et ses partenaires.
texts.en: Ms. Muyengo is the president of the business association Neema. She is 42 years old, married to a primary school teacher, and the mother of eight children, who are all in school. This client sells sugar retail at the city's central market. She had begun her business using funds from her husband and then benefited from a Hekima loan. This new loan will serve her to purchase 4 bags of sugar for bolstering her inventory. So, she thanks the microfinance institution Hekima and its partners.

loans.use: to purchase 4 bags of sugar to sell

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 31 years old. She lives in the small village of Telavi district, East Georgia with her husband, son, and grandparents, who are provided with a retirement pension. Her husband locally works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. 

The family is involved in the dairy business. In particular, they have four milk cows. Marine milks cows and produces different kinds of dairy products and sells locally in an open market, at a good price. She is a very hard-working, young woman and has a rich experience in her business. 

Marine requested a loan to renovate her bathroom. After renovating the bathroom, their living conditions will be improved. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate her bathroom.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.es:
Yasmin tiene 35 años, es madre de 4 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y por los cuales daría la vida con tal de brindarles una vida digna y sobre todo poder ofrecerles todo lo que no pudo tener cuando era niña. La vivienda de Yasmin se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla mucho la agricultura y gracias a ello Yasmin se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente se cultiva algodón, uva, pallares, entre otros. Yasmin trabaja desde muy joven, ya que tuvo la necesidad de apoyar a sus padres debido a los pocos recursos económicos.

Día a día Yasmin trabaja como agricultora, ella trabaja ella le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 9 horas al día; ella cree que le va bien porque es responsable y sobre todo porque le gusta cultivar las plantas.

Yasmin está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, entre otros, con lo cual podrá dar un buen mantenimiento a su cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha, así mejorara sus ingresos y podrá luchar para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y tener otro negocio”.
texts.en:
Yasmin is thirty-five years old.  She has four children, who she loves very much.  She would give her own life for them in order to offer them a life with dignity and above all, to offer them everything that she could not have when she was young.  Yasmin's home is located in the city of Ica, which is characterized by its warm and friendly climate, and its developed agriculture.  Thanks to this, Yasmin makes a living in agriculture, especially in growing cotton, grapes, lima beans, and others.  Yasmin has worked since she was very young; she needed to support her parents since they had few economic resources.

Day to day, Yasmin works as a farmer.  She works for about nine hours a day.  She believes that her work is going well because she is responsible and above all, because she likes to cultivate her plants.

Yasmin is very thankful to the Kiva loaners.  Thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to buy manure, fertilizers, and other items that will allow her to maintain her crops well, and to be able to have a good harvest.  This will improve her income and she will be able to fight to make her greatest dream come true: to give her children a good education and to have another business.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois dont fait partie ce groupe est créé depuis le 12 décembre 2011. ledit groupe est constitué de vingt huit femmes qui habitent le même village et mènent comme activités principales le petit commerce et le mareyage.

Madame Astou l'emprunteur en vedette du groupe est âgée de 29 ans, elle est mariée mère d'une fille; elle mène une activité de commerce de chaussures et sacs avec une bonne expérience de plus de dix ans. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite à l'extrême vêtue en wax multicolore et a levé la main gauche.

Elle achéte ses articles dans les grandes villes pour revendre dans sa localité. 

Son prêt lui servira à acheter des chaussures et sacs pour une valeur de 65000 F afin de se faire plus de revenus.

Avec ses bénéfices elle assure la scolarité de sa fille et aide son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' which houses this group was created on December 12, 2011. It is composed of 28 women who live in the same village. Their main work includes small-scale commerce and selling fish. 

Ms. Astou, the featured borrower of the group, is 29 years old. She is married and the mother of a girl. Ms. Astou has a business selling shoes and handbags with over ten years of good experience. In the photo, she is the one standing at the far right dressed in a multi-colored Wax cloth outfit, and her left hand is raised. 

She purchases her goods in the big cities to resell them in her town. 

Her loan will serve to supply her with shoes and handbags amounting to 65,000 francs CFA, so as to make more income. 

With her profits, she ensures that her daughter's schooling costs are covered, and she helps out her husband in meeting family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and handbags to resell

loans.name: Uaminifu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kyalangala, leader du groupe de credit Uaminifu, est entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans, mariée à un fonctionnaire de l’Etat et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des matériels de construction et  installe ses marchandises au marché central de la ville. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 20 roulos de câble électrique et autres… Son ambition est de scolariser ses enfants et construire une maison d’habitation. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions.
texts.en: This client, Kyalangala, is the leader of the loan group Uaminifu. She is an entrepreneur, 40 years old, married to a civil servant, and the mother of four children, all in school. She is a retailer of construction supplies and equipment and sets up her merchandise at the town's central market. This new loan will serve to provide her with 20 rolls of electrical cable and more… Her ambition is to educate her children and build a house. This client thanks Hekima for its actions.

loans.use: to purchase 20 rolls of electrical cable and more

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher, now 58 years old, is from Ngiya in Siaya County which is located in the western part of Kenya. She has been selling assorted dry cereals and the business is doing great. For now she supports two grandchildren in school.

Jenipher sells cereals, she has been doing this business for the last 12 years and makes a monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is taking her third loan with KADET Ltd. which she will use to buy more stock of maize for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her two grandchildren.

She dreams of leaving a legacy for her children and her grandsons too.

loans.use: To buy maize to add to her stock

loans.name: P.aleson

texts.en:
P. Aleson is 42 years old and lives in Ganta, one of the most talked-about cities in Nimba County, which is the second largest population county in Liberia and is rich in natural resources. He is a high school graduate, married, and his wife is a businesswoman. They have three children ages 2, 8, and 14 who are presently attending school. 

For the past seven years he has been running a local club where he sells beer, gin, Malta, soft drinks, etc. He spends 9 hours on his business, which he started by selling on a table in a market with a little money that he received from his father. One problem he faces is low income. He is requesting a loan to purchase more beer, gin, Malta, soft drinks etc. for his business. His plans are to build a house for his children and educate them.

loans.use: to purchase more beer, gin, Malta, soft drinks etc for his business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 61-year-old Hawa. She is married, and has four children aged 41, 36, 30 and 23 years old. In 1992, Hawa established her clothing business. She began her business because her parents wouldn't allow their female child to attend school. She was handed in marriage at 15 years old to a businessman who introduced her to business.

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,700,000 Leones (SLL) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Hawa has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy lace material and wax cotton. In the future, Hawa plans to acquire a shop, and also engage in agriculture activity. This loan will help her to achieve her future plans. She is a hardworking businesswoman. ARD has helped her to improve her business greatly. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy lace material and wax cotton for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to renew her sewing and tailoring work area.

loans.name: Karo

texts.en:
Karo is involved in agriculture. He keeps 15 cows, 10 turkeys and chickens. He also maintains an orchard, where apricot, apple, cherry and pear trees grow.
 
Karo is a 52-year-old man, who lives in Vosketap village. As agriculture is the only source of income for Karo, he would like to expand it. He has requested this loan to purchase onion seeds and forage for feeding the livestock, and to renovate the greenhouse. Starting cultivation of onions will give him an opportunity to sell them in the local market and earn more income. But Karo's greenhouse is too old and needs to be renovated. The loan is very important for Karo to expand his agricultural business and get more income.

loans.use: to pay for onion seeds, forage for feeding the livestock and renovation of the greehouse

loans.name: Eduardo Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo Pedro esta casado tiene 35 años de edad, curso los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos 3 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a la construcción de viviendas, inicio este trabajo siendo ayudante de albañil y hasta el momento lleva 18 años de experiencia, cuenta con  el apoyo de su esposa quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.
