Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de herramientas de trabajo, ya que actualmente le hacen falta algunas herramientas, necesarias para desempeñarse bien, compra de compra de herramientas eléctricas, espera seguir mejorando su trabajo, en el futuro quiere tener una casa constructora.
texts.en:
Eduardo Pedro is married, 35 years old, and completed three years of primary education. He has five children, three of whom are students. 

He makes a living building houses. He began doing this work as an assistant bricklayer and has now been doing it for 18 years. He has the support of his wife who makes a living doing housekeeping.

He is requesting a loan to use for buying work tools, since he is currently lacking some tools that are necessary to perform well. He would like to buy electrical tools. He hopes to continue improving his work. In the future he wants to have a construction firm.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 38 years old; she is married, with three children between the ages of 16 and 24. The children are presently attending school, and all of them live in the capital city (Buchanan) in Ground Bassa County.  This place is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market.  

Mamie is a high school graduate, and has been selling fashion clothes in the local market for the past nine years. She uses a taxi to get her goods from the wholesales center; she really face a problem during the rainy season. 

She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of fashion clothing before the rainy season. Her dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of fashion clothing before the rainy season.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Tièssiri  qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 4 enfants vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur premier prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de cosmétiques, de charbon de bois, des savons et des articles divers. 
Ramatou, qui est la seule assise devant fait de l’achat vente de savons et des articles divers. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt,  5 sacs de savons traditionnels,  5 cartons de savons moderne  auprès des grossistes de la ville de Bougouni et à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités, pour les frais de santé et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The members of the group Tièssiri average 33 years of age and four children each, all living in traditional families in the Heremakono Nord district of Bougouni City. The women know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity, so as to do better business, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first loan. This group of women does commerce in cosmetics, charcoal, soaps, and a variety of goods.

Ramatou, the only one seated in front in the photo, buys and sells soaps and a variety of goods. She intends to use her loan to purchase 5 sacks of traditional soaps and 5 boxes of modern soaps from wholesalers in Bougouni City and in Bamako. She makes her sales retail at the market and from home. She accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of men and women. 

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 22,000 francs CFA that will be used for: investing in her business, covering healthcare costs, and paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase soap

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of eleven children from Cortes, Bohol. She has been engaged in a basket-weaving business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Evangeline wants to apply for a loan to buy piglets and feed. She wants to start a hog raising business and at the same time continue her weaving ventures. Evangeline hopes to make her business a success and save money for the continued schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Magatte  Asta Lompoul Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 16 décembre 2011, il regroupe vingt deux femmes qui sont sont du même village, elles mènent diverses activités le petit commerce, l'artisanat, l'élevage et l'agriculture.


Fatou, l'emprunteur en vedette, est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants, elle mène une activité d'agriculture et d'embouche ovine. Elle est debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo et a levé la main gauche. 


Son prêt lui servira d'acheter 06 chèvres et des semences afin de gagner beaucoup de revenus. 


Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 16, 2011. It comprises 22 women from the same village. They have diverse work, such as small-scale commerce, arts and crafts, raising livestock, and farming.

Fatou, the featured borrower, is 46 years old. She is a married mother of six children. She has a business involving farming and the fattening of sheep. Ms. Fatou is the one standing at the far right in the photo with her left hand raised. 

Her loan will serve to purchase 6 goats and some seeds for her to earn much more income. 

She would like to use her profits to help out her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase goats and some seeds

loans.name: Rufus K.

texts.en:
Rufus is 45 years old and lives in Ganta city, one of the most talked-about cities in Nimba County. It is the second largest population county in Liberia and rich in natural resources. 

Rufus is married, with three children ages 6, 8, and 23, all of whom live at home and attend school. For the past 10 years he has been running a general shop. He has requested this loan to purchase more biscuit, batteries, butter, soap, oil, rice, toothpaste, milk etc., in other to have his business turn into a bigger one. 

The problem he's faced with is small capital. He started this business by selling for his father on a table at the market and learned this from friends. What he likes about this business is that he meets new people and makes profit every day; it makes him proud of having money in his home every day. He spends eight hours on his business every day, and uses a bus to get his goods from the wholesale center. In the future he wants to open another shop in the next community.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuit, batteries, butter, soap, oil, rice, toothpaste, milk etc.

loans.name: Yunis

texts.en:
Yunis is 41 years old. She is married to Opinde. They have been blessed with two children, ages 22 and 20. 

Yunis has been selling cereals in the market for the last 13 years. She makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD to buy more cereals for sale. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and pay back the loan.

In the future, Yunis hopes to become a leading cereals supplier in the region.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for sale.

loans.name: Asienzo Moini

texts.en:
Asienzo is a 40-year-old businesswoman who lives in Nimule. She is married and has five children between the ages of 3 and 15. All of them go to school.

Asienzo runs a store and has been in business for seven years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. She is taking a loan of 2,000 SSP to purchase beer, sodas and other items. In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years, Asienzo would like to expand her business. Her major challenges are the high prices in the market.

Asienzo says she is grateful for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more items such as beer, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz is 51 years old. He is from the village of Dighomi, and lives with his wife. Tamaz's wife works as a nurse at the hospital and gets a small monthly salary. 

Tamaz is an artisan, and renovates houses in his village and the capital city. Both family members work hard, but they still don’t have enough income to have some savings and improve their living conditions. 

Tamaz is requesting a loan to purchase a milking cow. He will be able to produce and sell cheese. 

Tamaz wants to expand his business in order to earn a good profit. With the increased profit, he will be able to reinvest in his agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs. As a result, the living conditions for the family will improve. 

Tamaz is a very hard-working person, with a rich experience in his work.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Laila's Group

texts.en:
Laila is a 36-year-old, Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Laila is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home. She is using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. She owns and operates a small, home-based, sewing and tailoring business.

She has 15 years' experience working with customers, creating custom-made dresses for women and children, and other small, fabric, household items. To have a better work environment, she would like to renew her work area, which is in great need of painting and renovation. She took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq, to enable her to pay for the work. 

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor, who are therefore unable to qualify for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for her protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area, which is in great need of painting and renovation

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a 35-year-old lady; she has been married for the past ten years.  Linet has been selling cereals, and gets a monthly income of KES. 7,650. She has good credit history with KADET LTD. 

She is taking her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase more cereals for her stock of maize, beans, and green grams (a type of beans).  She will put the anticipated profit back into the business.

Her dream is to educate her children, and run a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, and greengrams (a type of bean)

loans.name: Marietha

texts.en:
Marietha lives in Buchanan Ground Bassa County, a place that is good at producing fish on the Liberian local market.  She is 27 years old, single and has two children, ages 2 and 5.  All of them live at home, and the children attend school. 

For the past eight years, she has been selling slippers, blouses, and fabric in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother; she is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers, blouses, and fabric to expand her business. 

In the future, she wants to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers, blouses, and fabric to expand her business.

loans.name: Jestina

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Jestina. She is married and has five children, aged 20, 17, 14, 11 and 8 years. 

In 1997, Jestina established her patient medicine business to assist her husband in the running of the home. She went through training at the Nixiou Hospital in Segbwema. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about 2,240,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month. 

Jestina would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. She has already received and successfully repaid loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more pharmaceuticals. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. 

In the future, Jestina plans to own a modern pharmacy and to establish a branch in Pujehun, her hometown. She also hopes that the loan will increase her stock and capital. One challenge she faces is the proliferation of fake drugs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceuticals.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Abdul. He is married and has four children, aged 21, 17, 15 and 11; all are schooling. 

In 2001, Abdul established his drinks business. He began his business because he wanted to generate enough funds to support his children's education; it is his only source of income. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 700,000 (Sierra Leone Leone) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy Star beer, stout, Vicco malt, cane soft and bottle soft (all are different types of drinks). 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 320,000. In the future, Abdul plans to become a distributor for a brewery, to educate his children and to develop his other plot of land. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks.

loans.name: Yesmi Yolani

texts.es: Yesmi, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Yesmi es muy emprendedora, hace tres años inicio su propia actividad de negocio. Vende variedad de perfumes, lociones, cremas, maquillajes y otros cosméticos que le solicitan sus clientes. Las ventas las realiza en su casa y de manera ambulante. Además vende desinfectantes según pedidos del cliente. Lleva tres ciclos de préstamos en ODEF para mantener el negocio. El préstamo actual es por 5,000 Lempiras y va comprar perfumes, maquillajes y desinfectantes para vender y aumentar los ingresos. Su plan es que el negocio crezca y poder aportar ingresos a su familia.
texts.en: Yesmi, 23, is single living with her parents in a village belonging to the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  She’s very enterprising and three years ago started her own business venture.  She sells a variety of perfumes, lotions, creams, make-up and other cosmetics her customers request.  She sells from place to place and also at home.  She also sells disinfectant to customer order.  She’s been in three ODEF loan cycles to stay in business.  The current loan is for 5,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy perfume, make-up and disinfectant to sell and increase income.  Her plan is that the business grows and to be able to contribute family income.

loans.use: Compra de perfumes, maquillajes y tambien desinfectantes para la venta.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia, de 43 años  de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de progresar. Es soltera pero tiene 2 hijos de 24 y 22 años de edad y junto a ellos vive cómodamente en su casa propia que obtuvo cuando vivía con su conviviente.
La actividad que realiza Zonia es la crianza de pollos y la guardianía de una casa que está a su cuidado, ahí tiene una granja  con capacidad de 400 pollos, los cría y luego los vende cuando han alcanzado el promedio de peso ideal para el consumo. Desarrolla esta función desde hace 5 años, trabaja sola y le va muy bien. Eventualmente vende gaseosas y golosinas cerca de un lugar deportivo.
Considera rentable su negocio pues le genera el ingreso económico necesario para pagar los gastos de su hogar como alimentación, vestido y otros. Eligió este trabajo por la experiencia que tenía, ya que en su juventud trabajó de la misma manera con la ayuda de su vecina en ese entonces. Ahora tiene su negocio en marcha y tiene muchas ganas de seguir creciendo, reinvirtiendo sus ganancias buscando ampliar su galpón donde pueda criar un mayor numero de pollos.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en compra de 150 pollos bebé y  materiales para implementar su galpón como bebederos, comederos de pollos, así como  alimentos balanceados en mayor volumen.
texts.en:
Zonia, 43, is a hard-working and earnest woman who is eager to progress. She is single but has two children, ages 24 and 22, and she lives comfortably with them in her own house that she obtained when she lived with her partner.

Zonia makes a living raising chickens and as the guardian of a house that is in her care. There she has a farm with the capacity to handle 400 chickens. She raises them and then sells them when they have reached the average ideal weight for consumption. She has done this job over the last five years. She works alone and it is going well for her. Occasionally, she sells sodas and candies near a sports venue.

She considers her business profitable since it generates the income necessary to pay for her home expenses such as food, clothing, etc. She chose this work because of the experience she had, since in her youth she did the same work with the help of her neighbor at the time. Now she has her business under way and she is eager to continue growing, reinvesting her earnings and expanding her shed so she can raise a larger number of chickens. 

With the 1500 nuevos soles requested, she will invest in the purchase of 150 baby chickens and the material to supply her shed, such as water feeders, feeders, and balanced feed in large volume.

loans.use: to buy water feeders and feeders for chickens, as well as balanced feed in large volume

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia, de 35 años, es una mujer amable y buena, es madre soltera de dos niños de 14 y 9 años con quienes vive en su casa propia que consiguió con mucho esfuerzo al lado de su ex cónyuge, día a día pone su mayor esfuerzo para hacer las cosas bien por el bien de sus hijos que dependen de ella para poder tener una buena educación y mejorar su calidad de vida.
El trabajo de Amalia, consiste en la venta de cosméticos y productos de aseo personal, vende todo tipo de artículos mediante el sistema de venta por catálogo, tiene un espacio de exhibición en su casa en donde llegan sus clientes en busca de perfumes, talcos, cremas o algún accesorio de utilidad. Lleva en ésta actividad desde hace 8 años, trabaja sola y gana muy bien, anteriormente alternaba este trabajo con otros negocios como la venta de jugos o la venta de prendas de vestir que no le han dado buenos resultados y tuvo que dejar esas actividades, a pesar de ello no desiste y ahora ha visto la oportunidad de construir locales o establecimientos para negocio y alquilarlos para asegurar sus ingresos mensuales, tiene un terreno disponible y desea sacarle provecho. Actualmente está en la ejecución y construcción de los mismos y espera que hasta ahí lleguen personas interesadas para alquilarlos lo más pronto posible y empezar a obtener los ingresos que requiere por la inversión que está haciendo. 
Por lo pronto, continúa trabajando en la venta de cosméticos y le gusta lo que hace, asegura sus ganancias con los clientes que ya ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años, está muy contenta por la independencia que tiene y porque puede generar ella misma sus propios ingresos para solventar los gastos necesarios en su hogar, espera seguir trabajando y expandir su negocio para continuar progresando ya que desea brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de acceder a una educación de calidad a través de una carrera profesional.
Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, por lo cual agradece a quienes hacen posible su financiamiento para continuar en el camino del cumplimiento de sus metas, del mismo modo se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad, se siente muy tranquila trabajando al lado de los integrantes de su banco comunal ya que todos sus miembros son muy buenos y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará perfumes, talcos, cremas de piel, aretes, cosméticos, acondicionadores y otros productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amalia, 35 years old, is a friendly and good woman.  She is a single mother to two children, 14 and 19 years, with whom she lives in her own house, which she got with a lot of effort at the side of her ex-husband.  Day after day, she puts forth her best effort to do things well for the good of her children, who depend on her to have a good education and to improve their quality of life.

Amalia's work consists of selling cosmetics and personal hygiene products.  She sells all types of items through catalog sales.  She has a display area in her house, where her customers come in search of perfumes, talcs, creams or some useful accessory.  She has been doing this activity for 8 years.  She works alone and earns very well.  

Previously, she alternated this type of work with other businesses such as selling juices or selling clothing, but they didn't give her good results and she had to stop doing them.  In spite of this, she doesn't give up and now she sees the opportunity to build stores or business establishments and rent them to ensure her monthly income.  She has a piece of land available and wants to take advantage of it. She is currently in execution and construction, and hopes that interested people will arrive to rent them as soon as possible, so that she can begin to get the income she needs for the investment she is making.

For now, she continues to work selling cosmetics and likes what she does.  She ensures her earnings with the customers she has been able to establish over the years.  She is very happy with the independence she has and because she can generate her own income herself to pay the necessary household expenses.  She hopes to continue working and expand her business in order to continue progressing, as she would like to offer her children the opportunity to access a quality education through a professional degree.

This is her second loan with MFP, for which she thanks those who make her financing possible, so that she can continue on the path of accomplishing her goals.  In the same way, she commits very responsibly to making her payments on time.  She feels very comfortable working alongside the members of her communal bank, since all the members are very good and supportive.

With the requested amount of 1500 soles, she will buy perfumes, talcs, skin creams, earrings, cosmetics, conditioners and other products to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, talcs, skin creams, earrings, cosmetics, conditioners and other products to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Elisma

texts.es: Elisma, tiene 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Elisma decidió hace 5 años a dedicarse al comercio, para vender ropa variada como jean, camisas, pantalones, sabanas, y otras, también cosméticos, perfumes y cremas. Ella vende de manera ambulante por pedidos y en su casa. Ha sido cliente de ODEF por tres ciclos, actualmente solicita otro préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para comprar mas mercadería como ropa y cosméticos para surtir y vender. Tiene como meta ofrecer más y mejores productos para hacer crecer el negocio y poder hacerle mejoras a su vivienda en el futuro.
texts.en: Elisma, 37, is married and has two children.  She lives in a village belonging to the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  Elisma decided five years ago to go into commerce and sell assorted clothes like jeans, shirts, pants, sheets and others; she also sells cosmetics, perfume and creams.  She sells from place to place on order and at home. She’s been an ODEF client for three cycles and is currently asking for a 20,000 Lempira loan to buy more merchandise like clothes and cosmetics to stock up on and sell.  Her goal is to offer more and better products to make the business grow and in future be able to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Susy

texts.en:
Susy is 54 years old and lives in Majengo, in Kakamega county. She is a widow and was left with three children, who are now aged 20, 23 and 24 years.

Susy operates a firewood store. She has been doing this business for the past six years, since the departure of her spouse. This is the main source of income for her entire family. She earns a monthly income of KES 40,000, 

She is applying for her third loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to add to her stock of firewood. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. She hopes to become a successful business lady in the region.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood for sale

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 41, married, and has five children between the ages of 16 and 28. They all live in the capital city (Buchanan) of Ground Bassa County. This area is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market.

For the past 18 years, she has been making and selling local soap, for the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her husband. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and caustic to expand her soap-making capacity. She wants to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, and caustic to expand her business.

loans.name: Jibu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mamy est  la présidente  du groupe de crédit Jibu, courageuse et ambitieuse, elle est  âgée de 35 ans, mère de 6 enfants, mariée à un homme sans emploi. Commerçante ambulante, elle vend  des cannes à sucre dans la ville de bukavu. Elle débuta son commerce avec le fonds qu’elle avait reçu de son père il yva plus de 5ans. Cependant, ce nouveau crédit  va  lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  200 tiges de canne à sucre afin de renforcer son business. A la longue, elle souhaite devenir grossiste et ainsi elle remercie Hekima pour son appui.
texts.en: This client, by the name of Mamy, is the leader of the Jibu loan group. Courageous and ambitious, she is 35 years old, has six children and is married to a man who’s unemployed. She works as a street vendor selling sugar cane in the town of Bukavu. She launched her business with the funds received from her father over five years ago. This new loan will allow her to buy 200 stalks of sugar cane in older to bolster her business. Her long-term goal is to become a wholesaler. She thanks Hekima for its support.

loans.use: to buy 200 stalks of sugar cane.

loans.name: Sinneh

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Sinneh. He is married and has one child, age 14. In 1990, Sinneh established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant, after spending most of his time in the mines. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,641,000 every month from his business.

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Sinneh has already received and successfully repaid three loans. Now he requires a new loan, in order to buy additional used clothing. He hopes that this loan will strengthen his trading in clothes. Sinneh plans to open a fish-selling business at the central market, in the future. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional bales of used clothing for resale

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and has one child, and that child goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives). She has a business of tailoring and has been in this business for 16 years. She generates additional income owning a pay phone.

Evelyn has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO, to buy more rolls of clothing material and thread. She sells at both wholesale and retail. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

She is aspiring to own a tailoring school, and also to employ two girls to assist her in sewing. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, medication and electricity.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing material and thread.

loans.name: Vardges

texts.en:
Vardges lives in Shirak town with his wife and two children (in the photo). About four years ago, he started his retail business. He trades in soft drinks and sweet sticks and chips. Due to his kind attitude toward clients, his shop is in demand and he has a lot of loyal clients.  

Now he needs to do some investments in the shop in order to satisfy current market demand. So, Vardges has applied for this loan to purchase supplies for his shop. 

Vardges hopes that this will enable him to meet his clients’ needs and gather a higher income, which will enable him to ensure a better future for his children.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for the shop.

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Jariatu is 43 years old and married with three children who are 9, 13 and 16 years old.  In 2005, Jariatu established her assorted drinks business.  She started the business to help her husband support their family.  Working six days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 850,000 every month. 

Jariatu requests a Le 5,000,000 loan. She has received and successfully repaid two loans. She needs the new loan to buy more assorted drinks to sell. Jariatu hopes this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. 

In the future, Jariatu plans to educate her children to the university level. She is very determined and hardworking.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase crates of assorted drinks for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 43 años, es una mujer amable, buena y emprendedora, ha sacado adelante a sus cuatro hijos de 27, 24, 19 y 16 años, todos ya son grandes y están estudiando, viven en su casa propia compartiendo el deseo y las ganas por salir adelante y mejor día a día su condición de vida.
El trabajo de María consiste en la venta de pescado fresco, todos los días se dirige al puerto pesquero de la ciudad para adquirir los pescados al por mayor, luego ella se encarga de distribuirlos por especies y tamaños, finalmente los pone a la venta por kilos llegando muchas veces a triplicar su inversión inicial. Tiene su puesto en el mercado, ahí vende toda la mañana, alguna veces por las tardes regresa a su casa llevando lo que le sobra para venderlos ahí mientras realiza algunas funciones del hogar. Trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo de 27 años, ella se encarga de vender los pescados luego de obtenerlos de sus proveedores ya establecidos, sus clientes varían entre los compradores eventuales y comerciantes de pescado de la ciudad. Lleva cerca de 24 años en este negocio y lo conoce a la perfección y se convirtió en una excelente administradora de su trabajo y siempre recibe buenas ganancias por ello.
Le gusta lo que hace, tiene buenos ingresos que le ayudan a continuar solventando los gastos de su familia, desea seguir trabajando igual y más adelante obtener un puesto de ventas más grande y un bote de pesca para que se abastezca por sí misma de su principal producto de trabajo.
Este es su crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias entre sí.
El monto solicitado (S/. 500) lo invertirá en la compra de pescados de las especies más solicitadas.
texts.en:
María, 43 years old, is a kind, good, and enterprising woman. She has brought up her four children who are 27, 24, 19 and 16 years old. All of them are grown and studying. They live in their own home sharing the desire and eagerness of getting ahead and improving their day to day quality of life.

María’s work is selling fresh fish. Every day she goes to the fishing harbor in the city to buy fish at wholesale. Later she sorts them by type and size, and finally she sells them per kilo and many times she is able to triple her initial investment. She has a stand in the market, and there she sells all morning, and sometimes returning home in the afternoon she takes what is left to sell while she does some household chores.

She works with the help of her 27 year old son. She is in charge of selling the fish after getting them from the established suppliers. Her customers range from people passing by to fishmongers. She has been in this business about 24 years and she knows it well and she has become an excellent woman manager in her work, always making a good income from it.

She likes what she does. She has good income which helps her continue paying the household expenses. She wants to continue working and later she hopes to obtain a bigger sales stall and a fishing boat so she can supply herself with the product she sells.

This is her second loan through MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity and confidence they put in her to grant a loan, and she promises to complete her payments in a punctual manner. Furthermore, she likes being a part of the communal bank that she belongs to because the members are responsible and supportive of each other.

She will invest the 500 soles in the purchase of fish of the kind most sought after.

loans.use: to buy the kind of fish most sought after

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 41 years old, she is married, and she has five children between the ages of  8 and 14 years. They all live in Buchanan, a city in Ground Bassa County that is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. She was not fortunate enough to attend school, but she is good at managing a business. She has been running a shop, where she sells foodstuffs like rice, biscuits, vita, candy, oil and pepper, for the past 24 years. She learned this way of selling from her mother.

Sarah is requesting a loan to purchase inventory for her business. She likes her business, because she has more customers and her daily savings amount is high. Her plans are to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs, like rice, biscuits, and oil, to resell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 29 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 3 and 10 years old. They all live in Buchanan in Ground Bassa County, which is good for producing fish on the Liberian local market. 

Emma was unable to attend school, and she has been selling fish for the past eight years in the local market. She learned this way of selling from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. 

Emma likes her business because she makes more profit every day.  Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 42 years old, married, and supports his three children aged between eight and 14 years old. He is in dairy farming with a monthly income of KES 17,500.  

He has borrowed a sixth loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase materials for construction of a dairy shed in his farm.  

The profits he earns will be used to educate his school-going children and add more livestock.His dream is to excel in his dairy farming and educate his children to greater levels.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for construction of a dairy shed

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Mohamed. He is married and his spouse is a trader whose income is 200,000 SLL every month. He has one child, aged 4 months.   

In 2006, Mohamed inherited his electronics business. He began his business because he lost his father when he was in form III/grade 10. His elder brother asked him to assist him doing business. After a year, his elder brother died and he took over the business.  

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 1,368,000 SLL every month from this business.   

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now he requires a new loan in order to purchase the following: tapes recorder, flash drives, radios and batteries. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 250,000 SLL.  

In the future, Mohamed plans to build a house and educate his child. His feeling about taking this loan is that he can get more income and business will grow. This loan will help him to achieve his future plans. He serves 15 customers each day.  His business is popular because of his good customer care. He is hard-working and trustworthy. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his electronics business.

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Mbalu is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five children who range in age from 7 to 22 years. In 2007, she went into the business of selling food items, such as oil, salt, mayonnaise, butter, flour, milk, eggs and sugar. She began this business because her parents did not send her to school, and instead had her work with her mother. Now she has a business of her own, works 7 days a week, 11 hours a day, and earns about SLL 800,000 a month.

She is requesting a loan of SLL 4,000,000 to buy more food items to sell to her customers, including cake flour, sugar, couscous, salt, shrimp and luncheon meats. Mbalu plans to open a large store in the future, so she can earn enough money to provide her children with a higher education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 39-year-old lady from Kisumu county. She is a widow and has two children, who are 13 and 15 years old.

Susan has been selling second-hand clothes for the past 10 years, and her monthly income is KES 7,000, She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of clothes for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to provide for her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of used clothes for resale

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 35 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 8 and 19. They all live in Buchanan Ground, Bassa County. The area is a good fish producer on the Liberian local market. 

Theresa was unfortunate at attending school, but she is good at managing business. She has been involved in the sales of palm oil, rice by the cup, and pepper, at the local market and she learned this way of selling from her friends.

Theresa is requesting a loan to purchase palm oil, rice by the cup, and pepper for her business. She likes her business because it helps her to save money. Her plans are to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, rice by the cup, and pepper for her business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina, de 51 años, es una mujer buena, honesta y muy amable, es conviviente durante muchos años con su pareja y tiene 3 hijos que estudian en la universidad, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia y es por ellos por quienes sigue adelante y trabajando arduamente. 
La actividad principal de Carolina consiste en la venta de diversos productos alimenticios que ella misma se encarga de preparar diariamente. Ofrece a la venta “cecina”, “chorizos”, “paté” y otros productos derivados del cerdo, asimismo prepara juanes”, “humitas de maíz” y tamales. Ella posee éste gran don culinario y es conocida como una de las mujeres que tiene la sazón más exquisita en la ciudad. Tiene un puesto de ventas estratégicamente ubicado en el mercado principal de la localidad en que vive. Aún recuerda con nostalgia pero con mucho orgullo como se inició en éste trabajo hace 25 años y ha visto con el paso del tiempo que su esfuerzo y constancia por consolidarse en el mercado laboral le ha dado frutos y logros que ahora puede disfrutar.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es preparar sus potajes, disfrutar de los aromas y sabores y saber que sus fieles comensales disfrutan de cada platillo que ofrece, además se siente orgullosa porque su única hija mujer está siguiéndole los pasos en esta actividad además de formarse como una profesional. Espera continuar progresando implementarlo su puesto con otros productos alimenticios. Este es el crédito número 1 con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado está muy comprometida a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos, amables y solidarios.
Con los S/.500 solicitados, comprará ingredientes que utiliza a diario para preparar los alimentos que vende como arroz, condimentos, aceite y otros.
texts.en:
Carolina, 51, is a good, honest, very kind woman living with her spouse of many years; she has three children attending university and lives in her own house with her family.  She continues working hard and moving forward for them.

Carolina’s main activity consists in selling various food items she prepares herself daily.  She sells cured meat, sausages, paté and other products derived from pork.  She also makes ‘juanes’ [similar to a tamale, except made with rice, spices, a stuffing, and wrapped in the the leaf of the bijao. The stuffing can be fish, chicken, or even simply manioc], corn 'humitas' [prepared with fresh corn combined with lard and salt and queso fresco for a savory dish or with fresh corn with lard, sugar, cinnamon and raisins for a sweet dish] and tamales.  She’s a very skilled cook and is known as one of the women with the tastiest food in the city.  She has a strategically located sales stand in the main market in the place where she lives.  She still remembers nostalgically but very proudly how she started in this business 25 years ago and has seen with the passage of time that her effort and perseverance to become consolidated in the marketplace has led to fruits and accomplishments she can now enjoy.  What she likes best about her work is preparing her dishes enjoying their aroma and flavor knowing that her regular diners will enjoy every dish she offers.  She also feels proud because her only daughter is following in her footsteps in this activity in addition to training to become a professional.

She hopes to continue making progress adding more food items to her stand.  This will be MFP loan #1 and she’s grateful to those who make her loan possible so she can continue towards her objectives.  On the other hand, she’s very committed to making her payments punctually.  She’s very happy to belong to her communal bank because all the members are very good, kind and mutually supportive.  She will use the requested 500 soles to buy ingredients like rice, condiment, oil, etc. she uses every day to prepare the meals.

loans.use: to buy ingredients she uses daily.

loans.name: Revelacion En Dios Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Revelación en Dios está conformado por 8 integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón padres de familia responsables de 20 hijos menores de edad. Ellos son originarios de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Martha es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad del banco y de los pagos en tiempo y forma. La actividad de  Martha es vender cuajada de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. La rutina de Martha es trabajar unas 8 horas diarias, bajo el sol, con un peso de unos 20 kg  cargando una pana y ofreciendo sus cuajadas, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto porque ha sido su medio de trabajo y su forma de obtener ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cuajada para que en un futuro no muy lejano obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Revelación de Dios agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Revelación en Dios" is made up of 8 members, 7 women and man, parents who are responsible for 20 young children. 

They are from León, which is in the east of the country.

Martha is the co-ordinator of the communal bank, which means she is in charge of the bank and ensuring that payments are made correctly and on time. Martha is sells curd as a travelling salesperson, as well as from her home. She works for 8 hours a day, under the hot sun, carrying 20kg and selling her curd. She works with pleasure as her work allows her to make money. 

The loan is intended to invest in working capital and stocking her business with curd so that in a not to distant future she can make a better income. The communal bank "Revelación en Dios" is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders offer to people with few resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a means of honest work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up on curd to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hasfa

texts.en: Hasfa is married and has four children. All her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal, which she has been doing for six years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income by rearing chickens. She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality, and defaulters. She aspires to become a wholesaler and to build rooms that she can rent out. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because she wanted additional capital. She lives in her own house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Charles

texts.es:
Charles, de 36 años es un hombre forjador, optimista y muy trabajador, lleva una relación de convivencia por más de 10 años, producto del fruto de su amor tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 13 años quienes son su razón de vivir y su principal motivo para esforzarse día a día por mejorar sus condiciones de vida, viven en una casa propia que pudo edificar gracias al resultado de su trabajo, ahí comparten juntos la alegría de ser una familia con deseos de progresar.
El trabajo de Charles consiste en realizar todo tipo de trabajos de torno y soldadura en motores, vehículos u otros, su público es muy variado y cuenta con una amplia cartera de clientes conformado por personas naturales e instituciones públicas y privadas que le han ayudado a consolidarse en el mercado laboral. Tiene un taller que ha establecido en su casa. Trabaja con ayuda de tres personas y lleva en éste negocio cerca de 14 años, la exigencia que su clientela le pide lo ha incentivado siempre a hacer un buen trabajo y continuar mejorando en las cosas que hace. Atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.

Le gusta mucho lo que hace porque le permite trabajar en lo que es su pasión desde muy niño, las oportunidades que éste trabajo le brinda y las satisfacciones que le otorga todos los días ha hecho que se sienta cada vez más seguro y contento por haber puesto su esfuerzo en ésta actividad. Espera pronto poner su propio taller de soldadura y trabajar con mayor esmero dando siempre lo mejor de sí para continuar haciendo un trabajo de calidad.
Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en él para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual, además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1000) comprará dos latas de soldadura.
texts.en:
Charles, 36, is a very hardworking, optimistic forger.  He’s been in a relationship for more than 10 years and has two children who are 9 and 13 years old who are his reason for living and main motivators to strive daily to improve their quality of life.  They all live together in his own house that he succeeded in building as a result of his work.  They share the joys of being a family and of making progress there.

Charles’ work consists in doing all types of lathe work and welding motors, cars and others.  His public is very varied and he has an extensive clientele made up of individuals and of both public and private institutions that have helped him become established in the labor market.  He has a workshop at home and works with the help of three people.  He’s been in this business for about 14 years.  His customers’ demands have motivated him to always do good work and to continue improving in what he does.  He’s open from 8 in the morning until 8 at night.

He likes what he does very much because it allows him to work in what he’s been passionate about since he was a boy.  The opportunities this job provides him and the satisfaction he gets from it every day have led him to feel more confident and happy every time to have put his efforts into this activity.  He hopes soon to open a welding shop and to work even harder giving the best of himself always to continue doing quality work.

This is MFP loan #2 and he’s grateful for the opportunity and the trust placed in him in order to be eligible for this loan.  On the other hand, he commits to make his payments punctually.  He is happy to be part of the communal bank he belongs to because he’s seen that the members are responsible, supportive people.  He will use the requested 1,000 soles to buy two cans of solder.

loans.use: to buy two cans of solder.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a woman of 43 years and a mother of two children. She lives in Zambezi, on the outskirts of Limuru. She operates a food stall in the same area and has been in this business for two years now. Lucy gets a monthly income of KES 32,000.

This will be Lucy's first loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). She plans to use the entire loan to buy cereals, like beans, maize, sugar, and flour. In the future, she wants to open a restaurant in the same area.

loans.use: to buy cereals for her food stall.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es: Digna aprovechará la tempórada escolar para vender mucha mercancia ajustada a esta época, pues los padres de familia del barrio donde está aubicada su miscelanea,quienes son sus principales clientes, conocen que comercializa los articulos de estudio de buena calidad y a un buen precio. Con su negocio ayuda económicamente a su familia y esto es justamente lo que hace cuando invierte, vende  y gana dinero. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará utiles educativos que su clientela le ha encargado y para que estos regresen a comprarle, ella estará dispuesta a responder a sus necesidades, intereses y deseos. Digna se siente muy agradecida por la primera oportunidad y espera que le ayuden en esta oportunidad, con un nuevo credikiva, con el cual aumentará el inventario que mas rota en su miscelanea y esto es justamente la razón del éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Digna wishes to take advantage of the current school season by selling relevant merchandise. The parents who are her main customers in her store know that she sells good quality school supplies at good prices. With the income from her business she helps support her family.

Digna is now applying for another loan to buy educational supplies which her customers have ordered. She wishes to respond to their needs, interests, and wishes. Digna is very grateful for the first opportunity to have a loan and expects that this new loan will help her too. She plans to increase and change the inventory in her small store; this is the very reason for her business success.

loans.use: buy school supplies

loans.name: Njeri

texts.en:
Njeri is 31. She is married to Kenneth and is the mother of one child. Together with her husband, she runs a cereal shop and a retail shop in Kangemi. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of 60,000 shillings.

This will be Njeri's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy 30 bags of maize for resale. In the future, she wants to open another cereal shop in Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Joseley

texts.en:
Joseley lives in the Kongowea area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two school-going children. He owns a retail shop, a business which he has been operating for four years. He is also formally employed.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to their group. He joined Milango with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is competition from other businesses like his own. 

Joseley is applying for a loan of 52,300 Kenyan shillings, to buy retail stock of engine oil and other lubricants. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings, to improve the living standard of his family and to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to see his business grow to a bigger business and to open another outlet.

loans.use: To buy retail stock of engine oil and other lubricants.

loans.name: Keibeh

texts.en:
Keibeh is 37 years old, married, and lives in Airport, surrounded with her four children that attend school. Her husband is a contractor. 

For the past 15 years, Keibeh has been involved in business and currently she sells palm oil, rice, pepper, okra, bitter ball, etc. She says she walks every time to reach the village to buy her goods since a car and bike cannot reach the village market. She likes how her customers can be waiting for her return and she enjoys how supportive she is to her family. She learned this way of selling from her mother. 

Keibeh is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, okra, bitter ball, etc. for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, pepper, okra, bitter ball, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Boban

texts.en:
Boban, 41, is married and has three children. Boban and his family live in a village in a minority community in the southern part of Kosovo. At this time, Boban is the only one in the family working and supporting them all. In order to do this best, he is starting his own agricultural business working the land with a tractor. This type of job is very well paid in his area and is very much in demand.

Boban is asking for a loan to buy a tractor and hopes to expand his business even further in the future. His goal is to improve the living conditions of his family, and he is grateful to all Kiva lenders for helping him achieve this.

loans.use: To buy a tractor.

loans.name: Tulay

texts.en: Tulay lives in the city of Buchanan in Grand Bassa County, which provides fish in the Liberian local market. Tulay is 22 years old. She is single, and she has two children, ages 4 and 7 years old, who live at home and attend school. For the past ten years, Tulay has been selling blouses, slippers, and artificial hair in the local market. She established this business with a small loan from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more blouses, slippers, and artificial hair to expand her business. In the future, she wants to build a house and to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more blouses, slippers, and artificial hair to expand her business.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly is 45 years old, married, and supports four members of her family. Her children are aged between 25 and 18 years.  Her spouse is Philip, a farmer. She owns a food stall and has been in operation for a period of six years, earning a monthly income of KES 31,000.

She is taking her second loan, in the amount of KES 60,000, after having repaid the previous one successfully. She intends to use this amount to purchase sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, tea leaves and salt for her business.  

The profits she earns will be used to plow back into the business and to educate her children. She hopes to improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, maize flour, cooking fat, tea leaves and salt, for inventory for her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 40 years old, and lives in an airport's surroundings. She has three children between 7 and 15 years old. They are attending school and living at home. Her husband is a businessman. 

For the past 11 years, Martha has been operating a local restaurant in the community. She is respected in her family, and also the mother of a supportive home. One of the problems she faces is that she does not have a good location for her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more food ingredients, like fish, cassava, bush meat, bonnie, pig's feet and chicken, for her business. Her plans are to expand her business and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients, like fish, cassava, bush meat, bonnie, pig's feet and chicken, for her business.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is a 48-year-old married woman. She has five children, ranging in age from 20 to 30 years old. She describes herself as an obedient woman. She operates a livestock farming business in which she sells goats. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located on agricultural land and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as having insufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy livestock to sell. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is 51-years-old. She lives in Sisian town with her husband. Gayane works at the local kindergarden.
Besides her work, she also keeps a cow. Gayane gets milk and uses it in cheese production. Her husband helps her to sell the cheese in local markets. Gayane has applied for this loan to purchase a cow, two heifers and forage for feeding them. The loan is very important for Gayane to get more milk and to make cheese. She is sure that this will help her to generate high income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow,  two heifers and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has three school-age children. He has operated a tailoring shop for 19 years now. Stephen is also a farmer.
He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are finding customers, high fuel prices and purchasing stock for his business.
Stephen is applying a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy more clothing, including school uniforms. He will use the extra income to improve his farming business and provide for his family’s needs. He aspires to own other businesses in other places.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, including school uniforms.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a single mother of one child who goes to school. She has a business of selling snacks (chips, chicken, beef, and sausages).  She has applied for a loan of 500000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more chicken, Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal, beef and sausages. She works six days a week at the market and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and medication.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, Irish potatoes, charcoal, beef, sausages and chicken.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is a 50-year-old, married woman. She has eight children, whose ages range from 8 to 22 years. She describes herself as an honest woman. 

She operates a retail store, where she sells cereals and beans. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a regular commercial area, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is the poor road network, which greatly affects her business. 

Veronica will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy cereals and beans to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will continue to purchase beans and millet to sell. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy millet and beans to resell

loans.name: Zulita

texts.es:
Zulita tiene 40 años, es una mujer emprendedora y amante del trabajo, tiene 3 hijos de 19, 16 y  8 meses junto a su conviviente, vive junto a toda su familia en una casa propia que construyeron como resultado de años de trabajo, esfuerzo y ahorro. Ama a cada uno de los miembros de su hogar y es a ellos a quienes les dedica todo el esfuerzo que hace para seguir adelante.
El negocio de Zulita consiste en la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, todos los días desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su tienda para atender a sus clientes que llegan hasta su establecimiento en busca de algún producto. Su bodega es la más surtida de su barrio y sus clientes no dudan en comprarle, no solo por ese motivo, sino también por la calidad de las marcas de los artículos que ofrece, además de eso el trato tan cordial y la amabilidad que expresa en cada una de sus palabras son la cualidades perfectas para que sus clientes estén siempre agradecidos. Recuerda que cuando se inició en éste negocio no tenía muchos productos que ofrecer por lo que no lograba tener buenas ventas durante el día, sin embargo buscó la solución, completó un pequeño capital y poco a poco fue implementando su pequeña tienda, ahora le va muy bien en sus ventas. Lleva en este negocio 3 años y siempre recibe la ayuda de su cónyuge.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y verlos empezar el día con una sonrisa, considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse temprano para atender su bodega y complementarlo con la crianza de su pequeño bebé, aún cuando se siente cansada, sin embargo, sabe que es su trabajo y que tiene que hacerlo, espera que más adelante su negocio crezca y le brinde mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, está muy agradecida al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, asimismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, además está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado (S/. 1500), comprará mayor cantidad de productos con los que implementará su tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, huevos, fideos, verduras, frutas y otros artículos.
texts.en:
Zulita, 40, is an enterprising, work loving woman. She has three children, aged 19, 16 and 8 months, and lives together with her partner. They live together in their own home, which they built as a result of years of hard work, effort and saving. They love each other and she works hard to ensure that they succeed.

Zulita's business sells groceries and basic necessities. She opens her shop very early every day to serve the customers who come to her shop in search of products. Her store is the best stocked in her neighbourhood and her customers do not hesitate to shop there, not only because of this, also because of the quality brands hat she offers and the warm and friendly service that she provides with every word so that her customers always feel welcome.

She remembers that, when she started her business, she did not have many products and she could not get good sales during the day. However she looked for a solution, raised a small amount of capital and in small stages she went about setting up her little shop and now her sales are going well. She has now been running her business for 3 years and always receives help from her partner.

Her favourite thing about work is talking to her customers and seeing them starts her day with a smile. She thinks the hardest thing is getting up early to work in the shop and raising her baby when she is so tired. She knows that it is her job and needs to be done however, and she hopes that in the future her business will grow and will provide better economic rewards.

This is her second loan with MFP, she is grateful for the knowledge that she has financial support as it helps her to feel more secure when advancing with her business, she also commits to making her payments according to the schedule. She is happy to belong to her communal bank as all of the members are responsible and caring.

With the requested money (1500 PEN) she will buy wholesale products to stock her grocery store with items like rice, sugar, eggs, beans, greens and fruits, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, eggs, beans, vegetables, fruits and other items.

loans.name: Fauzia

texts.en:
Fauzia lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has eight children, the youngest two of whom are in school. She owns a food cafe, a business she has been operating for five years. Apart from this, she earns an income from a farming business. She also sells clothes.

She learned about Milango through one of its employees, who invited her to a group. She joined Milango with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges she is facing include price fluctuations and bad debts.

Fauzia is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenyan shillings to buy food ingredients, like flour, cereals and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings, and used to improve the living standard of her family and to pay her children’s school fees. Her plan for the future is to expand through opening another food cafe.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients, like flour, cereals and cooking fat.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 33-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as a focused and determined man. He operates a farm stand where he sells maize and beans. His business is located on agricultural land and his primary customers are local residents and schools. He describes his biggest business challenge to be occasional weather changes which lead to crops drying up and greatly affecting his business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy maize and bean seedlings. His business goal is to be a supplier of cereals within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy maize and bean seedlings

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has two children, ages 24 years and 28 years. She describes herself to be a humble woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Florence will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her four family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. This is Florence's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en: Riziki  is a 29-year-old married woman who has five children. She owns a rental house where she provides housing accommodations. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located at a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high land rent. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to pay for the renovation of the rental house. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the rental house.

loans.name: Ylli

texts.en:
Ylli is a 30-year-old single man who lives with his father in a town in southeastern Albania; his mother passed away long ago, leaving him at a very young age. He has got plans; he wants to get married soon. But before that, he needs some money to stock up on inventory items for his little bar-caffe restaurant that he has been operating for almost a year now. 

Ylli has been experiencing good profitability from his business and wants to expand his services by offering more items on the menu. In order to achieve this, he requests a loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek. He is hoping that lenders will show some understanding in this matter and assist him financially.

loans.use: To stock up on inventory items for his little bar-caffe restaurant

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 47-year-old married man who has four children. He describes himself to be loving and determined. He operates a butcher shop and grocery store  where he sells meat and fruits. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in an agricultural business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate meat for selling. He will use the KES 15000 loan to buy meat to sell. His business goal is to be a supplier of meat and fruits within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 49 years old, and lives in the Airport surroundings. She was too unfortunate to attend school, and she is married and has six children between 12 to 30 years old. Only two are living with her and going to school. For the past 30 years she has been involved with business. Presently she is selling rice, bread, biscuits, pepper, and other items. 

The problem that she is facing is that the transportation cost is too high. She likes her business because it provides for her needs. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, bread, biscuits, pepper, and other items to expand her business. Her plans are to educate all her children and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, bread, biscuits, pepper, and other items to expand her business

loans.name: Mujeres De Progreso 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Paulina is one of the members of the group Mujeres de Progreso (Women in progress) 1, 2 & 3. This group is located in a rural community surrounded by sugarcane fields in the outskirts of San Pedro de Macoris. She makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. For the past six years she has operated a grocery stall where she serves her customers and sells different products. She started her business with her own capital after saving for a while.

Paulina is excited to be a part of this third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan portions and grown her business. She plans to use her loan to invest by buying grocery products. Paulina says that her most difficult challenges are improving her business and helping her family. Nevertheless, she plans to continue enjoying working in her business. Paulina thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy groceries like candies, snacks and others.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Phoebe is a 27-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 6 months to 6 years. She describes herself to be an optimistic woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household-use items. Her business is located at a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a water tank which will be used by her six family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She describes herself to be an intelligent woman. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes she makes. Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 8,700 KES loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members for household chores. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu is 30 years old and lives near Airport, Liberia. She was unable to attend school and is married with three children between 4 and 10 years old that are in school. Her husband is a driver. 

For the past twelve years, Bendu has been selling oil, rice, flour, sugar, bread, sardines etc. She started this business by selling for her oldest sister and learned this trade from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, flour, sugar, bread, and sardines for her business. Her plan is to build a home and sent her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, flour, sugar, bread, and sardines for her business

loans.name: Banco Comunal Cristo Rey Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Cristo Rey, está conformado por 8 integrantes de los cuales 7 son mujeres y un varón. Personas responsables, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación. Estos integrantes  pertenecen a la comunidad del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Y se caracteriza por ser un lugar productor de leche y sus derivados. Aracelis es la coordinadora del banco comunal la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de las cuotas en tiempo y forma de cada uno de los integrantes. Ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una tienda donde vende  en cantidades pequeñas y productos comestibles como: jugos, gaseosas, pan,  sobre se shapoo, sobre de café, arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, azúcar, huevos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos. El banco comunal Cristo Rey agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The "Cristo Rey" communal bank is comprised of eight members, seven of whom are women and one is a man. They're responsible, hardworking people with a lot of drive to succeed. These members belong to the community of Sauce, which is located in the northern area of the country and is known for its milk and dairy production. Aracelis is the communal bank's coordinator and she's responsible for each of the members' repayments in terms of time and form. Her business is a grocery store located in her own house. It's a store where she sells small quantities of products and foodstuffs such as juice, soft drinks, bread, shampoo packets, coffee packets, rice, beans, milk, sugar and eggs. The purpose of this loan is to get working capital and stock up her business by purchasing goods for selling. The "Cristo Rey" communal bank thanks the lenders for the help they provide for people of limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have an honest means of livelihood.

loans.use: to get working capital, to stock up her grocery store and to purchase goods such as shampoo packets, coffee packets, rice, beans, bread, milk, sugar and eggs for selling.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Solomon. He is married to a businesswoman and has four children ages 19, 15, 13 and 11 years; all are school-going children.  He has one additional dependent, his younger sister's daughter, who came to live with him to attend school as his sister is living in the village. 

In 1992, Solomon established his essential drugs business. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,300,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. 

Solomon has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans, and he now requires a new loan in order to purchase  glucose powder, dexorange, septrin syrup, Is Cof S detol, and multivitamin syrups. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  

In the future, Solomon plans to open a laboratory, open another drug store and educate his children very well.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase glucose powder, dexorange, septrin syrup, Is Cof S detol, and  multivitamin syrups

loans.name: Bakr

texts.en: Bakr is a 23-year-old young man who lives in Sana'a, Yemen. He is a secondary school graduate. Two years ago, Bakr opened a small drinking water purification station with the help of his late father. He now supplies grocery stores with 5 liter containers of water. Baker is the head of his family after the death of his father. He works very hard and  does his best to provide his mother and little brothers and sisters with everything they need. The drinking water purification system in his station is old and needs to be replaced with a modern one; therefore, he asked for a loan of 200.000YER to buy a new drinking water purification system. Bakr hopes that his small drinking water purification station will make more profits and in turn, help him to improve the standard of living of his family

loans.use: to buy a drinking water purification system

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is a 39-year-old lady who lives in Airport, Liberia. She is married with three children between 9 and 17. The children are in school and live at home. Kumba is a high school graduate and has been involved in the sales of body cream, powder, spry, and bath soap for 10 years. Her husband helped her to start her business. The business helps them to earn a living for for her children.

Kumba is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, powder, spry, and bath soap for her business. She hopes to build a house and educate her children in business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, powder, spry, and bath soap for her business

loans.name: Nery Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor Nery Alejandro esta casado, tiene 29 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 de los cuales esta estudiando, se dedica al tejido de cortes típicos, en varios diseños y colores, inicio este negocio con poco capital y por iniciativa propia, hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quien  se dedica a los oficios domésticos.
