She also rents out a house for additional income.

Marceline would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance of their jeepney. Her profits from the business will definitely help meet her business and family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marceline hopes that her business will grow even more and prays for good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

Note: Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney – open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Zayton

texts.en:
This is Zayton, 46, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Esmael, a self-employed man, and she is a mother to their child. She and her husband manage their household, while engaging in business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zayton operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an increase in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Zayton hopes to expand her business and dreams of giving her child a good and quality education. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, to increase the inventory of her store.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.en: Anselmo is married with three children. He is 46 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Anselmo owns and operates a private transportation service. He has been in this business three years and earns 13,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. He requested a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase spare parts and accessories. Anselmo been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC since 2012. In the future, Anselmo wants to finish his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
Андрей живет в селе Днепровка. Он занимается выращиванием овощей на своем участке уже 12 лет. У него есть несколько теплиц, выращивает помидоры, огурцы и редис. Андрей – очень трудолюбивый. Он работает на огороде, а в свободное время также подрабатывает сварщиком – делает теплицы для других сельскохозяйственников. 
Андрей обратился к КИВА за кредитом в размере 24 000 гривен для того, чтобы устроить отопление теплиц. Он планирует сделать газовое отопление в теплице для рассады, для этого ему нужно приобрести котел, сделать проект на газ и приобрести все нужные материалы. У Андрея есть еще земля. В планах у него построить теплицы и там, а со временем также сделать хороший ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Andrei lives in the Dneprovka village.  He has been involved in growing vegetables on his land plot for 12 years.  He has several greenhouses, where he grows tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes.  Andrei is very hardworking.  He works on the land and also as a welder in his free time, making greenhouses for other farmers.  Andrei requested a loan in the amount of 24 000 hryvnia from Kiva to install heating for greenhouses.  He plans to install gas heating in the seedling greenhouse and needs to purchase a boiler, make plans for gas and buy all of the necessary materials.  Andrei has more land.  He plans to install greenhouses there as well and make good repairs at home in time.

loans.use: to install heating in greenhouses

loans.name: Maxym

texts.ru: Максим занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах на своем земельном участке уже 10 лет. В основном он выращивает помидоры, огурцы и редис. Максим простой и общительный, он срадостью делится тем как идут дела в его бизнесе и планами на будущее. Максиму нужны дополнительные средства для ремонта теплицы, а также покупки семян. У Максима есть еще земля, где он хочет построить еще одну теплицу. Максим женат, есть один сын, который учится в школе.
texts.en: Maxym has been involved in growing vegetables in greenhouses on his land plot for 10 years.  He mainly grows tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes.  Maxym is simple and personable; he gladly shares how his business is going and his future plans.  Maxym needs additional means to repair a greenhouse and to buy seeds.  Maxym has more land, where he wants to build another greenhouse.  Maxym is married and has a son, who attends school.

loans.use: to repair a greenhouse and buy seeds

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores, a 53-year-old, married mother of four children, is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City. There, she has been operating a general retail store, selling a variety of food and non-food products, for the past 10 years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Dolores joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She expected such services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now she is requesting a new loan of 7,500 PHP to buy more items to resell, such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store, such as eggs, noodles, shampoo, soap and toothpaste.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила выращивает овощи в теплицах. В прошлом сезоне благодаря КИВА кредиту она получила хороший урожай и смогла благоустроить свое жилье. Однако, младшей дочери Людмилы сделали операцию на желудке. На лекарства ушло много денег, но дочери уже намного лучше. Старший сын нашел работу и теперь помогает с деньгами.

Людмила просит предоставить ей кредит на закупку качественных семян, а также замены пленки в теплице. Это позволит Людмиле вовремя приготовиться к сезону и получить хорошую прибыль.
texts.en: Ludmila grows vegetables in greenhouses.  Thanks to a Kiva loan, she gathered a good harvest last season and was able to improve her home.  Unfortunately, Ludmila's youngest daughter had a stomach surgery.  A lot of money was spent on medications, but the daughter has improved significantly.  The oldest son found work and now helps with money.  Ludmila is requesting this loan to purchase quality seeds and also to replace plastic for a greenhouse.  This will allow Ludmila to prepare for the season in a timely manner and make a good profit.

loans.use: to purchase quality seeds and also to replace plastic for a greenhouse

loans.name: Avelyn

texts.en:
This is Avelina, of Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, a widow, and has two grown children. Avelina cultivates bananas and mangoes for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Avelina joined GDMPC. Avelina is requesting a loan of 11,500 PHP, which she will use to pay laborers to do work needed for 
farm maintenance. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers for work needed to maintain her banana and mango farm.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 61 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Joel raises livestock for sale, primarily pigs. He has been engaged in this business for five years and earns 25,000 PHP a month. 

Joel been a member of GDMPC since 2004. He is requesting a new loan of 48,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. He aims to expand his business one day.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса замужем. У нее есть взрослые дочери. Она занимается фермерством.

Лариса выращивает овощи на продажу на протяжении 25 лет. Она имеет собственный большой участок земли, засаженный кабачками, капустой, баклажанами и т.д. Лариса также выращивает рассаду и ранние овощи в телицах. Она целеустремленная и трудолюбивая. 

Лариса просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на закупку удобрений, дров и семян. Часть кредита Лариса хочет потратить на ремонт теплиц. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль благодаря кредиту и восполнить нужны семьи.
texts.en:
Larisa is married. She has grown daughters. She works as a farmer.
Larisa has been growing vegetables for sale for some 25 years now. She has her own large land plot, where she grows vegetable marrow [a type of squash], cabbage, eggplant/aubergines etc. Larisa also  plants out seedlings and grows early-season vegetables in her greenhouses. She is goal-oriented and hard-working.

Larisa is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 UAH to buy fertilizers, firewood and seeds. She would like to use part of her loan to renovate her greenhouses. She hopes to increase her revenues thanks to this loan and to provide for household needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, firewood and seeds.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old and married. Julie plants, harvests, and sells bananas for a living. She has been engaged in this business for six years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Julie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julie is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. She plans to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Aellin

texts.en:
Aellin, a 36-year-old married mother of three, is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has been operating a specialized retail ice cream business for the past two years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Aellin joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her product. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her product.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora May is from Catadman, Ozamis City. She is 33 years old, married, and has one child. To make a living, Flora May owns and operates a business serving local foods in the community. Flora May has been engaged in this business for three years and earns 22,500 PHP a month. 

Flora May is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional food and drinks to sell. She joined GDMPC in 2012 to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional food and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old and married with two children. She's from Gala, Ozamis City. Susan has been operating a farming business for 15 years. She earns 20,000 PHP a month. 

In 2004, Susan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susan is requesting a loan of 33,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Susan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Jabeen's Group

texts.en:
Jabeen is a 48-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Pakistan with her husband, five sons and two daughters. Both the daughters are married and the elder son has a vegetable shop. Her husband owns a small vegetable shop in the market. His income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Jabeen is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes. 

She herself is a tailor, and she wants to generate more income by purchasing a new sewing machine. She will extend her business if she gets a good amount of profit in the future. 

Jabeen is a member of six-person group and has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a sewing machine to stitch up more dresses and to satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of the loan, to reach her desired net income and be able to save for their future. She dreams of giving her children a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
Rubina is a 44-year-old married woman and the responsible mother of two sons and four daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an independent and hardworking woman. Her husband is doing a private job.

For the last 22 years, Rubina has been in the garment business. She purchases garments from different areas and sells them in the market nearby. With her little income she helps her husband to meet the family needs and the costs of their children's education. Presently Rubina needs to purchase a variety of garments for her business. For that she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Purchasing more garments will allow her to expand her business. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her small business and family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of garments to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for an animal-selling business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 44, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Gregorio, a mechanic, and she is a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. She is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

Helen operates a variety store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them individually. Her regular customers are her neighbors and others in the community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to help her continue to operate her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Helen dreams of seeing all of her children successful in their careers, and she also hopes to expand her business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories about her life and her business and to draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embriodery material for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is from Migcanaway, Tangub City. She is 35 years old and married with two children. To make a living, she does fish vending while her husband does fishing. She has been engaged in her business for 11 years and earns 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) a month for this activity. 

In 2008, Merlinda joined GDMPC. Merlinda is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 90 kg of chemical fertilizer, to rent of a field and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Motia

texts.en: Motia is a 24-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He opened his own grocery store to earn an income. He has seven years experience in business, and he hopes his skills will help him. He is a hard worker, putting much effort into improving his family's living conditions. He applied for a youth loan of 150,000 YER to buy grocery items to increase his business. He says that his parents have been a big inspiration and that is why he will fight to offer them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to increase his business.

loans.name: Mufari Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nsimire, trésorière du groupe Mufari, entrepreneur courageuse et mère de 7 enfants, qui vont tous à l’école. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans une école publique. La cliente est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires, elle s’approvisionner dans l’intérieur de la province. Elle commença cette affaire avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 15 sacs de maïs. A son passage, la cliente paye trop des taxes aux groupes armés, qui opèrent dans ces zones. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son accompagnement en micro crédit aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Nsimire is treasurer for the Mufari group, a courageous entrepreneur, and mother of seven children, all of whom go to school. Her spouse is a teacher at a public school.

Nsimire sells foodstuffs. She stocks up in the countryside. She started this business with her own funds that she received from her husband. This new loan will enable her to buy 15 bags of corn.

Nsimire pays too much in taxes, when she travels, to armed groups operating in the regions where she goes. She would therefore like to thank Hekima for assisting small, non-bankable entrepreneurs by providing them micro loans. It should be noted that another client is holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of corn

loans.name: La Famille Group

texts.fr: Regroupant les membres d’une même famille élargie,le regroupement « la Famille  » compte 5 membres dont 4 hommes et une femme qui s’activent dans le commerce et l’aviculture. Leur président, monsieur  Mamadou Samba âgé de 54 ans, fait de l’aviculture depuis 2 ans et désire un  crédit pour renforcer et augmenter la capacité de sa production en poulets de chair. Il est marié et s’occupe de sa famille pour leur besoins journaliers en nourriture. Mamadou Samba désire avoir une autonomie financière un jour et pouvoir financer seul son activité.
texts.en: The "Famille" group is composed of five members of one extended family (four men and one woman) who are actively involved in retail business and poultry farming.  Their leader, Mamadou Samba, is 54 years old.  He has been involved in poultry farming for the past two years and wishes to obtain a loan to boost and increase his production capacity of broilers.  He is married and takes care of his family's daily nutritional needs.  Mamadou Samba wishes to be financially independent one day and to be able to finance his business by himself.

loans.use: to buy young chickens to raise and resell.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Kenneth lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a training ground for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. His primary income sources are milk, eggs,  and crops and has been doing this work for five years. He has one child.

He stated that what is most enjoyable about farming is the "time for harvesting after months of hard work". His biggest challenge is managing costs. He will use the loan to buy a dairy cow.

Kenneth was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'because it is a social organization.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. He answered, 'co-guarantee mechanism.'

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Kenneth replied 'better quality of life.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kenneth owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is 35 years old, married with two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Cristy manages and owns a business, raising crab and shrimp for sale to earn a living. She has been in business for 5 years and she earns PHP 6,000 each month. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,500 to purchase additional crabs and shrimp. Cristy's business is very stable in her community. 

She joined GDMPC last year. In the future she will use her income to support her two children in their studies until they finish college. She also provides their daily needs. Cristy hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs and shrimp

loans.name: Dilsia Rosa

texts.es: Dilsia, tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara junto a uno de sus hijos. Ella inicio su propio negocio de pulpería hace 4 años donde vende maíz, frijoles, manteca, churros, café, azúcar, condimentos, huevos, verduras, pastillas, refrescos, pollo, etc. este negocio es su fuente de ingresos.  Doña Dilsia   ha mantenido activo el negocio mediante la inversión de varios prestamos, actualmente esta solicitando el sexto préstamo que es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir también en la compra de productos básicos alimenticios como maíz, frijol, arroz, azúcar, manteca, pollo, churros, refrescos, y otros abarrotes para surtir el negocio. Su objetivo es incrementar el inventario y ofrecer más producto a los clientes. Ella tiene como meta llegar a ser un supermercado y que sea un patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dilsia is a 49-year-old single mother who has four children. She lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara, with one of her children.

Dilsia established her own grocery business four years ago. There she sells corn, beans, lard, snack foods, coffee, sugar, condiments, eggs, vegetables, medicines, soft drinks, chicken, and other items. This business serves as her source of income. Doña Dilsia has maintained an active business by investing several loans.

She is currently requesting her sixth loan in the amount of 10,000 HNL so that she can invest in the purchase of basic food products such as corn, beans, rice, sugar, lard, chicken, snacks, soft drinks, and other grocery items to restock her business. Her objective is to increase her inventory so that she can offer more products to her customers. She also has a goal of converting her business into a supermarket so that she can provide an inheritance for her children.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, rice, sugar, lard, chicken, snacks, soft drinks, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
El señora Adela tiene dos hijos, vive en casa familiar, ocupando una habitación y sus dependencias como ser: baño, cocina, comedor y sala con un acabado fino y piso de machimbre, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz.

Adela, estudió hasta el nivel secundario, actualmente se dedica a la venta de cortes de telas de todo tipo como ser: telas para la confección de polleras, poleras, mantas, blusas y otros, ella vende por más de doce horas al día ya que es su única fuente de ingresos. 

El crédito lo requiere para el incremento de su capital, desea comprar más material prima (telas) para surtir su negocio y mostrar la variedad de telas a sus clientes. 

El sueño de Adela, es tener una tienda propia y hacer crecer su negocio.

Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Adela has two children. She and her family live in a house that includes a bathroom, kitchen, dining room, and living room with fine finishes and wooden plank floors. The house is located in the District of Miraflores in the city of La Paz.

Adela studied through high school. She currently sells all types of cut fabric that is used for making skirts, T-shirts, blankets, blouses, and other articles. Adela works more than 12 hours a day and this business is her only source of income.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her capital. She wants to buy more fabrics so that she can restock her business and display a variety of materials for her customers. Her dream is to have her own shop and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Appolinaire

texts.fr: Appolinaire est un homme de 43 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. il a ouvert un mini kiosque dans un quartier de la ville qu'il gère depuis 03 ans et se debrouille bien. Il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des produits alimentaires telles que biscuits, bonbons, cacahuète et cigarettes, etc... afin d'augmenter son stock de marchandises. Ce qui permettra de réaliser un bénéfice non seulement pour augmenter son capital et activité et de satisfaire la clientèle. Il voudrait ainsi avec ces derniers pouvoir subvenir au besoin de sa femme et de ses 04 enfants.
texts.en: Appolinaire is a 43-year-old man who is married and the father of four children.  He has opened a small booth in one of the city's neighborhoods and he has been running it for three years.  He is managing well.  He is requesting this loan to buy goods such as biscuits, candy, peanuts, cigarettes etc...and increase his stock of products.  This will allow him to make a profit, which will be used to increase his capital, expand his activity, and meet his customers' needs.  In doing so, he hopes to be able to meet the needs of his wife and four children.

loans.use: to buy goods such as biscuits, candy, peanuts, cigarettes etc...

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es: Vilma, tiene 40 años de edad, esta divorciada, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de San Francisco Atlántida. Ella tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva como blusas, camisas, pantalones, vestidos y ropa para niños. Ademas vende cosméticos y achinería. El negocio lo tiene establecido en su casa y ya tiene su clientela fija. Vilma a decidido solicitar un préstamo de 12,000 Lempiras para compra de más mercadería y mantener surtido su negocio, con esta inversión ella espera obtener más utilidades. Tiene como meta trabajar duro para que crezca el negocio y que nunca les falte la alimentación y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old, divorced, and has five children. She lives in a neighborhood in the town of San Francisco Atlántida.

For the past four years, Vilma has been selling new clothing such as blouses, shirts, trousers, dresses, and children’s outfits. She also sells cosmetics and knickknacks. Her business is located in her house and she has an established clientele.

Vilma decided to request a loan in the amount of 12,000 HNL so that she can buy more merchandise to maintain the inventory in her business. She hopes this investment will result in more profits. Her goal is to work hard so that she can grow her business and provide food and an education for her children.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Poh Gending Lestari Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah and the whole group of Poh Gending Lestari got a second loan from MUK. After evaluating the first loan, the group wanted to get additional funding from MUK to supplement their pigs.

Ni Nengah has a plan to use the loan to buy a sow and feed purchased with her own capital. Ni Nengah lives with her husband, who works as a private employee, and one of her children who is still in senior high school. Every day she spends 30,000 IDR for groceries, 20,000 IDR to equip her schoolchild and 125,000 IDR to pay for electricity and water. She hopes the sow can give her a lot of healthy piglets.

loans.use: To buy a sow

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline (in the photo here with her dairy cows though requesting a loan for poultry business) lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has no children and has been doing this work for four years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'poultry and dairy keeping!' Her biggest challenge is 'weather changes'. The animals on the farm are not named. She will use the loan to buy more poultry birds.

Caroline was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'it deals with farmers.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'record keeping.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Caroline replied 'more income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Caroline owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net and TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, or a DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Nicoline

texts.fr: Nicoline est une femme Célibataire de 27 ans, sans enfant. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la place depuis plus de 5 ans. Son salon fonctionne bien grce a son savoir faire et l'expérience qu'elle a acquise avec le temps et surtout son acceuil chalereux envers sa clientéle. sollicite un credit pour s'acheter un casque pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèlle et augmenter sa marge bénéficaire. le benefice realisé sera re-injecté dans son activité pour l'agrandire.
texts.en: Nicoline is a 27-year-old single woman, with no children.  After completing her professional training, she opened a beauty salon in a local neighborhood over five years ago.  Thanks to her expertise, to the experience she has gained overtime, and to the fact that she always greets her customers warmly, her beauty salon is doing well.  She is requesting a loan to buy a hair salon helmet.  This will allow her to better meet the needs of her customers and to increase her profit margin.  She will use her profits to reinvest in her business in order to expand it.

loans.use: to buy some equipment for her beauty salon (hair salon helmet)

loans.name: Ineah

texts.en:
Ineah lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. He has six children and has been doing this work for 10 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'horticulture and dairy farming!' His biggest challenge is "drought". He will use the loan requested from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow.

Ineah was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'because they deal with farmers.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'to do farming as a business.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked  'How will this loan benefit your family?', Ineah replied 'assist in paying school fees.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ineah owns the following: 'a cow and poultry' but does not own 'a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'a mosquito net and electricity' but does not have 'solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has seven children and has been doing this work for eight years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'dairy farming!' Her biggest challenge is 'price fluctuations'. One of the animals on the farm is named 'lelmet.'

Jocelyn was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'fair interest rate.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'saving for the future.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Jocelyn replied 'better quality of life". She will use the loan of 40,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jocelyn owns the following: 'a cow and poultry' but does not own 'a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net and TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine or a DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Veronico

texts.en: For the past 12 years, Veronico has been selling baked snack food in his local community for a living. Veronico is 48 years old and married with three children. He is from Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He earns 20,500 PHP a month from his work and joined GDMPC this year. Veronico is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase the raw ingredients he needs to make products to sell. He plans to use the income generated with his loan to expand his business and save for his future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to make products to sell.

loans.name: Felixia

texts.en: Felixia is a married woman living in Bohol, a province in the Philippines. She is the mother of one child. Felixia has been in the food vending business for several years, selling local delicacies and desserts in her locality. This is the source of her income. Felixia is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for the food she prepares, such as flour, sugar and butter, as well as additional groceries to sell in her store, including canned goods, candies, soda and rice. With this loan, she will be able to increase her sales and eventually improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the delicacies she prepares, such as flour, sugar, and butter, and additional groceries to sell in her store, including canned goods, candies, soda and rice.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Gia is 52 years old. He lives in the Gardabani District with his wife and son. Gia applied for a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
Gia had a car and worked as a taxi driver. After an accident, his car will not run, and nowadays he doesn’t have any source of income. Gia’s son works as an artisan and receives a monthly income. It is hardly enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the “subsistence poor” category. 
Gia has requested a loan from Credo to re-start the family business. His loan request was approved in the framework of new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages providing business start-up and re-start credits on  soft conditions to the rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” on the basis of low income. With this credit, Gia will purchase a car. After purchasing the car Gia will be able to continue working. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-Up Loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car, because his taxi was in an accident.

loans.name: Teofie

texts.en:
Teofie is a 39-year-old married man and the father of a nine-year-old daughter. They live in Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. Teofie is a candlemaker and has been in the business for more than two years. He is also engaged in hog-raising ventures. 
Teofie is asking for a loan to buy materials for making candles, such as wax, yarn and thread, as well as additional feed for the pigs. With this loan, he will be able to improve his business and augment his income. Teofie dreams of making his business a success in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for making candles, such as wax, yarn and thread, as well as additional feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en: Tomas is from Bagakay, Ozamiz City. He is 35 years old, married, and has one child. To make a living, Tomas owns and operates a general store. Tomas been engaged in his business for about 10 years and earns 13,500 PHP a month from these activities. Tomas joined GDMPC in 2009. He has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to buy goods to sell in the community, including sugar, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, shampoo and other daily basic needs. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell in his community, including sugar, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, shampoo and other daily basic needs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is from Poblacion 4, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old. Marilyn is married and has two adult children. Marilyn owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 4,000 PHP a month. Marilyn is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her motorcycle so she can offer better service. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle so she can offer better transport service.

loans.name: Bold

texts.en:
Mr. Bold, 46 years old, lives in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on his brother’s plot of land. His brother operates a grocery store on his land.  Since 1995, he has been providing taxi service to local people and accumulated a vast amount of experience in this field. Using a previous loan from our organization, he built a garage for his car and this time he wants to renovate the interior components of the garage, as well as build his own house. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,200,000 MNT to renovate the garage interior, purchase 23,000 units of bricks which will be used for the house construction. As a result, the car he uses for his income will last longer as the insulated and renovated garage will have a good effect on the parked car. Also, by building his brick house, he can live in a more comfortable and warm place.  More importantly he will need to burn less coal thus contributing to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to renovate garage and purchase bricks for his house

loans.name: Zhuzhanna

texts.ru:
Жужанна замужем. У нее двое детей. Жужанна работает на заводе и ведет небольшое фермерское хозяйство, которое дает дополнительную прибыль. Она трудолюбивая и ответственная. Для Жужанны семья на первом месте.
Жужанна просит предоставить кредит в сумме 17,900 гривен на улучшения жилищных условий. Она хочет сделать ремонт ванной комнаты, побелить стены в кухне и прихожей. Сейчас в ванной отпала плитка, появилась плесень, ржавеет ванна и испортились трубы. Жужунна надеется, что благодаря кредиту семья станет жить намного уютнее.
texts.en:
Zhuzhanna is married and has two children. She works at a factory, while also operating a small farm, which provides additional income. Zhuzhanna is hard-working and responsible. Her family is her number one priority.

Zhuzhanna is requesting a loan of 17,900 hryvnia in order to improve her living conditions. She would like to carry out repairs in the bathroom, and paint the walls in the kitchen and in the entry hallway. Currently, tiles have fallen off walls in the bathroom, mold is growing, the bathtub is rusty, and pipes are leaking. Zhuzhanna hopes that, thanks to this loan, her family will have a much more comfortable life.

loans.use: to repair her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry for her farm.

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
It is the third loan for Arif from Kiva. He was very thankful to Kiva and lenders for helping him to improve his business. He did repairs and extended his work area, and he did renovations and some improvements in his business with Kiva's and lenders' help.

Now he needs a 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) loan to buy new healthcare supplies and medicines. He has been in this business for 15 years. 

Arif had been an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli City, but now he has settled in the Fizuli region with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy healthcare supplies and medicines.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Назокат женщина в возрасте 50 лет.   Она замужем  имеет четверых  детей.   Ее вид деятельности связан с торговлей.    Назокат продает  мужскую  обувь.   Этим бизнесом она занимается более 10 лет.   Дети Назокат уже выросли и создали свои семьи но   они по возможности помогают своим родителям.  Но Назокат старается сама тоже зарабатывать деньги так как у детей свои семьи и заботы.    Назокат с 2005 года  кредитуется в Арванде и является одним их лучших клиентов. Она не разу не имела просрочки и не нарушала условии кредитования. Всегда пунктуальная и ответственная. 
  На полученный кредит Назокат хочет привезти новый ассортимент товара и увеличить свой товарооборот. Она очень благодарна организации Арванд за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Nazokat is a woman of 50 years old. She is married and has four children. Her activities are linked to trade. Nazokat sells men's shoes. She has been engaged in this business for more than ten years. 

Nazokat's children are grown and have created their own families, and they help their parents as they are able. But Nazokat also tries to earn money on her own since her children have their own families and concerns. 

Since 2005, Nazokat has been borrowing from Arvand and is one of their best clients. She has never had a late payment and has not violated the conditions of lending. She is always punctual and responsible. 

Nazokat wants to use the loan to bring a new assortment of products and to increase her inventory. She is very grateful to Arvand for the financial support and understanding.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of men's shoes

loans.name: Ilkhom

texts.ru: Илхому 30 лет. Он живет со своей семьёй в Спитаменском районе. У него двое детей. Жена Илхома занимается шитьёй национальных одежд. А Илхом обеспечивает семью зарабатывая на жизнь куплей-продажей крупно-рогатого скота. Он занимается этой деятельностью уже 5 лет. С целью расширения своего бизнеса Илхом собирается взять кредит и на полученные деньги приобрести крупно-рогатый скот.
texts.en: Ilkhom is 30 years old.  He lives with his family in the Spitamen region.  He has two children.  Ilkhom's wife sews traditional clothing.  Ilkhom provides for the family by buying and selling large livestock.  He has been in this business for 5 years.  With the goal of expanding his business Ilkhom is planning to take out a loan and use the money to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children who are 10 and 6 years old. She buys and sells cereals to her customers and has been in operation for a period of three years, earning an income of KES 26,000 monthly.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. This is her first loan and she intends to use it to purchase five bags of dry maize and three bags of dry beans for resale. 

The profits she earns from the business will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children and for the upkeep of her family. Her dream is to have better living standards and prosper in her business.

loans.use: To purchase dry maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Zviad

texts.en:
Zviad is 25 years old. He lives in the Gori District with his mother. Zviad requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is the newly started business. In particular, Zviad has a grocery store locally. It is hardly enough food for the family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

His loan request was approved in the frame of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Zviad will purchase a stock of groceries. This will increase the sales and thus the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.to sell

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда очень трудолюбивая и целеустремлённая женщина, она замужем. Мавлуда имеет 2 детей. Дети совершеннолетние. В детские годы условия жизни у нее были очень тяжелые. С самых ранних лет она  занималась шитьём. После занятий в школе она шила платья девушкам и женщинам своего кишлака, чтобы заработать деньги для  содержания семьи. Повзрослев, она поехала в город, чтобы учиться в кооперативный техникум, вышла замуж и опять занималась  шитьём женской одежды. Чтобы прокормить детей, муж Мавлуды начал продавать мясо. А также Мавлуда выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу, горох и другие сельхозпродукты. Уже более 20-и лет она занимается этим бизнесом. Муж, сын и невестка помогают ей в ведении бизнеса. Полученный урожай она  продает местным жителям по более низкой цене, чем на базаре, с первых рук. Большая часть населения данного района приобретают пшеницу, а затем на мельнице получают муку и выпекают хлеб для личного пользования. Мавлуда хочет получить больше дохода и оплатить за учёбу младшей дочери. Сама Мавлуда мечтала получить высшее образование, но по образовавшему обстоятельству не смогла.  Поэтому трудится  и старается, чтобы её дети получили высшее образование. Она планирует организовать новый бизнес скотоводством для получения дополнительного дохода. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциации Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 15000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mavluda is a very hard-working and driven woman. She is married and has 2 adult children. 

Mavluda had a difficult life as a child. From early childhood, she worked as a seamstress: every day after school, she made dresses for other girls and women of her village, in order to earn some money for her family. When she was older, Mavluda moved to the city to go to college, got married, and once again started sewing women's clothing. In order to provide food for their children, her husband became a butcher. 

In addition to sewing, Mavluda cultivates wheat, corn, peas and other crops. She has been in this business for over 20 years. Her husband, son and daughter-in-law help her with farming. Mavluda sells her harvest directly to the local populace at prices that are lower than those at a market. Most people in the region purchase wheat, process it into flour at a mill, then bake their own bread.

Mavluda would like to increase her income in order to pay for her youngest daughter's education. Mavluda herself dreamed of post-secondary studies, but was unable to pursue them due to family circumstances. This is why she now works hard and tries to provide university education for her children. 

Mavluda is planning to launch a new livestock business in order to earn additional income. She has taken the course "Succeed", organized by the Association of Business Women, and received her graduation certificate. She is requesting a loan of 15000 somoni to purchase cattle and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for her new business

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en: Andrea, 60, is a married woman with one child. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She plants, harvests and sells bananas and coconuts to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. Andrea has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a lady of 48 years and married to Stanely. They have five children. She is a tailor and also does dairy farming. She has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of 70,000 shillings.

This will be Elizabeth's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to buy materials for making school uniforms for resale. In the future, she wants to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy materials for making school uniforms.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 70 years old, married and supports a family of two. He runs a general merchandise shop in Kabarnet town in Baringo County. This has been his income-generating business for the last 20 years and he gets an average monthly profit of KES 36,000. 

He has borrowed a loan of KES 80,000. With this loan, he intends to purchase more stock for his shop such as.maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. He anticipates getting profits that he will use to expand his business by increasing his stock to meets his clients' demand.

James hopes to improve his living standards and be financially stable. He also hopes to save money to enable him to expand his business into a general goods wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, sugar, cooking fat, etc

loans.name: Ulfatmo

texts.ru:
Улфатмо 39 - летняя женщина проживающая в городе Вахдат. Она живет с мужем. У нее двое маленьких, очаровательных детей. Образование у Улфатмо средне - специальное. Она портниха.
На протяжении трех лет Улфатмо занимается шитьем. Также она вышивает интересные рисунки и цветочки, чтобы разнообразить виды платьев. Она предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Каждый день она учится создавать новые образы и необычные рисунки, чтобы дать возможность найти свой образ своим постоянным клиентам. Улфатмо берет кредит для приобретения еще одной швейной машинки, покупки бисера, камушек и ниток.
texts.en:
Ulfatmo is a 39-year old woman who lives in the city of Vahdat. She lives with her husband. She has two small and charming children. 

Ulfatmo has secondary specialized education. She is a seamstress. For a period of three years Ulfatmo has been working with sewing. Further she embroiders interesting figures and flowers in order to enhance the look of the dresses. She provides the service from her home. Every day she studies how to make new images and unusual patterns, in order to give her loyal customers the opportunity to find their image. 

Ulfatmo takes a loan for the purchase of an additional sewing machine, and the purchase of beads, stones and thread.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and to buy beads, stones and thread

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru:
Файзулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 25 лет. Он холост. Файзулло живет с родителями. Его родители пенсионеры. Он единственный сын в семье, который обеспечивает своих родителей. 
Файзулло вот уже год как занимается растениеводством. При доме у него имеется небольшой участок земли, где он выращивает овощи. Также он один раз в год сеет пшеницу. Таким образом Файзулло зарабатывает и помогает своим родителям. Файзулло берет кредит для посева пшеницы, картошки и моркови.
texts.en:
Fayzullo lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 25 years old and single. Fayzullo lives with his parents. His parents are pensioners. He is the only son in the family who provides for his parents. 

Fayzullo has already worked with crop production for a year. At home he has a small plot of land, where he grows vegetables. Also, once a year, he sows wheat. This way Fayzullo earns money and helps his parents. 

Fayzullo takes a loan for the sowing of wheat, potatoes and carrots.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fuel

loans.name: Bohodir

texts.ru:
Боходир мужчина в возрасте 25лет, живет в Дж. Расуловском районе. Он женат, имеет троих детей, двоих сыновей и одну дочь. Его дети еще очень маленькие. Жена домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей. Сам Боходир работает водителем такси уже 5лет. Он с молодости любил водить автомобиль. Когда ему было 20 лет он купил автомашину под маркой "Matiz" и начал работать таксистом.
 Боходир кредитуется в ООО МДО Арванд с 2011 года и не когда ни нарушал политику кредитования. На полученный кредит Бахадир хочет купить запчасти для своего автомобиля и устранить неисправности. Баходир очень благодарен организации Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Bohodir is a man of the age of 25 years, who lives in the J. Rasulov region. He is married and has three children, two sons and one daughter. His children are still very small. His wife is a housewife, who raises the children. 

Bohodir has worked as a taxi driver for five years already. Since youth he loved driving. When he was 20 years old he bought a car of the brand "Matiz", and started working as a taxi driver. 

Bohodir has been taking loans with "MDO Arvand" since 2011 and he has never broken the loan conditions. For the loan received, Bohodir would like to purchase spare parts for his car and repair malfunctions. Bohodir is very thankful to the Arvand organization for the help and support.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a 24-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a personal goal of educating his children and building a permanent house as a residence. He has been in the transport sector for the last two years after getting money from a saving cooperative in his village. He faces hardships such as customers not paying on time and high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas. Ronald intends to use the loan to buy building materials such as sand and cement for his residential house.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand and cement for his residential house.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is married and the mother of three children. She is 44 years old and lives in the village of Dela Paz in Clarin, Misamis Occidental Province in the Philippines. Ruby makes and sells suman (rice cakes) to earn a living, and she had this business for 4 years. She earns 5,500 PHP each month. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make suman. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make suman.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a thirty-seven-year-old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is running a videography service alongside motorcycle transport and rentals as an additional income. He has a dream of having a digital studio to meet the current market despite lack of enough capital to run all his activities. Emmanuel is requesting a loan to buy digital equipment for his studio.

loans.use: to buy digital equipment for his studio.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is now 39 years old and still living with her three children whom she supports. She is still running her secondhand clothing stall in Awasi and her monthly income has increased to KES. 23,000.

She is requesting her third loan of KES.71,000. She repaid the previous one successfully and intends to use this amount to purchase six bales of second hand clothing for resale.

The profits she earns will be used to repay the loan and pay school fees for her school going children.  Her dream is to see her business grow and her children get a good education.

loans.use: to purchase six bales of secondhand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is a 36-year-old married woman and a mother of four young children from Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. Jacinta earns a living through her hog raising business.
Jacinta works hard so that she will be able to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children. Jacinta wants to expand her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. With this, she is applying for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs. By doing this, Jacinta will be able to realize her dreams of making her hog raising business successful.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Silvano

texts.en: Silvano used the previous loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and sugar to sell. With the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his children and increase his stock. He still has challenges of price fluctuations, inflation, and customers’ not paying on time but his dream is to own a wholesale shop and educate his children up to the university level. Silvano intends to use this loan to buy drinks and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy drinks and salt to sell.

loans.name: Goret

texts.en: Goretti is a 48-year-old married woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is agriculture alongside running a bar as an additional income. She faces challenges of price fluctuation, pests and customers who do not pay on time. She has a vision of expanding her business to more areas and venturing into modern farming methods. Goretti intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primarily milk producing area. He has 3 children and has been doing this work for 6 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops. 

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'dairy keeping!' His biggest challenge is marketing. Patrick was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'effeciency". He will use the loan to buy poultry birds. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'record keeping.' His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Patrick replied 'able to pay school fees.’ 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Patrick owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en: Sultan is a 26-year-old married man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a very hardworking and successful entrepreneur. He has been operating a grocery store for many years. He is satisfied with his business. His biggest dream is to improve his and his family's quality of life. He benefited from the previous loan. He gives thanks to Kiva for financing his previous loan. He applied for a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to stock his business with grocery items. He wishes to improve his business and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy wholesale products such as eggs, rice, beans, bread, oil, biscuits, sweets, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Lois

texts.en:
Lois is 67 years old and she supports her husband and grandchildren. She has been farming in Kwakotoe-Emali for the last seven years and receives an income of KES.6,300 per month.

She has a good credit history with KADET where she is applying for her fifth loan of KES.50,000. She plans to buy feeds, fertilizer and pesticides. She will use the extra profit to plant more fruits like mangoes and oranges.

She hopes to become a famous farmer and own many assets in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Jane Amor

texts.en:
Jane Amor is a 53 year old. She lives in Ozamiz City. She is married and has 2 children. To earn a living, Jane Amor owns and operates a business serving local foods to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP per month. 

She is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is now 24 years old and supporting two of his children. He is still operating his kerosene/diesel selling business and his monthly income has increased to about KES 20,000.

He has borrowed a second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase more stock of kerosene and diesel for resale.  

The profits that he earns will be used to repay the loan and plow back into the business.  His dream is to own a filling station supplying all types of fuel.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of kerosene and diesel for resale.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 37 years old and supports four people. She runs a small scale farming business and has been in the business for the last four years with a monthly income of about KES 10,000.

She is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000 with which she intends to purchase farm supplies for this year's planting season. 

She plans to use the additional income to plow back into the business and to purchase farm machinery; i.e., a tractor for easy tilling of the farm as well as other machines.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Lorgenia

texts.en:
Lorgenia lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and single. Lorgenia owns and operates a retail business. She has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns about 8,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Lorgenia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. 

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, sardines, rice, coffee, sugar and soap. She plans to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products like canned goods, sardines, rice, coffee, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Reuwel

texts.en:
Reuwel is a 68-year-old man, widowed and blessed with two children. He runs a shop in Kariobangi in south Nairobi and he has been in this business for the last five years. He gets an income of about KES 40,000 per month.

He has a good credit history with KADET LTD where he is applying for his sixth loan of KES 100,000, with which he plans to buy stock of cooking oil, sugar, salt, flour and many others.

He will use the anticipated profit to pay the loan and his own expenses. He hopes to go higher from a shop to a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy stock like sugar, flour, cooking oil, salt and many others.

loans.name: Rafat

texts.en:
Rafat is a 30-year-old young man. He is married and a father to one son and one daughter. For the past three years, Rafat has had an internet cafe, the only one of its type in the area where he lives. He has a lot of loyal customers, which makes his project a profitable one. It is the only source of income for the family.

He wants to expand and improve his current project, so he is requesting a 2,000 USD Youth loan from FATEN to cover the costs of purchasing new computers for his clients' use. It will meet the increasing clients' demand to use computers in the internet cafe, which will lead to a positive improvement in Rafat's income and help him to offer better living conditions to his family.

Rafat is photographed in his internet cafe.

loans.use: To purchase new computers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 60 years old. He owns a retail shop in Matuu town, and he has been in this business for the last twelve years. He gets an income of about KES 25,000 every month.

He has a very good credit history with KADET LTD where he is applying for his sixth loan of KES 100,000, with which he plans to boost business by buying stock of sugar, cooking oil, flour, salt and tea bags. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his grandchildren.

He hopes to own a supermarket in Matuu and open a retail shop in Tala.

loans.use: To buy stock like sugar, salt, cooking oil, flour and teabags.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is 27 years old, married, and she supports a family of two. She runs a grocery shop and this has been her income-generating business for the last four years. She gets an average monthly income of about KES 8,000. 

She has borrowed her first loan from KADET LTD of KES 10,000. With this loan she intends to purchase more fruit and vegetable stock for her grocery shop. She anticipates getting profits that she will use to pay school fees for her children. With any surplus she will expand her business by increasing the variety of fruits and vegetables to meet her clients' demands.

Carolyne hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable. She also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetable stock for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Narcita

texts.en:
Narcita is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Narcita makes a living selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional crabs and shrimp. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business and improve her living conditions as well.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs and shrimp.

loans.name: Tahiya

texts.en:
Tahiya is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Tahiya has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, mending clothes.

To help expand her business, Tahiya has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to obtain material to make more clothing. This will help Tahiya to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Tahiya hopes that she will be able to build a house in the future.

Tahiya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to obtain material to make more clothing

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en:
Damalie is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Damalie has been working hard to manage her general store, a retail shop. 

To help expand her business, Damalie has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to develop the business and buy more goods such as cooking oil, sodas, and flour, and will help Damalie to generate greater profits and be in position to pay school fees for her children. Damalie hopes that in the future she will be able to have a bigger business. 

Damalie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as cooking oil, sodas, and flour

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is a 33-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol, Philippines. She has four young children ages 12, 11, 7 and 5 years old. 

She runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and commodities to the people in her place. 

Anabel wants to improve her business but lacks the capital to do so. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, sodas, biscuits, chips and snack foods. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

In the future, Anabel dreams of making her business grow and become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, sodas, biscuits, chips and snack foods.

loans.name: Ningala

texts.en:
Ningala is a 38-year-old tailor in Bamburi, Mombasa. She is married and her husband provides additional income and together they support three children. She has been in the tailoring business for the last eight years and she has done well.

She is requesting her first loan to purchase clothing material for making embroideries to sell to her customers.

She plans to plough back the anticipated profit into the business. She hopes to build her own house in future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material for making embroidery

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marilou works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Marilou is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline is glad about the progress in his business. The first loan he previously received helped purchase a new stock, the sales of which he used to pay school fees and repay the loan. 

He is applying for a loan of 93,850 Kenya shillings to pay for a new stock of tea for sale. He looks forward to venturing into the export market in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of packed and blended tea.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bee hives, and pay for the colonization of his hives.

loans.name: Oliver's Group

texts.en:
Oliver's group includes four hard-working women. Oliver is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. 

For the past two years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her kiosk , which sells raw food. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more stock of food such as raw matooke (green plantain) to sell. It will help Oliver to generate greater profits and improve her stock. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to have a well equipped kiosk. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to purchase more stock of food such as raw matooke to sell.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Ibrahim from Kulanda Town Branch Southern Area Bo District. He is married and has three children between the ages of 2 years and 16 years. Two of his children attend school. 

Ibrahim runs a shoe store where he sells ladies' sandal, shoes, children's slippers, etc. He has been running this business for five years. He works at the business from 7 a.m. until 6 p.m., seven days per week.  His business is the only source of income he has. Ibrahim says that the main challenges to his business are price inflation and high rental fees.

Ibrahim has requested a loan in order to buy more ladies' sandals, shoes, slippers and crape for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his business and educate his children. In the future, he plans to expand his business more. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more ladies' sandals, shoes and slippers for sale.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene's group includes three hard-working women. Irene is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past year, Irene has been working hard to manage her vegetables and charcoal business. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to pay for more stock of charcoal to sell, and it will help Irene to generate greater profits and catch the attention of more customers. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Benina's Group

texts.en:
Benina's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Benina is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Benina has been working hard to manage her outside catering business, which sells chips and other foods. 

To help expand her business, Benina has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to obtain more raw food such as Irish potatoes and cooking oil to use in the business. This will help Benina to generate greater profits and pay her bills. Benina hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Benina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to obtain raw food such as Irish potatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: 3.12.228. Tt Van Hà Group

texts.en:
Kế is 60 years old and she is married with no children. Kế  is the group leader of the 3.12.228. TT Van Hà solidarity group, which consists of four members. Kế supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Kế  has a retail business selling lagim. Kế  has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the food to sell.

In 2010, Kế  joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Kế  has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Kế  hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make food to sell.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is 30 years old. She lives in the Gurjaani District with her husband, Jumber, and four children, ages 2, 6, 8 and 12. 

Tea requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for her agricultural business start-up, without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. According to government estimates, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category, and they get monthly social assistance.

The family grows strawberries on the family-owned land, and the harvested products are sold at the local open market. In addition, Tea and Jumber are daily workers in local farmers’ fields.
