Eunice is a member of Focus Women's Group based in the Gatukuyu area of Thika in Central Kenya. She is married with five children; three are still in school and two work as casual laborers.

Eunice is a dairy farmer with three cows, which produce about 10 liters of milk per day. She sells the milk for about $0.50 per liter, and with this income she is able to feed her family and pay her children's school fees.

She wants to construct a biogas plant on her farm to offset her fuel expenses. Every day she spends about $1 on kerosene for lighting and $0.50 on charcoal and firewood for cooking. With a biogas source, she will spare this money and use it to expand her farming business.

From the biogas she will also produce slurry, which she will use on her land to increase production. With increased production she can improve her family's food security and income.

loans.use: For biogas construction

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 33 years old and lives in Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She is married and has four children between the ages of 1 and 14, all live at home and three are in school. She was unable to attend school, but she has been managing her business for ten years now, without any default. Sometimes to get her goods from the valley is difficult, because cars cannot reach the valley -- only motorbikes. She started her business with money from her husband, having learned this way of selling from her mother. Rebecca is requesting a loan to purchase dried bush meat to resell. She hopes to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase dried bush meat to resell.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a 35-year-old, single mother. She has three children, ages 3, 7, and 15. The older two go to school. 

She rented a small shop in the middle of the trading center and she operates a cosmetics shop. She chose this place near her home to help her reduce transport costs since she has so many other expenses to cater to. 

She started this business after her husband had abandoned her and married another woman. As a single mother, Prossy has to strive to see that her children get all the basic needs met. Her customers trust her cosmetics because they are genuine.

Prossy needs a loan to purchase more stock to boost up her business. As a single parent, Prossy faces the challenge of providing the best basic needs for her children. For the business, lack of enough capital and stiff competition from cheap cosmetics sellers are the major challenges that are hindering her progress.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Balunkeswar Shg Group

texts.en:
Balunkeswar SHG was formed in 2006 and is composed of ten members in a small village in Odisha. 

Susama is the lady who is standing in the third position on the left side of the photograph. She is wearing an orange, black and red color saree. Susama, aged 29, is an educated member of their group, so she was selected as the leader of Balunkeswar SHG. Susama has two sons and one daughter. She is living with her husband and her three children. Her children are continuing schooling. 

With the loan that she is receiving, Susama plans to boost her agricultural business, and to do so she will purchase chemical fertilizers, rent a field and pay for the cost of labor. In order to strengthen her agricultural business, she plans to improve her strategy and make use of new farming techniques.

Both Susama and her husband have been involved in this activity for five years. They have good knowledge of paddy cultivation and vegetable cultivation.

Susama currently grows rice. She has requested a loan to grow her agriculture activity. Her ambition is to expand the business for which she is receiving financial support, and to diversify her activity by growing vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers, rent a field and pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Bofa

texts.en:
Bofa is 20 years old and lives in the area of Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest-producing rubber plantation area of Liberia. Bofa and her boyfriend live together, along with their two children, aged 1 and 4 years. Both children live at home and one attends school. Bofa is a high school graduate.

For the past two years, she has been operating a little shop where she sells charcoal. She started this business with a loan from her mother. She enjoys her business, because she has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal by the bag for her business, and she plans to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal by the bag, for her business,

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
Masudi is a married farmer living in the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. He has been involved in subsistence farming, mainly to meet the family's needs. He now plans to invest more into farming, and maybe he will do cash crop farming.

He was invited to join Milango by his friends, and he joined to access capital. Masudi is applying for a loan of 10,650 Kenyan shillings to pay for seeds, fertilizer and labor. He believes this is a good venture, which will help to improve his family's food security. The extra income will go toward loan repayment and meeting other family needs.

loans.use: To pay for seeds, fertilizer and labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Asata

texts.en:
Asata is 28 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school.  She lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia.  For the past six years, she has been operating a provision shop where she sells soft drinks, rice, soap, and other items. She earns a large profit although sometimes she has fewer customers. 

Asata is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more soft drinks, rice, soap, biscuits, and other items to expand her business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, rice, soap, biscuits, and other items.

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her early 20s, is married, with one small baby. She has been running a charcoal business for three years now.  She works from 8.00am to 7.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Salma's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania Ltd.  She used the previous loans to buy a TV set, a refrigerator, a mattress, and a bed; covered household expenses; and bought more stock of charcoal. She has successfully paid back all her loans. 

Salma hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, 'Blue Group,' which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Yamileth de 30 años de edad, originaria de Matagalpa, pero actualmente vive en Estelí, soltera,  madre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 4 y 13 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica  al negocio de pulpería. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio vendiendo chiverías, la  cual poco a poco  fue  incrementando el inventario de su pulpería, y de esta manera ha podido obtener mejores ganancias,  y   hacer crecer su negocio, ella se siente muy satisfecha  porque  obtiene ingresos a diarios, cuenta con clientes fijos en su pulpería, este ha sido su primer negocio. Sus expectativas es ampliar su pulpería en una distribuidora para poder ofrecer de todos los productos más solicitado por sus clientes.
Es por esta razón que ella está solicitando el financiamiento  para comprar  arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, pan, jabón, etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a comprar  toda la mercadería en general que aún no tiene en existencia de su inventario, con el propósito de obtener mejores ganancias  en su negocio y  hacerlo crecer.
texts.en:
30-year old Yamileth was born in Matagalpa but now lives in Estelí. She is a single mother with two children aged 4 and 13 and earns her living running a general store. She started out selling dairy products and then gradually added other items. In this way she was able to earn more money and grow her business.

Yamileth feels happy because she has a daily income and regular customers. This is her first business. Her plan is to expand the store so she can offer all the products most asked for by her customers.

For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, soap etc. She thinks that this loan will help her to buy all the merchandise that at the moment she does not stock. Then her income will be greater and she will be able to expand the store.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, bread, soap etc.

loans.name: Eyling Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eyling  de 41 años de edad, originaria de  Estelí, casada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de  7, 17 y 18 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio con ayuda de una amiga que le dio ideas para que emprendiera su propio negocio, la cual miro muy bueno y decidió establecer  la  venta de tortillas, negocio que le genera ingresos a diarios, ya que ella cuenta con clientes fijos, este ha sido su primer negocio, también recibe el apoyo de su esposo, sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio para que le genere más ganancias.
Eyling está requiriendo al financiamiento para comprar, maíz y leña. Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar  todos los  productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus tortillas, sus planes futuros es  incrementar sus ventas con el objetivo de poder salir adelante con su familia, una de sus metas es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.
texts.en:
41-year old Eyling is a native of Estelí. She is married and has three children aged 7, 17, and 18. She sells tortillas, a business she began with help from a friend who gave her ideas for businesses she might start. She felt that a tortilla business was a good idea and would bring in a good income on a daily basis. Eyling now has regular customers.

This is her first business and her husband also helps her. Her hope is to expand the business and thus generate a greater income.

Eyling is seeking a loan to buy corn and firewood. She thinks that the money will help her buy all the products necessary for making tortillas. Her plan for the future is to increase sales so that she can help her family get ahead. One of her goals is to improve the building where she makes the tortillas.

loans.use: buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Satto

texts.en:
Satto is 24 years old and has five children who attend school.  She lives in Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. For the past five years, she has been running a table, where she sells oil, salt, vita, peppers, and others items. She started this business with help from her mother. 

Satto is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more oil, salt, vita, rice, peppers and others items for her business.  Her plan is to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase oil, salt, vita, rice, peppers and others items.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 37 years old, single and lives in Kakata Town.  It is the capital city of Margibi County and the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She has three children between the ages of 2 and 12 that are in school and live at home.   She stopped her education at 9th grade.

For the past seven years she has been selling charcoal from a table in the market. She focuses on charcoal because the consumption of charcoal in Liberia is very high.  She established the business with a loan from her mother. She enjoys the independence her income gives her. She is requesting a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. Her plans are to build a shop and a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Lakheswar Self Help Group

texts.en:
Lakheswar Self Help Group was formed with nine members in 2006 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They chose Pramila as the leader of their group. The lady standing first from the right side of the photograph is Pramila. She is a 35-year-old woman living with her husband and her son, aged 11. 

Since ten years ago, Pramila’s husband has been working as a farmer to manage his small family. It is not sufficient to manage the family. So Pramila is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in the milk business. She has three years experience in this business. She has requested a loan to buy a cow and fodder so that she can support her family’s income.

Pramila says that by selling milk, she can support her family and she can send her son to a good school; through that, she can provide a better education to her son.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fodder for her business.

loans.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Juana se preocupa por la humanidad, ya que por vocación de servirles a los demás  se decidió estudiar auxiliar de enfermería, de la cual tiene 36 años de ejercer tan noble labor, trabaja en un centro de salud de la zona donde habita, es soltera con 4 hijos a su cargo los que le brinda el apoyo necesario como madre,  actualmente está solicitando un pequeño financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda la cual está en mal estado, y lo utilizara en la compra de Cemento, Arena, Zinc, Alfajillas y Mano de Obra, para construir Bajarete, Techo y Piso de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que con mucho esfuerzos ha venido realizando.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana has always been concerned about people. In order to serve others she decided to study to become a nursing assistant and has been engaged in this noble profession for 36 years. She works in a health centre near her home. 

Juana is single but responsible for four children whom she supports like a mother. She is seeking a small loan to improve her home which is in poor condition. She wishes to buy cement, sand, zinc roofing, wood posts, and hire a builder to construct walls, a roof, and flooring. This will improve the condition of her home which she has been working hard to do.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, zinc roofing, wood posts, and hire a builder

loans.name: Adile

texts.en:
Adile, twenty-two years old, is married and a young mother of two children. She and her family live in a village in a southern part of Kosovo in very bad conditions. 

In order to earn a living, her husband works transporting goods for others and earns a very small income. Adile, along with her husband, is now planning to buy a horse as a way of providing and transporting goods, such as wood and other materials, for others. This business is the only main source of income for the family. 

Adile is now requesting a loan in order to purchase this horse, which will help them to increase the family income. Her goal is to improve the living conditions and overall quality of life for her family. She hopes in the future to give her children a better education and wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a horse for transporting goods.

loans.name: Yesenia Maria

texts.es:
Yesenia de 32 años de edad, originaria  Estelí, casada, madre de 2 hijos, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de carnes. Inicio su actividad laboral  a la edad de 26 años, con capital propio, dinero que le dio su marido,  la cual ha podido establecer su negocio de venta de carne,  ella se siente muy satisfecha ya que le genera ganancias a diarias  porque cuenta con clientes fijos, este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es ampliar el área del local en donde tiene  su negocio.
Ella esta requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar carne de res y cerdo.  Ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayuda a incrementar sus ventas de carnes, para obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es poder ofrecer más variedad de carne a  sus clientes, una de sus metas próxima es  cancelar el crédito para luego volver a solicitar otro para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 32 years old and is originally from Estelí.  She’s married and is the mother of two children.  She sells different kinds of meat and started doing this when she was 26, with money that her husband gave her.  She is very satisfied because it generates daily earnings and she has steady customers.  This is her first business and she wants to expand it.

She needs this loan to buy beef and pork.  She expects this loan to help increase her sales and income.  Her future plans are to be able provide a better variety of meat to her customers.  One of her next goals is to pay off this loan and then request another one for her business.

loans.use: to buy beel and pork.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona es una mujer emprendedora junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos ellos se dedican a la actividad de la siembra y cultivo de papa, ella tiene una amplia experiencia en esta actividad que aprendió hace más de 20 años dicha actividad que fue enseñada por sus padres a los cuales ella les agradece por haberle regalado e inculcado el respeto a su prójimo el amor a DIOS y a la familia y lo mas importante en esta vida haberle enseñado a trabajar.

Simona tiene un grado de educación primaria que curso hasta el 4 grado; pero con mucho esfuerzo hizo que sus hijos siguieran estudiando y pudiesen realizare, hoy en día cuenta con el apoyo de sus esposo y sus hijos mismos que agradecen el esfuerzo de sus padres, su producto es comercializado y vendido a través de los intermediarios en el mercado local, en la actualidad parte de la tierra que utiliza Simona para la siembra y cultivo de papa es alquilada y para poder llegar a su área de trabajo caminan una hora aproximadamente.

Simona actualmente solicita ayuda para comprar semilla e insumos agrícolas para la siembra de papas actividad por medio de la cual ha podido salir adelante con su familia, ha podido ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, alimentos, vestimenta, etc.

El sueño de Simona es poder comprar un terreno el cual pueda ser trabajado propiamente y poder realizar sus cultivos para así poder obtener ganancias propias en su totalidad que ayuden al crecimiento de su negocio, a tener un mejor estilo de vida y que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Simona is an enterprising woman. She, her husband, and their four children grow potatoes. She has extensive experience in this work that she learned more than 20 years ago. This livelihood was taught her by her parents, whom she is grateful to for having given her and instilled in her, respect for her neighbor, and love of God and family. Most importantly in this life, they taught her to work. 

Simona has a primary school education and went as far as 4th grade. But with a great deal of effort she has enabled her children to continue studying.  Today she has the help of her husband and of their children, who are grateful for the parents' efforts. 

Their crop is marketed and sold through the middlemen in the local market. Currently, part of the land that Simona uses for growing potatoes is rented, and in order to reach their farmland they walk for approximately an hour.

Simona is currently requesting help in order to buy seeds and agricultural supplies for growing potatoes, work that has enabled her and her family to move forward in life. She has been able to provide her children with education, food and clothing. 

Simona's dream is to be able to buy a piece of land that can be properly farmed, where they can raise their crops, and this way obtain profits that will be completely their own, and help their business grow. This will enable them to have a better standard of living and ensure that their children can continue going to school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and supplies for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Jennet

texts.en: Jennet is 34 years old and lives in the area of Kakata Town, the capital city of Margibi County, which is the highest producing rubber plantation in Liberia. She’s married and a high school graduate. With little income from her husband who is a motorcyclist, she is determined to make their lives better by engaging in a small fabric sales business. Jennet has been in this business for five years now and she enjoys the flow of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fabric to sell to enable her to build a shop for her fabric business. Her dream is to become a houseowner in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beehives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Juraqul

texts.ru: Журакул житель Яванского района. Ему 48 лет. Он женат, отец 4-х детей. Один сын работает трудовым мигрантом. Сам Журакул зарабатывает на жизнь услугой такси. Он возит пассажиров на своем личном автомобиле. Журакул занимается этой деятельностью уже 18 лет. Он просит кредит у организации для ремонта своей автомашины. Надеется, что это улучит процесс его работы.
texts.en:
Juraqul is a 48-year-old resident of the Yavan region. He is married and has four children. One of his sons is a migrant worker. 

Juraqul himself has been working as a taxi driver for 18 years. He drives his clients in his own car. He is requesting this loan to repair his car, which he hopes will improve the operation of his business.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beehives and pay for their colonization.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, who appears in the photo, is a 49-year-old, married man and a father to one son and five daughters. He is a school teacher and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Ahmad is a very ambitious man and always thinking of his family's future, to always offer to them better living conditions.

Ahmad also is a university student who wants to complete his Master's degree studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Ahmad and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Tukolere Wamu Farmers Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of men and women who are typical farmers located outside the city on route to the western part of the country. Rovinsa, a divorcee, joined the group because she could not get far on her own and therefore needed external help in the form of a loan. After the divorce, the husband neglected her and the children whom she has to single handedly provide for all their needs. 

Rovinsa makes bricks to supplement her meager income. Her main challenges are unpredictable weather changes and an unstable market. She will use part of the loan to buy a piece of land to enlarge the farming area and the remaining balance to clear tuition arrears for her children.

To be able to fend for seven children and a dependent takes hard work and determination, which Rovinsa has totally embraced and so have all the group members.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Osaid

texts.en:
Osaid is a 19-year-old, single man. He lives with his family in Kofor Raaee village near Jenin. His father and mother are employed and both are getting low salaries, which barely cover the family's needs.

Osaid is studying at the university, specializing in Accounting. Osaid wants to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Osaid and improve the family's living conditions. Osaid is shown in the picture.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Dina Margarita

texts.es: Dina Margarita de cuarenta años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la venta de comida desayunos y almuerzos, frijoles, gallina, carne, verduras, arroz, sopas, bebidas, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en la preparación de comidas, gracias a eso obtiene las mejores ganancias, comercia desde su hogar y  ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además de un buen servicio; Dina es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y con muchas metas que desea lograr, quiere ganarse un futuro mas prospero y trabajara duro hasta alcanzar el éxito que tanto desea, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz, carnes, verduras, bebidas, etc. Dina Margarita tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Dina Margarita, 40, lives with her children in her own house.  She works selling food like breakfasts, lunches, beans, chicken, meat, vegetables, rice, soups and beverages.  She’s been in business several years and has gained much experience preparing food.  Thanks to this she earns better profits.  She sells from home and has many customers because people prefer her because everything she sells is top quality at affordable prices and service is good.

Dina’s an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work and who has many goals she wants to reach.  She wants to earn a more profitable future for herself and to work hard to reach the success she so desires.  

In recent weeks demand has increased and she wants to take advantage of it to make a new investment which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy corn, meats, vegetables, beverages, etc.  Dina Margarita has good payment references and flawless morals; she’s sure that she will repay the loan while at the same time is confident that she’ll provide her family with a fulfilled life.

loans.use: to buy corn, meats, vegetables and beverages.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi, who appears in the picture, is a 28-year-old, married man and a father to two daughters. Fadi is employed and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Fadi is a very ambitious man who is looking to improve himself and create better living conditions for his family. 

Fadi is studying at the university, specializing in Business Administration. Fadi wants to complete his studies by paying the university fees, so he is requesting a USD 1,250 loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Fadi and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has five children with four of them currently in school. For the past five years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small shoe business. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more school-going shoes for resale, and will help Florence to generate greater profits and pay half the school fees for her children. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to own a residential house. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more school-going shoes for resale

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en: Ibrahem is a 35-year-old married man. He is a school teacher who earns a low salary that is not enough to cover all of his family's needs. Ibrahem is looking to improve his position at work to increase his income and to live in better conditions. Ibrahem is studying at the university, specializing in Business Administration. Ibrahem wants to complete his studies, so he is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the university fees. This will ensure a better future for Ibrahem and improve his family's living conditions. Ibrahem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To pay his university fees

loans.name: Omri

texts.en:
Omri is a 27-year-old married man with no children yet. He lives in a modest house with his wife and has a small grocery store, where he sells different types of groceries. The store has been profitable and is his only source of income.

Omri and his wife are suffering from a water leak in their house, which has increased in the winter season. Omri wants to fix this matter, so he is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN. He will use the loan to purchase the necessary materials and hire workers to fix the part of the roof that is causing the water leak. This will create for Omri and his wife suitable home conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house. Omri is photographed inside his house.

loans.use: To fix his leaking roof.

loans.name: Juana Marizol

texts.es:
Juana es una señora bien Optimista en cuanto al desarrollo académico ostenta la especialidad de Licenciada en administración de empresa, contador y actualmente está estudiando licenciatura en maestra de educación primaria, es Casada con 2 hijos a su cargo, a los  que tiene que proporcionarles  las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen, estudian en los colegios del municipio, tanto en secundaria como en primaria.

Una de las necesidades que la señora  Juana  atraviesa hoy en día es de graduarse como licenciada en educación primaria, producto del gran esfuerzo realizado para alcanzar tan deseado sueño, ya que debido a esta necesidad, le `permitió tomar la decisión de visitar  ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para realizar los estudios de sus sueños,  el que le beneficiara aun mas en su centro laboral, por el nivel académico que presentaría, lo que de paso le vendría mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana is a very optimistic lady who is trained as a company administrator, accountant and is currently studying for a master’s degree in primary education.  She’s married and has two children and she wants to provide them with the best conditions so that they can develop and study in the local schools, both in middle and elementary schools. 

One of Juana’s needs is to graduate with her master’s in education; the result of great effort to achieve her dream.  This allowed her to make the decision to visit Ceprodel to request a loan to be able to study.  This will benefit her even more in her work and allow her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Javi Rakel

texts.es:
Javy es una joven casada y madre de familia luchadora, emprendedora con deseos de superarse y seguir adelante ella ha enfrentado un obstáculo con sus estudios ya que sus padres son de bajos recursos y no le pudieron dar la oportunidad de estudiar, junto a su esposo decidieron buscar mejores oportunidades para salir adelante tomando en cuenta que contaban con un enorme potencial LA JUVENTUD, LA SALUD y enormes deseos de hacer otra actividad más que ser simplemente una ama de casa, su esposo dedicado desde toda su vida a labrar la tierra en donde lo que él hace es para poder llevar lo necesario a la casa, ambos vieron la necesidad de que uno de los dos tenía que ver la forma de generar un poco mas de ingresos, por lo que se le presento a javy la oportunidad de poder sacar un curso de belleza impartido por FUDEIMFA brazo técnico de la cooperativa COMIXMUL. gracias a esta oportunidad aprendió a valerse de una forma distinta, ella se capacito en cortes de cabello de mujer y de hombre, actualmente ella visita casa por casa atendiendo personas de todas las edades solo con 2 tijeras una capa y dos peines.

JAVY actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de herramientas y materiales para trabajar como ser: secadora y plancha para el cabello, una silla, espejos, mesa, capas, peines y cepillos ya que en la comunidad donde ella vive hace mas de 6 meses instalaron la energía eléctrica lo que le facilita su trabajo para realizar sus servicios.

Su sueño es tener un salón de belleza el cual pueda generar ingresos para poder ayudar a su esposo con la canasta básica y otros gastos que a diario se presentan e ir ahorrando para darle a su hijo un mejor futuro para que el tenga mejores oportunidades que ellos y pueda superarse.
texts.en:
Javy is a young married woman and a hard-working parent. She is enterprising, and has the desire to improve herself and get ahead in life. She has faced an obstacle with her education, as her parents are low income and couldn't give her the opportunity to go to school. 

She and her husband decided to look for opportunities to succeed, considering that they had tremendous potential in terms of youth, good health, and her strong desire for an additional livelihood apart from being just a housewife. Her husband has worked the land all his life, where his work enables him to support the household. 

Both saw the need for one of the two to find a way of generating a bit more income, and an opportunity arose for Javy to take a beauty salon course offered by FUDEIMFA, the technical arm of the COMIXMUL cooperative. Thanks to this opportunity, she learned to fend for herself in a different way. She trained in cutting men's and women's hair. Currently she goes from house to house, serving people of all ages, with only two pairs of scissors, a cape and two combs.

Javy is now requesting help to buy tools and supplies for work, such as a hair dryer and hair iron, a chair, mirrors, a table, capes, combs and brushes. In the community where she lives, they installed electricity six months ago, which makes it easier for her to provide her services.

Her dream is to have a beauty salon that can generate income, so that she can help her husband with the basic household expenses and other costs that arise daily. She also hopes to begin saving so that she can give her son a better future. This is so that he will have better opportunities then they had, and can excel.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
In his own words, this is what Jackson has to say. "I have been in the restaurant business for the last 40 years, with my late wife who used to get loans for the business from UGAFODE until she passed away in 2012, after a long illness. I also started getting financial help from UGAFODE in 2005, which has boosted my restaurant (Pop In) in Rukungiri town. It has become popular and it has grown tremendously in the recent years. I have been able to educate my children and to take good care of my family.

 I will use this particular loan to buy food items and utensils for the restaurant.

"I would like to take this opportunity to thank UGAFODE for its services and for giving me the opportunity to be part of it and its good customer services, given to us. I am really grateful for the services and, to the Kiva lenders, I want to say thank you in advance. I am so excited to be partnering with you." 

-- Jackson

loans.use: To buy stock for the restaurant, in the form of food and utensils.

loans.name: Sadra

texts.en:
She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sadra has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more different fashionable clothes for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and open up a stationery business. Sadra hopes that in the future she will be able to own a very big stationery store. 

Sadra is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more different fashionable clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Madrine

texts.en:
Madrine is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kisekende in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Madrine has been working hard to manage her small grocery shop, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Madrine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh foods such as raw bananas and baking flour for making donuts for resale, and will help Madrine to generate greater profits and take care of herself and buy new clothes. Madrine hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a big store for her goods. 

Madrine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods such as raw bananas and baking flour for making donuts for resale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
She is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her poultry farm, which sells chicks. 

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more poultry feeds and chicks for resale, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and provide some basic needs for her family. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to own a primary school. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more poultry feeds and chicks for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 17 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who are both currently in school.For the past two years, Rose has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soft drinks such as lemonade and passion fruit juice and a fridge for cooling, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children and also renovate her chicken farm house. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to build her own house. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks such as lemonade and passion fruit juice, and a fridge

loans.name: Maria Ofelia

texts.es: Maria Ofelia de cincuenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, leche, pan, jabones, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, la tienda esta ubicada en su vivienda en una comunidad muy transitada de personas , ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque es la tienda mas surtida con productos de calidad, a muy buenos precios y además con un servicio excelente; Maria es una mujer emprendedora, activa, dedicada a su labor y con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le abran camino al éxito, como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio pero necesita realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, producto instantáneo, bebidas, jabones, etc. Maria Ofelia  tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable se siente muy agradecida con la ayuda, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Ofelia is fifty-two years old and lives with her life partner in their own home.  She has a store where she sells basic-need items, like bulk grains, milk, bread, soap products, and other items.  She has been in this business for several years and has had a lot of experience in sales, which allows her to obtain the best profits.  

The store is located in her home, which is in a community that has a lot of foot traffic.  She already has a lot of customers; the people prefer her because the store is well-supplied with high-quality products at good prices.  Furthermore, she provides excellent service.  Maria is an enterprising and active woman, who is dedicated to her work and has a lot of drive to move forward.  She is always looking for new opportunities that will open a path to success. 

Like all good saleswomen, she wants to increase her business but needs to make new investments.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy bulk grains, snacks, instant foods/beverages, drinks, soap products, etc.  Maria Ofelia has good payment references and is very responsible.  She is very thankful for the help, and assures that she will be able to pay off the debt while being able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, snacks, instant foods/beverages, drinks, and soap products.

loans.name: Carlina

texts.en:
This is Carlina, 52. She is a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She also has a printing business for additional income.

Carlina operates a mineral water station. She retails mineral water to her customers and sells by the container (5 gallons per container) with a profit. Her regular customers for her mineral water are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to upgrade her facilities and buy more stock of mineral water to expand capacity. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Carlina dreams to expand her business and dreams to have more businesses. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the upgrade of her facilities and buy more stock of mineral water  to expand capacity.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, age 42 and a resident of Malibay, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jolito, and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilou operates a food vending business. She sells different fruits like pineapple, watermelon, cucumber and other fruits ready to be eaten. She also sells juices and cooked quail eggs. Marilou earns a minimum of PHP 300 per day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fruits and quail eggs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Marilou hopes that her business will grow, and dreams of providing a quality education for her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy different fruits like watermelon, cucumber, pineapple and other fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
This is Apolinaria, 55, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She and her children are helping each other in managing their house and providing income for their everyday expenses.          

Apolinaria owns and oversees the operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of her jeepney unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Apolinaria hopes to have bigger capital for her growing business and dreams to have a good and peaceful life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

-Jeepneys are the most popular means of public transportation in the Philippines. They were originally made from US military jeeps left over from World War II and are known from their flamboyant decoration and crowded seating. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. They have become a ubiquitous symbol of Philippine culture. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
This is Bienvenida. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of herbal medicines and food supplements. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She now owns an air conditioner and refrigerator repair shop for additional income. She and her husband, Celso, are helping each other to provide income to their family.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 20,000 PHP, to buy other tools for her repair shop and for the salary of her workers. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Bienvenida hopes to expand her business and have other branches. She dreams that her youngest child will finish her studies. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for other tools of the repair shop and for the salary of the workers.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
This is Eliza. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She is now in a buy and sell business where she sells different products like squid, shrimp, onions, vegetables and other products. Her business is expanding. She and her husband are working hard to continually provide income for their family.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy squid, shrimp, onions, vegetables and other products for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Eliza dreams to expand and have more employees for her business. She hopes that her children will finish their studies. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different products like squid, shrimp, onions, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en:
Ursula is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has engaged in a rice farming business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income.
Ursula dreams of expanding her business but lacks the financial resources to do so. With this, she desires to avail a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. She believes that through this, Ursula will be able to improve their harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a 34-year-old, married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has five children. The youngest child is 4, while the eldest is 16 years old. She is engaged in making native baskets. She makes them out of nito (native palm). She has been in the basket-making business for 17 years. Her husband is a welder in one of the shops in their community.

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase nito (native palm) and wicker (woven fiber formed into a rigid material, usually used for baskets or furniture) with which to produce more baskets. In the future, she would like to invest in other ventures, to generate more income that she could use to support her family, including sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy nito (native palm) and wicker with which to make baskets.

loans.name: Fatimata

texts.fr:
Née vers 1961, FATIMATA  est une veuve et mère de 7 enfants qui vit avec ses  enfants dans la ville  de Koutiala. 
N’ayant pas eu la chance de fréquenter l’école, FATIMATA s’est basée depuis quelques années sur le commerce de diverses marchandises notamment : les draps de lit, les couvertures, les  colliers en perles, etc. 
Pour pouvoir remédier aux petites ruptures qu’elle subit et qui la fait perdre des clients, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle  il y’a plus de 6 ans.  Après avoir pris des prêts  en solidaire ( prêt du groupe )  qui ont été tous correctement  remboursés, elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel et  tous les trois précédents ont été bien remboursés.  
Elle compte acheter, une douzaine de draps et 10 couvertures avec ce prêt. Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente  au grand marché et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte au comptant. Avec le renforcement de son fonds de commerce, elle compte sur un bénéfice moyen de 60.000FCFA  par mois, qu’elle utilisera  pour payer les  intérêts de son prêt,  participer aux dépenses familiales et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1961, FATIMA is a widow and the mother of seven children.  She lives with her children in the city of Koutiala.

Not having had the chance to attend school, Fatima has been involved for several years in sales of various items such as bed linens, blankets, pearl necklaces, etc. 

In order to address the shortages which cause her to lose customers, she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso more than 6 years ago in order to satisfy her customers’ demand.  After having taken out group loans which were all properly repaid, she is on her fourth individual loan,  the preceding three having been repaid. 
She plans to buy a dozen sheets and ten blankets with this loan.  She gets her supplies in Koutiala from wholesalers and makes her sales at the main market and on foot to a mixed clientele, for cash.  With this increase in her working capital, she plans to make an average profit of 60,000 FCFA per month, which she will use to pay the interest on her loan and to contribute to family expenses, and will invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy various items such as bed linens, blankets, and pearl necklaces.

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem is a 28-year-old young man. He is married and is a father to two sons. He is employed, but he explains that his low salary is not enough to cover all of his family's needs.

Salem has finished building a small house (he is photographed in the new house) and he now wants to finish the house's inside, such as by painting and decorating the house. As a result, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 from FATEN to cover the costs of purchasing paints and decorations for the house. In this way, the loan proceeds will provide Salem and his family with suitable living conditions and will enable them to enjoy living in their new house.

loans.use: To paint and decorate his new house

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old, married, and has 10 children. Rodrigo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. He has been engaged in his business for seven years and earns 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rodrigo joined GDMPC. Rodrigo is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which he will use to obtain farm chemicals. He plans to use the additional profit generated by the business, to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to obtain farm inputs for cultivating bananas.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad, originario de la Comarca las Banderas, de las afueras de Teustepe, casado, padre de 1 hijo de 17 años, actualmente está estudiando su quinto año de secundaria, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta y compra de piedra cantera. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio desde muy joven con ayuda de un amigo quien le alquilaba un camión para que saliera a vender piedra cantera de forma ambulante, el cual ha podido incrementar sus  ventas y ha obtenido mejores ganancias, ya que con las ganancias obtenidas pudo comprar su primer camión, del que es propietario hace más de 15 años, este ha sido su primer negocio.
Sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio. Es por esta razón que él  está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar más piedra cantera. El  estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar más piedras por mayor, con el objetivo obtener ingresos extra,  sus planes futuros  es poder cancelar el crédito para luego volver a solicitar.
texts.en:
José, 46, is from the Las Banderas region, from the outskirts of Teustepe.  He's married and the father on a 17-year-old child who is currently in his fifth year of secondary studies.

He's a merchant by trade and makes a living buying and selling quarry stone.  He started in the field of commerce when he was very young with the help of a friend who rented him a truck so he could go out to sell quarry stone on foot.  He has been able to increase his sales and earned better profits because with his profits he was able to buy his first truck, which he has owned for more than 15 years.  This was his first business.
 
His expectation is to expand his business.  This is why he needs the loan to buy more quarry stone.  He thinks this loan would help him buy more stone wholesale, with the goal of earning extra income.  His future plans are to pay back the loan and request another one.

loans.use: to buy more quarry stone

loans.name: Lila Devi

texts.en: Lila is 43 year old and lives with her husband, Puspa, as well as their two sons and daughter in the Bara district of Nepal. They have been running a family grocery store for the past 11 years, which they started with just NPR 15,000. The grocery store has helped support the family but is not enough, so they have acquired a small area in the main market to sell their goods, and Lila has requested a loan of NPR 100,000 to expand their grocery business.

loans.use: To expand the family's grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase varieties of synthetic hair and hair product for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two  dairy cows.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Santa Rosa del Peñón un pequeño pueblo, donde existen diversas actividades comerciales, es aquí donde habita la joven Ana Julia de 45 años de edad.

Ana Julia es una madre soltera, es maestra de educación primaria labora en una comarca de santa rosa del peñon desde hace 17 años, cuenta con una hija quien está estudiando en la universidad, a duras penas ella mantiene los gastos universitario de su hija, pero también ve de gran Necesidad, mejorar su vivienda, por tal razón solicita un financiamiento a Kiva Y Ceprodel para la compra de: Cemento, ladrillo y Arena, con esto cubriría parte de su necesidades. 

Cuenta con una buena salud, su honestidad y su buen record crediticio que le han ido mejorando su vivienda. 

 Agradece a Dios por haberle iluminado de poder Solicitar un Crédito con Ceprodel y Kiva y espera que le brinden el financiamiento para poder llegar a obtener parte de sus principales sueños.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa del Peñón is a small town, and host to various commercial activities. It is here that Ana Julia lives. She is 45 years old.

Ana Julia is a single mother.  She is a primary education teacher, and has worked in the Santa Rosa del Penon region for 17 years.  She has a daughter that is studying at the university. She barely maintains her daughter's university expenses, but she also sees improving her home as a great necessity, so she is asking for financing from Kiva and Ceprodel to buy cement, bricks and sand. With this she will cover part of her needs.

She counts on her good health, honesty, and her good credit record, which have been improving her home.

She thanks God for having enlightened her that she can request a loan with Ceprodel and Kiva, and she hopes that they will provide her the financing to be able to achieve part of her biggest dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks and sand

loans.name: Yeris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yeris del Carmen habita en el municipio de El Sauce, pueblo lleno de costumbres religiosas donde todos sus pobladores se conocen y trabajan por el bien de la comunidad ayudando al más necesitado.

Es una mujer de 39 años, casada que le apasiona la lectura y que le hubiera gustado estudiar Licenciatura en Español pero por la extrema pobreza y por falta de recursos económicos de su familia solo pudo llegar hasta el tercer año de secundaria e iniciar a trabajar para ayudarle a su mamá con los gastos del hogar.

Es por eso que es una mujer cansada por el trabajo que ha desempeñado desde su corta edad y que hoy se dedica a la venta de comida rápida por las noches ubicado en su vivienda donde generalmente en Nicaragua se le llama fritanga lo cual ofrecen carne asada, tacos, tajadas.


Hoy en la actualidad es responsable del bienestar de su mamá y quiere darle lo mejor recompensado todo lo buena que fue a pesar de las dificultades que pasaron.

Con el fin de darle mejor atención a sus clientes en cuanto a la comida que ofrece está solicitando el apoyo de kiva para que le financien un crédito a través de Ceprodel para la compra de plátanos verdes, arroz, aceite, carne de cerdo, salsa de tomate, plátanos maduros y frijoles.
texts.en:
Yeris del Carmen lives in the town of El Sauce, a community full of religious customs where all the inhabitants know each other and work for the good of the community by helping the most needy.

She's a 39-year-old married woman who's passionate about reading and who would like to have studied for an advanced degree in Spanish.  Because of her family's extreme poverty and lack of financial resources, however, she only managed to finish the second year of her secondary education when she had to start working to help her mother with the household expenses.

This is why she's a woman who's tired from the work she has done since she was very young, and who now makes a living at night in her home selling fast food generally known here as "fritanga," selling grilled meat, tacos, and plantains.

Currently she's responsible for the well-being of her mother and she wants to give her the best to repay her for how good she was despite the difficulties they had.

With the goal of giving the best customer service with regard to the food she sells, she's requesting the support of Kiva to finance a loan through CEPRODEL so she can buy green bananas, rice, oil, pork, tomato sauce, ripe bananas, and beans.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, rice, oil, pork, tomato sauce, bananas, and beans

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre comerciante de 26 años de edad. El está casado y vive en Sololá junto a su esposa la cual trabaja independientemente apoyando  la economía de su familia.
El se dedica a la producción de manzanas en parcelas que tiene arrendado en una aldea del departamento vecino Quiche. Esta actividad lo realizan sus padres ya que es una fruta que se produce bastante en la aldea y fue donde aprendió desde hace muchos años  pero por falta de capital económico no fue su principal trabajo.
Años después Tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir una pequeña parcela para retomar esta actividad teniendo ahora 3 año de ser independiente en esta producción y el ve que la rentabilidad es muy buena para seguir mejorando la economía de su familia, de este modo el solicita un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para comprar fertilizante y darle el mejor mantenimiento a los arboles de manzana y de esta manera obtener muy buena cosecha y ganancias para este año.
Sueña que en un futuro con las ganancias que le genere esta producción logre la apertura de un nuevo negocio y seguir ampliando la plantación de manzanas en otra parcela.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 26-year-old businessman. He is married and lives in Sololá with his wife, who works independently to support the family. 

He earns his living growing apples on plots of land he has rented in a neighboring Quiche district. His parents also grew apples because it is a fruit that is widely produced in the area. There, he learned how to grow apples, but due to a lack of finances, it was not his primary job. 

Years later, he had the opportunity to acquire a plot of land to begin growing apples again. Currently, he has 3 years of experience doing this independently. 

He sees the profitability of this business to continue improving his family's financial stability. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 5,000.00 Quetzales to buy fertilizer so he can maintain his trees better, thereby creating a better harvest and increasing his earnings. 

He hopes to use the money from the apples to open a new business and continue growing apples on other plots of land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for maintain his apple trees.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which is a heavy pineapple-producing region. She has 6 children and has been doing this work for 40 years.  Her primary income sources are crops and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: She enjoys horticultural farming because of the high returns! Her biggest challenge is high input prices. Animals on the farm have been given the names of Kagoiya, Wambura, Munugu, Kabara.
Annah has been  in horticultural farming but has requested a loan of 10,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy  dairy goats for a venture into dairy farming.


When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, Annah replied that she needed loans to be able to expand her farming.  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, and she learned that she could expand her dairy farming through micro finance loans.

Annah's highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', she replied that she will be able to cater for the family's needs.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ann owns poultry and a bicycle but does not own a cow, pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household  a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, TV, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline, age 26, is a married lady and a mother of three children, ages 11, eight and four. She sells vegetables and fruits besides she also offers motorcycle transport for eight years, and  earns a monthly income of KES 33,000.

Jackline is servicing her second loan of KES. 100,000 from KADET LTD after she paid the previous one successfully. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new motorbike for her business.  

The profits she earns from her business will be used to pay the school fees of her children. She hopes to expand her grocery store and also see her children progress well in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a  new  motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Samuel Hipolito

texts.es:
Samuel es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Ocoña, Ciudad que se caracteriza por tener unas hermosas playas, asimismo en él se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz, también se desarrolla la pesca y sobre todo en esta ciudad se puede encontrar  varios platillos típicos en especial el Chupe de Camarones. Samuel es padre de familia y por ello cada día se esfuerza mucho para poder sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos a quienes ama con todo su corazón y por los cuales daría la vida con tal de verlos felices.

Día a día Samuel trabaja en su negocio como agricultor, sobre todo actualmente ha sembrado arroz y él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su familia; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y porque siempre tiene a Dios a su lado.

Samuel está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, podrá realizar el arao, entre otros, para poder darle un buen mantenimiento a su cultivo y de esta manera poder obtener una buena cosecha y seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser un gran microempresario”.
texts.en:
Samuel is a hard-working and enthusiastic man, who lives in the city of Ocoña. The city is characterized for having beautiful beaches as well as agriculture, especially rice. There is also a large fishing industry and you can find a lot of typical dishes such as Chupe de Camarones [typical shrimp dish] in this city. 

Samuel is a father. Each day he tries very hard to get ahead for his two children. He loves them with all his heart and he would give his life in order to see them happy. 

Samuel works as a farmer. Currently more than anything else, he has sowed rice. He works about eight hours a day and with the fruit of his labor he is able to pay for his families' expenses since he has two children.

He believes his business is going well because he's a very responsible person and he always has God on his side.

Samuel is very thankful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help he has been able to buy fertilizers which allow him to maintain his crops and have a good harvest. Also he is able to keep working every day in order to make his biggest dream come true" "to be a great micro-businessman".

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and irrigated crops.

loans.name: Nolberta Vicenta

texts.es:
Nolberta es una mujer muy entusiasta y trabajadora, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camaná, ciudad de clima caluroso, y en donde se cultiva el arroz más rico del mundo, así como también  los frejoles, garbanzo, entre otros.  Nolberta ha pasado por muchas adversidades ya que hace algunos años su esposo falleció y desde ese momento se armo de valor y fuerzas para luchar ya que tenía que sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos sola, pero a pesar de la tristeza lo pudo lograr. Cuando Nolberta tiene un tiempo libre le gusta ver películas al lado de su familia, también le gusta preparar su platillo favorito el cual es el Seco de Pollo. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar una carrera universitaria. 

Con mucho entusiasmo Nolberta trabaja como agricultora en su pequeña parcela, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias y aprendió este oficio gracias a sus hermanos; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajadora. 

Nolberta está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá dar mantenimiento a su cultivo como abonos, fertilizantes entre otros y poder tener una buena cosecha, con lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo y poder seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio”.
texts.en:
Nolberta is a very enthusiastic, hard-working woman who lives in Camaná.  The city has a warm climate and is also where some of the tastiest rice is grown, along with beans, chickpeas and other crops.  Nolberta has seen much adversity in her life and a few years ago her husband died.  Since then she has had to be courageous and struggle to provide for her three children on her own; and despite her sadness, she has been successful.  In her free time, Nolberta enjoys watching movies with family.  She also enjoys making her favorite meal: chicken stew.  Because of her family's scarce resources, she was only able to get a high school education, but she would have liked to go on to the university.

With a lot of enthusiasm, Nolberta works as farmer on her small patch of land where she spends 10 hours a day.  She learned the trade from her siblings and believes business is going well because she works very hard.

Nolberta is very grateful to Kiva lenders for their support.  Thanks to them she can buy crop supplies, such as fertilizers, etc., so she can achieve a good harvest.  This will allow her to continue growing and struggling daily to reach her goal:  "To have her own business location".

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other supplies.

loans.name: Antonia Paula

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 60 años, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, en el distrito de Ocoña con su esposo y sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar para solventar sus gastos, Antonio no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta tejer prendas de vestir y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Estofado de Carne para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Antonia se dedica a la agricultura, ella cuenta con una pequeña parcela donde siembra arroz y frejoles, Antonia trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y manejo de su cultivo.
Antonia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo, de esta manera Antonia espera obtener una buena cosecha, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda, a fin de brindar mayor seguridad y bienestar para su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia is 60 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the city of Camaná in the district of Ocoña. She loves her husband and three children and says they are her main reason for living. Antonia is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who, along with her husband, dedicates all of her efforts to providing for her family. Regrettably, although she would have liked very much to study a professional career, she was not able to do so because of a lack of economic resources and needing to work to cover her expenses.

In her free moments Antonia likes to weave clothing, and on certain occasions she cooks a delicious Estofado de Carne [beef stew] to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with a lot of effort and determination, Antonia farms a small plot of land where she plants rice and beans. She works everyday from the early hours of the morning for approximately 10 hours. Antonia enjoys working her land, which she thinks does well because of her experience and crop management.

Antonia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their support she will be able to buy manure and fertilizers for her crop. In this way, she hopes to obtain a good harvest, and she will continue working and striving to achieve her greatest dream, which is to finish the construction of her home in order to increase her family’s security and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy children's school materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Santiago

texts.en:
Santiago is the son of Cifriano, who is also applying for a loan through Kiva. He lives with his wife Rebecca and five children in the village of San Jose. Cacao farming is a tradition that runs in the family, and Santiago has chosen to follow it with enthusiasm.

Cacao is great because it helps farmers with cash, says Santiago. There is little liquidity in the Mayan villages, where cacao is the only source of income for many a farmer. Santiago’s favorite time in the cacao growing cycle is harvest, because it brings in money and facilitates investment in home improvement among other things. In the near future he hopes to build a home that better accommodates his growing family. 

Two of Santiago and Rebecca’s children are currently of school age. The family hopes to put the kids through school so they can become professionals in their chosen field and get jobs in town. In Belize, schooling is not required past primary (6-14) education, and schools charge tuition for children enrolled in any level of education. 

The family is requesting this loan in order to do maintenance on the farm and expand by transplanting new seedlings. Maintenance includes cleaning and pruning the fields. Cleaning means cutting the underbrush to clear access to trees for harvest and pruning or preparing land for transplanting new trees. Cleaning is a routine activity for farmers living in the lush tropical lowlands and needs to be done three to four times per year. Pruning is the process of cutting the non-productive branches and is necessary to increase yields and prolong the lifetime of a cacao tree. Santiago plans to hire 15 people to help get the work done in one day.

loans.use: Cacao farm maintenance and expansion

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.en:
Eusebio, his wife Teresa and their nine children live in the village of San Jose. Eusebio, a cacao farmer of six years, likes the crop because it currently has a market. “My favorite part is because I got my children in high school,” he told Maya Mountain Cacao. In Belize, High School is not mandatory, and carries a tuition cost of 400 Belize Dollars (USD 200). 

The family hopes to put their put through school so they have access to the qualified job market. “I don’t know if I want them to farm, because it’s hard work. Better they study,” says Eusebio. Besides his native Maya Mopan, Eusebio also speaks Q'eqchi' and English.

Eusebio currently farms two acres planted with 700 cacao trees. He is requesting this loan to clean and prune his productive cacao. Cleaning means cutting the underbrush to clear access to trees for pruning, harvest or planting. It is a routine activity for farmers living in the lush tropical lowlands and needs to be done three to four times per year. To help with the task, Eusebio will hire 10-12 people to clean and prune his farm. Pruning is cutting the non-productive branches and is necessary to increase yields and prolong the lifetime of a cacao tree. 

In the near future, Eusebio hopes to expand his farm by one more acre. He is currently waiting for his young cacao trees to grow before transplanting new ones, as they require more care and attention. Besides cacao, the family grows corn, beans, rice and fruit trees. For income, they depend on the cacao and sell pumpkin seeds in neighboring Guatemala. The hardest thing about farming for Eusebio is the recurring shortage of money if one doesn’t have savings and the many rainy days during the wet season in Belize.

loans.use: Clean and prune cacao fields

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe and his wife Emiliana brought up 11 children, aged 14 to 37, all of whom live in the village of San Jose surrounded by the Maya mountains. The kids all took after the father to become farmers, and two of them also grow cacao encouraged by the growing market. 

Felipe got into cacao farming by buying an acre of already productive trees. Having gotten a taste for it, he is now planning to expand by planting 1,000 new plants. Instead of buying seedlings – transplant-ready cacao grown in bags for at least six months – Felipe will have an on-farm nursery where he will grow his own seedlings. The principal reason for the expansion is to support his children who can eventually take over. 

His favorite part about cacao farming is seeing the trees covered in pods and the time when everybody gets together for harvest.
