The less exciting side to cacao is cleaning and maintenance, says Felipe, as it keeps farmers in the fields and working hard. Besides cacao, Felipe also grows corn and beans, which he sells locally. 

Felipe is requesting this loan to hire help to set up the nursery as well as clean and prune his productive cacao trees. Cleaning means cutting the underbrush to clear access to trees for pruning and harvest or prepare the soil for transplanting new cacao seedlings. Pruning is the process of cutting the non-productive branches and is necessary to increase yields and prolong the lifetime of a cacao tree. The job will require as many as 30 people working for 10 days.

loans.use: Cacao farm maintenance and on-farm nursery

loans.name: Sabas Cristian

texts.es:
Don saba de 60 años de edad,  un humilde habitante de la Comarca San Gabriel, en las afueras de Teustepe, casada, padre de 4 hijos ya son independiente, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles y a la ganadería. Inicio hace 30 años  en el ámbito del comercio ayudándoles a otras personas cuidando una finca, ya que con el dinero que le pagaban, decidió ahorrar para emprender su propio negocio de siembra de maíz y venta de ganado, este ha sido su primer negocio, del cual se siente satisfecho con las ganancias que le genera este negocio a diario, él cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos.
Sus expectativas es incrementar sus ingresos, es por esta razón que Don  Saba está solicitando el financiamiento para comprar un camión. Ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudaría a  comprar el camión que necesita para poder transportar sus granos básicos a otros departamentos para venderlo a un buen precio, sus planes futuros es  cancelar el préstamo para luego volver a solicitar otro para poder comprar otro camión.
texts.en:
Sabas, 60, is a humble inhabitant of the San Gabriel region on the outskirts of Teustepe. He is married and the father of 4 children who are now independent. As a farmer, he makes a living by growing corn and beans, and also by ranching. He started 30 years ago in this area of trade  helping other people take care of an estate, since he decided to save the money they paid him to undertake his own business of growing corn and selling livestock. This has been his first business. He feels satisfied with the daily earnings that this business generates.He relies on the help of his children. 

His expectations are to increase his income; therefore, Sabas is requesting this loan to buy a truck. He estimates that this loan will help him to buy a truck, which will be used to transport his basic grains to regions to sell at a good price. Because of this, his future plans are to repay his loan and then apply for another one to buy another truck.

loans.use: to buy a truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cleaning cacao fields and transplanting new seedlings

loans.name: Gabino

texts.en:
Gabino, his wife Antonia and six children live in the village of San Jose. Four of the kids are currently in school and one is being home-schooled. Gabino feels it’s important to invest in education, but also hopes his kids choose to continue the cacao growing tradition that has run in the family for two generations. “I remember when I was eight or nine, my dad grew cacao in the community across the river. I wanted to move and become a farmer like him,” Gabino tells Maya Mountain Cacao. Besides his native Maya Mopan, Gabino is also fluent in English.

His favorite part about cacao farming is working in the shade of the trees. Cacao farming is not easy, he confesses, adding that it is what helps his family get by. Besides cacao, the family gets modest income from selling corn, beans, fresh veggies and peanuts in the local market. Gabino says the family will continue farming cacao, and they have reason to be proud of their product. 

Gabino’s enthusiasm for cacao farming is contagious, he told us, as he recently got his brother to start and enjoy farming alongside his town job. Gabino is requesting this loan to hire two people for two weeks to help him clean and prune his 600 bearing cacao trees and clear access to the 500 trees newly planted in June. Besides the benefit of clearing access to the cacao trees, cutting the underbrush has the side benefit of producing firewood that can be used for the daily cooking activities. Pruning is an important investment for cacao farmers as it is said to increase yields in the coming season and extend the lifetime of cacao trees.

loans.use: Cleaning and pruning four acres of cacao

loans.name: Cifriano

texts.en:
Cifriano, age 64, and his wife Eusebia-Leona have brought up seven children, the youngest of who is already 20. One of his sons, Santiago, built a house next door and also started a cacao farm and is requesting a loan through Kiva. Cifriano has been farming cacao for five years and currently maintains 1,000 trees planted in three acres of lush tropical forest. 

Cifriano and his family live in the family of San Jose – Toledo’s cacao village extraordinaire. Most of the farmers here grow cacao for their main source of income. Farmers’ wives help out at harvest time, with fermentation and drying, and many also do crafts. Eusebia-Leona prepares materials for other jippi jappa palm weavers who then make the crafts for sale in town or nearby tourist-frequented Mayan ruins that abound in Toledo. 

The family is ready to invest in building a good house, so that their children can be better off than they were, Cifriano told Maya Mountain Cacao. His favorite part about cacao is the guaranteed market. A challenge, however, is maintaining it cleaned and pruned, says Cifriano. He is therefore requesting this loan to hire 10-15 people who could do the cleaning, pruning and planting in one day instead of him doing the work alone and over a long period of time. 

Cleaning means cutting the underbrush to clear access to trees for pruning and harvest or prepare the soil for transplanting new cacao seedlings. Transplanting means planting into the ground cacao seedlings that are typically raised in special bags for at least six months prior.

loans.use: Clean, prune and expand cacao farm

loans.name: Epiphanio

texts.en:
Epiphanio and his wife Romelia have four children, all of whom are currently in school. Everybody also does their bit with harvesting and the older kids are also starting to get into pruning – an activity that helps farmers bring up yields for the following harvest. 

Besides farming, Epiphanio owns and drives a school bus that transports countless kids from the village of San Jose to a high school in Toledo’s biggest town of Punta Gorda. Cacao is a good option for the family because it has a stable market, and the farm is close enough to the house that the kids can help out when they’re not busy with school and Epiphanio is out with the bus. His biggest challenge with cacao are the birds. “They like the cacao. There’s nothing I can do, so I just leave it for them,” he confesses. Epiphanio’s favorite thing about cacao farming is choosing the ripest pods for harvest.  

His vision for the future is building a nice home and perhaps starting a little business – a local convenience store. “Once you start getting a little bit of money, then you start saving, and maybe start a business,” he says. Epiphanio is requesting the loan to plant 800 trees, doubling his current crop. “I’m planting more four acres and want prepare and leave one farm for my son, who is now four years old,” he told Maya Mountain Cacao. Cacao trees take about five years to become productive and continue yielding for decades (sometimes ten!) thereafter.

loans.use: Clean cacao farm and transplant new seedlings

loans.name: Justo Patrocinio

texts.en:
Justo Patrocinio lives in the village of Santa Elena, on a road that leads to the Guatemalan border. Justo and his wife Irma have 8 children, the youngest of whom is four and the oldest 22. The older boys helped plant and take care of the cacao farm, and are now searching for jobs in town, while the younger are interested in and counted on for help around the farm. 

Justo likes farming cacao because it both brings in money and can be used to make your own chocolate drink. The drink of the Gods, as it was regarded by the ancient Mayas and limited to the elites, is very commonplace in the Maya communities today. You can make it by grinding the cacao beans (usually by hand) and molding cacao balls that can be dissolved in hot water for a rich and nutritious beverage. 

Justo is requesting this loan to hire five people for a week to help him clean four acres of cacao. Cleaning underbrush is a routine activity for cacao farmers in the tropical lowlands. Cacao grows in agroforestry-type ecosystems with varying levels of vegetation and on fertile jungle soil that is especially productive and non-selective about what it grows, so farmers have to be. 

Like few farmers in his village, Justo has diversified his crops and besides the typical combination of cacao, corn and beans, he grows fruit trees like starfruit and soursop, coffee and cardamom. “It’s hard when you start things because there’s no money at that point. I have to wait for harvest time,” he explains the difficulty in investing to diversify his farm. In the future, Justo wants to invest in more trees and do some reconstruction on the house. If he works hard this year, he says he might afford to buy a solar panel to illuminate the house before his daughter starts high school.

loans.use: Cleaning four acres of cacao farm

loans.name: Honorato

texts.en:
Honorato his wife Macrina and their five children live in the village of San Jose, in the Maya Mountains. A farmer from an early age, Honorato says farming is no joke, and wants to provide his children an education to help them get a head start. 

Honorato got into farming cacao five years ago encouraged by other farmers and by the promise of a stable and guaranteed market for the crop. He is now farming two acres – around 600 cacao trees. Honorato says cacao is a good crop because it’s long term: “you don’t have to replant it, just clean, prune and take good care.” The tricky part of cacao farming for Honorato has been the fungal pod rot disease Monilia, and the trees that go straight up without producing. “We call them suckers, because they suck the top of the soil without giving anything back,” he professed.  

His favorite thing about cacao is the moment after the trees are cleaned and pruned. “Then I really appreciate my field. Trees are looking nice and sailing with the breeze,” Honorato says with a smile, adding that harvest is also a fun time. 

With children between the ages of four and 17, and possibly one more in the planning, there are school fees to worry about. However, kids are indispensable assistants to help out at harvest. Macrina also helps with harvest, but also fermenting and drying as well as shelling and grinding cacao for the hot cacao drink that is omnipresent in Mayan homes. Honorato is asking for the loan to expand his farm by buying and transplanting 600 seedlings as well as cleaning two acres of cacao. Transplanting means planting seedlings raised in bags for at least six months into freshly cleaned soil. Cleaning is the process of cutting underbrush to clear access to trees for pruning and harvest or prepare soil for planting.

loans.use: Clean 2 acres of cacao farm and transplant new seedlings

loans.name: Firmo

texts.en:
Firmo, his wife Veronica and their eight children – aged two to 17 – live in the village of Pueblo Viejo. The family’s income comes mainly from cacao, rice and beans sold at the local PG market as well as Firmo’s maintenance job. 

A cacao farmer of five years, Firmo currently farms 2.5 acres with 500 sparsely planted cacao trees. He is requesting this loan to transplant 175 trees and clean his productive plants. Cleaning is a routine activity for cacao farmers working the land in the lush tropical lowlands. The money will be used to pay for around 170 hours of labor by fellow farmers and Pueblo Viejo villagers. 

Firmo enjoys cacao, because he sees the benefit it brings his family. Six of the kids are currently in school. “I’ll try my best to send them to school. I can do the farming, they can go,” he told Maya Mountain Cacao. If everything goes well in the farm, in the near future Firmo hopes to invest in a solar panel. Pueblo Viejo is outside the grid, making it difficult for kids to do their studying beyond daylight hours.  

For Firmo, the biggest challenge with cacao farming is the birds. “I try to arrive before they do, but they come sooner,” he says. Pueblo Viejo is surrounded by mountains, and Firmo, like many of his counterparts, has to climb a steep hill to get to his farm. Living close to the Guatemalan border, Firmo speaks some Spanish, his native Maya Mopan language, Q'eqchi' and English.

loans.use: Cleaning and cacao farm expansion

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 38 years old, married and has four children. He operates a tailoring shop and has been in business for the past nine years. He is a very hardworking man and very humble.

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has managed to build his home. Someday he hopes to expand his business and become very prosperous. He requires a loan of 63,585 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, a 43-year-old mother, and a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Abraham, a tricycle driver. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to help her in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Marilyn hopes that her variety store will become a grocery store. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to re-sell in her store.

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es:
José es un joven de 22 años, es soltero y por costumbres y tradiciones de la comunidad a la cual pertenece, alcanzó a terminar la escuela primaria. Tiene 2 hijos a quienes visita con cierta frecuencia. Vive en la casa de familiares en el cantón Santo Domingo de la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Santo Domingo se encuentra conectando la Región Sierra con la Región Costa del Ecuador, es una ciudad que se ha convertido en un eje comercial con varios sectores en crecimiento y como prueba se tiene a varias familias emprendedoras que hace algunos años comenzaron con pequeños negocios y ahora son microempresarios que aportan a la generación de empleo. Los estudios revelan que todos los negocios en su mayoría, empezaron empíricamente y han tenido acogida por el paso de turistas, empresarios y viajeros que se trasladan de una región a otra y además que es la tercera ciudad más habitada en el país. José reside en la Parroquia Puerto Limón de este cantón, un sector que fue habitado por una comunidad tsáchila y tiene varios atractivos turísticos. Además los habitantes de esta parroquia en su gran mayoría, se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería.
José se dedica a la producción de cacao y plátano verde. Aprendió con sus padres desde que era un niño y la puso en práctica desde hace 8 años cuando emprendió con los cultivos y la venta de su fruto. José es un hombre eminentemente campesino,  trabaja día a día y es poseedor de una incansable e inagotable fuerza de trabajo, su gran obstáculo para que crezca su negocio se encontró en la dificultad de obtener préstamos en entidades financieras porque aún no ha podido obtener las escrituras que avalan la finca de su propiedad, pues está dentro de una comunidad tsáchila por lo que ha tenido problemas pero sin embargo no ha sucumbido ante las inclemencias climáticas, económicas y sociales, es por esto que José requiere un préstamo para poder realizar una resiembra de sus cultivos de plátano verde que es muy cotizado en la zona para venderlo en el mercado pues las amas de casa lo preparan cocinado, frito, en pastel o muchas formas más que deleitan el paladar nacional e internacional. José agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la confianza brindada, pues ya es la segunda vez que le otorgan un crédito, por lo que se puede apreciar que además José es un cliente muy cumplido en sus pagos.
texts.en:
José, 22, is a single young man who, following the customs and traditions of his community, finished primary school.  He has two children, whom he visits with some frequency.  He lives in the house of some relatives in Santo Domingo Canton in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas.

Santo Domingo connects the mountain and coastal regions of Ecuador.  It's a city that has become a commercial crossroads with several developing sectors. As proof of this, there are many enterprising families here who started out with small businesses a few years ago and now are micro-business owners who generate employment. Studies show that all the businesses for the most part started out empirically and have been well-received by tourists, businessmen, and travelers who go from one region to the other.  In addition, this is the country’s third most populous city.

José lives in Puerto Limón Parish in this canton, an area that was inhabited by a Tsáchila community and has several tourist attractions.  In addition, the vast majority of residents in this parish make a living in agriculture and livestock.

José makes a living growing cacao and green plantains, which he learned from his parents at a young age and started doing eight years ago when he started growing and selling his fruit.  José is a consummate farmer.  He works every day and has an untiring and inexhaustible energy for work.

His big obstacle is that, for his business to grow, he had difficulty getting loans from financial institutions because he still hasn't gotten the papers that guarantee the farm he owns, which is within a Tsáchila community so he has had problems.  Nevertheless, he has not succumbed to weather, economic, and social harshness.

This is why he needs a loan to be able to replant his green plantain crops, which is highly valued in the area for sale in the market because the housewives prepare it cooked, fried, in pastry, or in many other forms that please the national and international palate.

José's grateful to Fundación Alternativa for their confidence in him, because this is the second time they have given him a loan.  This shows that José is also a client who makes his payments on time.

loans.use: to replant banana trees

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary works hard to support her family. Mary is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines.

Mary requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing equipment such as a fishing boat engine for her business.

Mary has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Mary would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment such as a fishing boat engine for her business

loans.name: Khasirat

texts.ru: Хасирату 40 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Со своей семьей она проживает в городе Исфара. В данное время муж Хасират не работает. Двое ее сыновей получают образование в России. Поэтому Хасирату приходиться самой обеспечивать семью. Она на центральном рынке города Исфары продает оптом женские одежды и материалы. В месяц один раз Хасират едит в город Душанбе за приобретением своего товара. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получить хороший доход, Хасират обратилась в организацию за кредитом. Полученные деньги она использует для приобретения женских одежд и материалов и тем самым увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Khasirat is 40 and married with two children. Khasirat and her family live in the town of Isfara. Her husband is not working at the moment, and her two sons are studying in Russia, so she has to provide for the family on her own.
Khasirat sells women's clothes and fabrics in bulk at the central market in Isfara. Every month Khasirat goes to Dushanbe to purchase her stock. To expand her business and increase her profit, Khasirat has requested a loan. She will use the funds to buy women's clothing and fabrics to boost her turnover.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing and fabrics

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, a 54-year old mother, and a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, a driver. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to help her in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects an expansion in her business income as she enlarges her business. 

Teresita hopes that her business will grow and expand. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages to re-sell in her store.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 12 children, Celia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Celia is borrowing 20000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Celia has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
As a parent of three children who are currently attending school, Angelita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Angelita is borrowing 10000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional frozen products such as chicken, hotdogs and meat to sell in her business.

Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional frozen products such as chicken, hotdogs and meat to sell

loans.name: Digna

texts.en:
This is Digna. She is 55 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother to her children. She and her children manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Digna oversees and owns operations of their Tricycle transportation business. They have one unit of tricycle that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Her regular customers are the people in the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 12, 000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and accessories, as well as for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Digna hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: elisabeth est une jeune femme de 30 ans mariée et avec à sa charge 02 enfants.elle est actuellement propriétaire d'une mini alimentation située dans un quartier de la place.cette alimentation commercialise les produits tels que: les poissons frais,les plantains,les bananes et autres.cette activité évolue dans de bonne conditions et dans un milieu sain.cependant,elle sollicite un credit à l'aide duquel elle pourra agrandir son commerce et accroitre ses parts de marché. les bénéfices serviront à terminer les constructions de son domicile plus tard et subvenir par la meme occasion aux besoins scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en: Elisabeth is 30 years old.  She is married and taking care of two children.  She currently owns a small food shop located nearby.  She sells food products such as fresh fish, plantains, bananas etc.  Her business is doing well and its environment is healthy.  Nevertheless, she is requesting a loan to expand her business and her share of the market.  She will use her profits to finish building her house one day and also to pay for her children schooling needs.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish and some staple foods.

loans.name: Donna May

texts.en:
Donna May is 33 years old and married with two children.

Donna May works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Donna May borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling dry goods business for five years and also earns an income from a general store.

Donna May aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Sop Sa Dieukeur Group

texts.fr: SOP SA DIEUKEUR est un groupe de solidarité qui regroupe 6 femmes.Elles exercent un commerce individuel de tissus, d'articles de mercerie et de produits et denrées divers.Elles sont mariées et mères de plusieurs enfants.Le chef du groupe ( celle qui tient une feuille et un stylo, quatrième à partir de la droite), est mère de trois enfants.Elle vend des tissus "ganila" au marché de sa localité.Elle prend en charge avec ses revenus ses propres besoins ainsi que les besoins de ses enfants.Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite un pret de 990 000f pour acheter des tissus, des articles de mercerie et divers produits.Leur ambition est d'élaegir leurs activités.
texts.en:
SOP SA DIEUKEUR is a solidarity group which consists of six women.  These women work as retail merchants and sell fabrics, sewing supplies and various other products.  They are married and have several children.  The leader of the group is the mother of three children (in the photo, she is the fourth woman from the right and holding a paper and a pen).  She sells "ganila" fabrics at her local market.  With her income, she takes care of her own needs as well as those of her children.

In order to strengthen their businesses, the members of the group are requesting a loan of 990,000 francs.  They will use their loan to buy fabrics, sewing supplies and other products.  Their ambition is to expand their commercial activities.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, sewing supplies and other various goods.

loans.name: Sop Sa Dieukeur 2 Group

texts.fr: SOP SA DIEUKEUR 2 est un groupe de solidarité qui compte 9 femmes mariées.Elles exercent le commerce de tissus et d'articles de mercerie.Le chef de groupe ( tout blanc au milieu) est mère de trois enfants. Ce commerce lui permet de prendre en charge ses propres besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants. Afin de renforcer leurs fonds de commerce, les femmes sollicitent un pret de 900 000f pour acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie.
texts.en: SOP SA DIEUKEUR 2 is a solidarity group composed of nine married women. They have businesses involving cloth and sewing supplies. The head of the group (all in white in the photo) is a mother of three children. This business enables her to meet her needs and those of her children. To bolster their business fund, the women are requesting a loan of 900,000 francs to purchase some cloth and sewing supplies.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and sewing supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Elizabeth is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Marie Caroline

texts.fr: marie caroline est une femme mariée agée de 43 ans et mère d'un enfant.pour s'occuper et subvenir à ses besoins,elle commercialise des vivres et vend en plus des aliments tels que le haricot,les arachides,les noix de palme,etc..dans un quartier de la place.elle exerce également une activité secondaire portant sur l'agriculture à l'aide des multiples terres dont son mari est propriétaire.le credit sollicité par marie caroline,lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de marchandises et auusi de servir des benefices pour ameliorer son cadre de vie tout en maintenant par la meme occasion son équilibre familial.
texts.en:
Marie Caroline is a married women, 43 years old, and the mother of one child. To take care of herself and meet her needs, she sells staple foods, and plus she sells grocery items, such as beans, peanuts, palm nuts, etc. in a local district. She also has a secondary business involving farming, with the help of multiple plots, which her husband owns. 


The loan requested by Marie Caroline will enable her to increase her stock of merchandise and also to [earn] profits for improving her living conditions, all the while serving to maintaining stability in her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise (plantains, taro root, peanuts)

loans.name: Magnifique Group

texts.fr:
Agnès fait partie du groupe  Magnifique et habite à Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de 35 ans. 
Elle a un enfant de 14 ans, qui étudie. Elle a sous sa charge 2 orphelins dont 1 étudie. 

Elle fait le commerce des habits depuis  8 ans. 

Elle est à son dixième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits, à  revendre pour gagner plus.
 
Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait devenir  une commerçante grossiste et que ses enfants étudient, et parviennent à terminer les études.
texts.en:
Agnès is a member of the "Magnifique" group and she lives in Bujumbura.  She is 35 years old and single.  She has a 14-year-old child who attends school.  She also takes care of two orphans, one of whom goes to school.

Agnès has been selling clothes for eight years.

This is her tenth loan with Turame.  With this loan, received from Kiva, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothes for resale, in order to make more money.

In the coming years, she would like to become a wholesaler and make sure that her children go to school and manage to finish their studies.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Les Cheribins Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwadjuma, Présidente du collectif de crédit Cherubin, Femme dynamique, entrepreneur expérimentée et très ambitieuse, âgée d’environ 32 ans. Elle est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Son mari est quincaillier. Elle a commencé son business en s’entraidant avec son mari. Plus tard, elle constitua son capital et trouva son autonomie. Elle vient de réaliser 3 cycles dans le programme de micro crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 150 kg de farine de manioc, les sels, les tomates, etc. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et accroître son chiffre d'affaire. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes non bancables. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Mwadjuma, is the president of the loan collective Cherubin. An energetic woman, an experienced entrepreneur, and very ambitious, she is about 32 years old and sells foodstuffs. Her husband is a hardware merchant. She began her business with mutual support from her husband. Later on, she built up her own capital and became autonomous. 

She just completed three cycles in the micro-loan program at the microfinance institution Hekima. So, her new loan must serve to provide her with 150 kg of cassava flour, salt, tomatoes, etc. 

In addition, she would like to see her children grow up and to increase her sales. This client thanks Hekima for its actions helping unbanked poor women to become autonomous. 

It should be noted that certain clients in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour, salt, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita works hard to support her family. Emelita is married and has a buy-and-sell fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now. Emelita requested a 22,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, Emelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Wendtarpanga Group

texts.fr:
Mme  LUCIENNE est responsable du groupe WENDTARPANGA. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13 ans et le moins âgés à 04 ans. 02 vont  à l’école et elle a 01 personne  en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes et chaussures depuis 08ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Paglayiri. Ses clients sont les  hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter  10  pièces de pagnes, 15 douzaines de paires de chaussure.	
Elle veut  épargner  ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne  améliorer son activité (devenir grossiste) et aider son mari pour les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. LUCIENNE is the official of the group WENDTARPANGA. She is the married mother of three children. The oldest is 13 years old, and the youngest is 4. Two of the children go to school. She has one person to support. 

Ms. LUCIENNE has been selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and footwear for eight years. She gets her supplies from the Paglayiri market. Her customers are men and women. 

She wants to purchase 10 lengths of 'pagne' cloth and 15 pairs of shoes. She wants to save her profits. Her ambition is to improve her business (to become a wholesaler) and to help out her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela, age 32, is married with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Estela has a fishing / fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years. Estela requested a 25,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat. In the future, Estela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa is 47 years old and married with one child who is in school. Josefa works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like spices, canned goods, soft drinks, bread, candies, etc. Josefa has been in this business for two years. In the future, Josefa would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like spices, canned goods, soft drinks, bread, candies, etc.

loans.name: Buyanjargal

texts.en: Mr. Buyanjargal is 26 years old and lives with his wife and son in Ger in Uvurhangai Province of Mongolia. His wife works at a local market as a saleswoman, and now she is on maternity leave and taking care of their newborn baby boy, Gan-Erdene, 3 months old. This borrower used to be a herdsman. He moved to the province center in 2010 and worked in various industries. He started his business of a taxi service in town with a motorcycle last year. His motorcycle has been broken several times, and he is planning to replace it with a better one. He is now requesting 800,000 tugriks to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to run his business smoothly. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "I need to work even harder since we have a newborn baby and my wife is on maternity leave."

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to run his transportation business smoothly

loans.name: Ndéye Khady

texts.fr: Ndèye K. G.  est une commerçante qui tient devant son domicile une étale de légumes et de poissons.Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Ce commerce lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et de prendre en charge les frais de scolarité de ses enfants.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 200000f pour acheter des légumes et du poisson frais. Elle ambitionne d'implanter une cantine devant son domicile et d'acheter un réfrigérateur.
texts.en: Ndèye K. G. is a merchant who has a spread of vegetables and fish in front of her home. She is married and the mother of three children. This business enables her to meet her needs and to cover her children's schooling costs. To bolster her business capital, she is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to purchase some vegetables and fresh fish. Her ambition is to set up a stall in front of her home and to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fresh fish

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is 50 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, cream, bread, etc. Clarita has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling fish. Clarita hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, sugar, cream, bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock up on beverages to sell

loans.name: Ana Merida

texts.es: Ana Merida de cuarenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la  venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, posee en variedad camisas, faldas, vestidos, pantalones entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias; comercia de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios accesibles, con producto de calidad y con un servicio excelente; Ana es una mujer emprendedora y muy dedicada a su labor, siempre esta luchando por lo que desea y no piensa rendirse hasta alcanzar el éxito que se merece, en los últimos meses aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión, pero no posee de capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar ropa por mayor. Ana Merida tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confia que le llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ana Merida is 42 years old. She lives with her life partner and their children in their own house. She sells clothing for women, men, and children. She has a variety of shirts, skirts, dresses, and pants, among other items. She has had this business for a number of years, and this has given her a lot of experience that allows her to obtain the best earnings. She sells as a street vendor and also from her home. She was won many customers, since people prefer her because she always has what they need at affordable prices, with quality products and excellent service. Ana is an entrepreneurial woman and very dedicated to her work. She is always striving for what she wants and doesn't think of giving up until she has reached the success that she deserves. 

In recent months, demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment, but she does not have the capital to back her up. For this reason, she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow her to buy clothing wholesale. Ana Merida has good payment references, and she is very responsible. She affirms that she will be able to pay off the debt, and at the same time she is confident that it will bring economic security to her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Azizjon

texts.ru: Азизджону 19 лет. Он энергичный и умный молодой человек. Азизджон не женат и живет с родителями. Он успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Технологический Университет Таджикистана. Данное время он является студентом 2 курса по специальности Инженер-энергетик. Азизджон любит такие предметы как физика, математика и английский язык. Он увлекается спортом и в свободное время читает газеты и журналы, а также разгадывает кроссворды. Будущим он хочет стать хорошим специалистом и заработать много денег для реализации всех своих планов. Азизджон должен оплатить за учебу в университете, однако его родители не имеют денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Azizjon is 19 years old. He is an energetic and intelligent young man. Azizjon is single and lives with his parents. He has successfully completed secondary school and was accepted to the Technology University of Tajikistan’s University. At present he is in his second year of studies, majoring in energy engineering. Azizjon likes such academic subjects as physics, math and English. He does sports, and in his free time he reads newspapers and magazines and also does crossword puzzles. In the future he would like to become a highly qualified professional and earn enough money to realize all his plans. Azizjon needs to pay for his university studies, but his parents lack the money. He is requesting a loan in order to pay for his university tuition. He is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition.

loans.name: Liliane

texts.fr: liliane est une jeune femme qui a un depot de boisson avec un volet restauration dans un quartier de la place.elle sollicite un credit ki lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de boissons et meme d'aliments à cuisiner tout en esperant voir augmenter le dégré de satisfaction de sa clientèle qui aura dorénavant à l'aide du credit obtenu une diversité d'offre de produits.les benefices obtenus à satisfaire avec beaucoup d'aisance les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Liliane is a young women who has a beverages warehouse which includes a restaurant, in a local district. She is requesting  a loan enabling her to increase her stock of beverages and also food supplies for cooking. Meanwhile, she hopes to see an increase in the degree of satisfaction among her customers, who, with the help of this loan, will have a diverse selection from now on. The profits earned will quite easily meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to expand her stock of goods for her restaurant

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a rice business in the Philippines and also earns additional income by selling vegetables. Myrna is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more rice to sell.

In the past, Myrna has sustained her business activities with seven loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en: Mrs. Davaajav is 42 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a small house in Bayanhoshuu District of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Gombosuren, age 45, works for a local construction company. Her daughter, Saranzul, age 18, is a sophomore student at an accounting specialized university. The borrower has been providing a public transportation business with her husband for two years now. She is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrik loan to pay her daughter's university tuition and health fees. Her daughter has recently slipped and broken her hand and needs medication and treatment. The borrower is hardworking, caring and friendly.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition and health fees

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines. She has been is this business for five years.

Rosemarie requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more clothing to sell.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more additional clothing for sale.

loans.name: Yvette Marie

texts.fr: yvette marie est une femme mariée agée de 46 ans,avec 04enfants en charge.dans le but de rechercher une meilleure condition de vie et un équilibre familiale,elle a décidé d'ouvrir un mini bar restaurant dans lequel elle commercialise les boissons de toute sorte,la nourriture qu'elle prépare elle meme.sa cible principale est essentiellement constituée des étudiants et des autres categories.comme activité secondaire,yvette marie a choisi de faire dans le service traiteur..elle exerce son commerce depuis environ 01an dans un quartier de la place.elle sollicite un credit afin de renforcer son fond de commerce.avec ses benefices,elle voudrait,agrandir son champ d'activité tout en espérant acquérir une grande part de marché.
texts.en:
Yvette Marie is a married woman, 46 years old, who has four children to support. With the goal of achieving better living conditions and family stability, she decided to open a min-bar restaurant, where she sells beverages of all sorts and makes the food herself. Her main target is essentially composed of students and others. On the side, Yvette Marie has chosen to do catering. She has been in this business for about a year in a local district. 

She is requesting a loan to bolster her business capital. With the profits, she would like to expand her scope of business while hoping to acquire a large market share.

loans.use: to increase her inventory for food service

loans.name: Miguel Fabio

texts.es: Miguel Fabio de treinta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia , él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, al mismo tiempo se dedica a la albañilería para complementar los gastos del hogar tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura y se siente orgulloso porque ha logrado obtener mucha experiencia que le permitirá día con día mejorar sus cosechas, las tierras de cultivo son propias y están ubicadas en una zona muy agrícola, el recibe todo el apoyo de su familia ellos le ayudan a comerciar en todos los lugares aledaños ya tiene mucha clientela pues la gente lo prefiere por la calidad del producto por los buenos precios y por el buen servicio; Miguel es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor siempre esta con las ganas de superarse y llegar al éxito,  la temporada pasada tuvo pérdidas y no logró las ganancias esperadas, por eso para esta siembra quiere aumentar la producción y recuperarse pero necesita de capital que lo respalde porque todas sus compras son al contado, es así como decidió solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, arroz, fertilizante, herramientas etc. Miguel Fabio es responsable con buenas referencias crediticias tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar el financiamiento y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel Fabio is 35 years old and lives with his wife and children in a home of his own.  He raises corn and beans and also works as a mason so that he can pay the household expenses.  He’s been a farmer for many years and he is proud because he has gained lots of experience that allows him to improve his harvests.  He has his own farmland located in an agricultural zone, gets his family’s support, and they help him sell in all of the surrounding areas because he has many customers and people prefer to buy from him because of his good prices and service.

Miguel is an enterprising man, always dedicated to his work with a desire to succeed.  He had some losses last season and he was not able to make his expected earnings, but this year he wants to increase his production and recover, but he needs capital to back him because he makes all of his purchases in cash.  He decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL so he can buy corn, bean, and rice seeds, tools, etc.

Miguel Fabio is responsible, with good credit references, and he is certain that he will be able to repay this loan and at the same time provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en: Mr. Baatar is 22 years old and lives with his brother in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His brother works for a local private company. Mr Baatar's parents are herders and live in the countryside. He has been working as a salesperson at his uncle's clothing sales counter in a local market for years, and now he is starting his own clothing sales and rental counter in the local market. He is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for his new business. He is a hardworking, optimistic, and modest man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory to start a new business.

loans.name: Ma. Corazon

texts.en:
Ma. Corazon is 57 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family and runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell.

Ma. Corazon has been in the grocery business for eleven years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco José es un hombre de 52 años, casado, con cinco hijos en las edades de 6, 24, 24, 28 y 30 años, el menor de ellos estudiante de preescolar; Francisco es vigilante en una empresa agroindustrial desde hace ocho años, su esposa se dedica a la venta de comida de manera ambulante, tiene también ocho años de habitar en su domicilio actual, requiere del crédito para continuar con las remodelaciones de su casa, pretende construir la pared del frente, ya que está muy destruida y representa un peligro para la integridad física de él y su familia. Francisco tenía el deseo de realizar dicha construcción desde hace un año, pero no lo había hecho por falta de solvencia económica, con la adquisición del préstamo anterior pudo cambiar parte del techo y con el crédito actual planea comprar materiales como bloques, cemento, arena, cal y piedrín.
texts.en: Francisco Jose is 52 years old, married, and has five children ages 6, 24, 24, 28, and 30.  The youngest attends preschool.  Francisco is a security guard for an agro-industrial company and has been for eight years. His wife sells food on foot.  They have been living in their current home for eight years and he needs this loan to continue remodeling it.  He wants to build a front wall because the current one is destroyed and it represents a danger to his and his family’s safety.  Francisco has wanted to do this construction for a year, but he has not been able to do it because of a lack of finances.  The previous loan allowed him to replace part of his roof and he will use this loan to buy building materials such as cinder blocks, cement, sand, salt, and stone.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es: Jorge Humberto de cincuenta y uno años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y ha adquirido valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno donde cultiva tiene un alto potencial agrícola, esta apto para la siembra y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad de producto, los buenos precios pero sobre todo por el excelente servicio siempre a la disposición de los clientes; Jorge es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, se dedica con gran esfuerzo y dedicación a su labor esta seguro que solo así logará el éxito que tanto desea; en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas debido a los cambios de clima y quiere recuperarse pero para ello necesita de capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar, semilla de maíz, maicillo, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Jorge Humberto tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos y esta muy contento con la ayuda por eso se hace responsable de cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza que le dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Jorge Humberto is 51 years old and lives with his wife and children in a home of their own.  He raises corn and sorghum and has been farming for many years.  It’s allowed him to obtain better harvests.  The land on which he works has a high agricultural potential and it’s ready for planting and close to his home. He sells everything in the community’s surrounding area and has many customers who prefer to buy from him because of the quality of his products, the good prices, and above all for the excellent service he gives his customers.

Jorge is an enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead.  With great effort and dedication to his work, he is certain that this is the only way he can have the success that he greatly desires.  He had some losses during the last season because of the weather and he wants to recover.  To do this he needs capital to back him, so he is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL so he can buy corn and sorghum seeds, insecticides, herbicides, etc.

Jorge Humberto has good payment references from his friends and he is very happy with the help and is committed to repaying this loan and at the same time provide a good life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seed and supplies.

loans.name: Yanet Del Carmen

texts.es: Yanet del Carmen tiene 52 años de edad, casada, con cuatro hijos de 13, 19, 26 y 29 años de edad, uno de ellos estudiante de secundaria, es residente del municipio de Chichigalpa, ha demostrado ser una mujer muy emprendedora, a partir de la iniciativa de establecer su propio negocio, un Centro de Educación Infantil, el cual está ubicado en el domicilio de Yanet, comenzó su negocio hace dieciséis años en vista de la necesidad de un local para niños en edad preescolar, la finalidad del crédito, es ampliar y mejorar las condiciones del local para prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, atender a niños de 1er grado de primaria, cubrir la creciente demanda y expandir el centro educacional, para la compra de materiales como cemento, zin, arena, piedrin, cal, entre otros. Yanet agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Yanet del Carmen is 52 years old, married, and has four children, ages 13, 19, 26, and 29 years old; one of them attends middle school.  She lives in Chichigalpa and has proven herself to be a very enterprising woman; she started her own business, a child education center, located in her home in Yanet.  She started her business 16 years ago because of a need for a local preschool.  She will use the money from this loan to expand and improve her establishment so that she can provide better service to her customers, care for first grade children, cover the growing demand, expand the educational center, and buy supplies such as cement, zinc metal sheets, sand, stone, salt, and other things.  Yanet is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Donaldo Antonio

texts.es: Donaldo Antonio de 48 años de edad, casado, padre de dos hijos de 16 y 19 años de edad, quienes asisten a la escuela secundaria y a la universidad respectivamente; originario de Chinandega desde hace cuarenta y ocho años, es pensionado y actualmente comerciante desde hace diecinueve años, sabiendo que posee una pulpería que está ubicada en su propiedad donde vende granos básicos, cosméticos, ropa, productos congelados, dulces y otros productos, también los distribuye de manera ambulante con ayuda de su esposa, quien desempeña el cargo de enfermera en el centro de salud  en una de las comarcas, inicio el negocio con ayuda de su pensión y el salario de su esposa, nunca había recibido prestamos por parte de la organización y con el crédito obtenido planea invertir en su pequeño negocio, ofrecer productos mucho más variados para satisfacer a sus demandantes, y así formar profesionalmente a sus hijos y ofrecerles un mejor futuro.
texts.en: Donaldo Antonio is 48 years old, married, and has two children ages 16 and 19.  They attend middle school and university.  Originally from Chinandega, he is retired and has been a merchant for 19 years.  He has a general store on his property and sells basic grains, cosmetics, clothing, frozen products, candy, and other things.  He also delivers on foot with his wife’s help. She works as a nurse in the health center in one of the settlements.  He started his business with the help of his pension and his wife’s salary.  He has not gotten any other loans before and plans to use the money to invest into his small business so that he can offer a greater variety of products to satisfy his customer demands.  In this way he will be able to provide an education and better future for his children.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena de cincuenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida en casa propia ; ella se dedica a la venta de dulce de mani y chocolate para cocer, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, comercia desde su hogar y en forma ambulante se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Elena es una mujer  activa, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora todos los días se esfuerza por tratar de cumplir sus sueños, sabe que solo con constancia y amor al trabajo podrá alcanzar ese éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda del producto y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima mani, chocolate, azúcar, etc. Elena tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida mejor con todos los beneficios que se merecen.
texts.en: Elena is 55 years old and lives with her husband is a home of her own.  She sells mani candy and cooking chocolate and has been doing this for several years.  This has provided her with lots of experience that has allowed her to obtain better earnings.  She sells from her home and on foot and has many customers who prefer to buy from her because she sells quality products at good prices and her service is unequalled.  Elena is an active woman, dedicated to her work and is very hard working.  Every day she works to try to achieve her dreams.  She knows that she will only be able to reach them with love and steady work.  Her customer demand has increased in recent weeks and she wants to recover, so she is asking for a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy mani, chocolate, sugar, etc.  Elena has good payment references, is very responsible, and is certain that she will be able to get out of debt.  She is also confident that she will be able to provide a better life for her family with all the benefits they deserve.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Harakoz

texts.en:
Mr. Harakoz is 29 years old and lives with his parents, brother, and son in a small house in Bayan-Ulgii province. His parents are retired and stay home. His brother works at a local private company. His son Mairambek, age three, goes to a local kindergarten.

Mr. Harakoz has been running a transportation service in town for ten years. He has built strong relationships with his customers. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts for his truck and to help run his business smoothly. He is a hardworking and modest man; he has a good record and has not been delinquent on his previous loans from XacBank.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his truck.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is 33 and a married woman with four children. They live in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Guadalupe has been running a sewing and tailoring shop for more than two years now. Guadalupe needs a loan for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy materials for sewing and tailoring like cloth, thread, and needles. This will help her to sew more, allowing her to serve more customers in her shop.

In the future, Guadalupe hopes to make her business a sustainable success.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing and tailoring like cloth, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Erdenetsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenetsetseg, 48 years old, lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been providing a taxi service to local people for 14 years, and they have accumulated a vast amount of experience in this type of service. In addition to their taxi service, they sell nuts and timber in summer and winter respectively. Mrs. Erdenetsetseg's mother lives in her old house, while she and her husband live in a newly built home. 

Mrs. Erdenetsetseg is requesting a loan of 6,800,000 MNT to purchase construction materials such as bricks, hardwood flooring, and roofing iron. The building materials will be used to improve the newly built house. The work includes the building of a brick oven, installment of hardwood floors, and roofing. As a result, the family can live in their improved newly built house, which is warm and comfortable. The new house has several benefits, such as preservation of heat, invulnerability to storms and frosts, and less smoke emission. All these factors are important contributions to the efforts against air pollution.

loans.use: to build a brick oven, install a hardwood floor, and build a roof.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 38-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as a very determined woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. Her business is located at a market, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as having insufficient funds to improve the business. She will use the 8,700 KES loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members for household chores. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de cincuenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida Ester y sus hijos en casa propia;  él posee un taller de electrónica donde repara, televisores, radios, planchas, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia  en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, presta el servicio desde su vivienda y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio excelente; Carlos es un hombre activo, dedicado a su labor, honesto y sobre todo luchador, para él lo mas impórtate es nunca rendirse aunque existan adversidades pues tarde o temprano siempre se abren las puertas al éxito, en la ultima semana aumento la demanda y desea realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar repuestos de telvison, grabadoras, plancha, herramienta etc. Carlos tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le  dará a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Carlos is 52 years old.  He lives his own home with his life partner, Ester, and their children.  He owns an electronic repair shop for televisions, radios, irons, etc.  He has been at this business for a number of years, which has given him a lot of experience in sales and allows hime to make more money amd offer his services from his home.  He already has a strong customer base that prefers his quality, good prices and excellent service.  

Carlos is an active man, dedicated to his work and honest.  Above all, he is a fighter.  For Carlos, it is critical to never give up, even when faced with adversity, since sooner or later the doors to success will open.  

Last week demand increased so he would like to invest more money.  He has therefore asked INTEGRAL for a loan, which will allow him to buy parts for televisions, tape recorders, irons, tools, etc.  Carlos has good loan references and an impecable ethic, which ensures that he will be able to pay off the debt on time and at the same time have confidence that he will give his family a full life.

loans.use: parts for televisions, recorders, irons and tools.

loans.name: Milton Humberto

texts.es: Milton Humberto de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; Él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo además para complementar los gastos del hogar posee dos vacas propias y trabaja de jornal en diferentes lugares, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y eso le ha regalado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas; el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a la localidad donde reside, comercia en todos los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere porque todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad, a precios accesible y con un excelente servicio; Milton es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, siempre esta buscando alternativas que le permitan encontrar el camino para un futuro mas prospero sabe que solo así alcanzara el éxito, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse, realizara una nueva inversión y para ello le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, maicillo, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Milton Humberto tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: MIlton Humberto, who is 29 years old, lives with his life companion and their children in their own house. His work is growing corn, beans, and sorghum. In addition, he supplements the household income with two of his own cows, and he works as a day laborer in different places. He has been working in this area for a number of years, and this has given him valuable experience that allows him to obtain the best harvests. His fields are located in an area of high agricultural use and very close to the town where he lives. He sells his products in all the areas surrounding his town, and he already has many customers who prefer him because everything that he sells is of first quality, at affordable prices, and with excellent service. Milton is an entrepreneurial man, dedicated to his work. He is always looking for alternatives that will permit him to find the route to a more prosperous future. He knows that only in this way will he achieve success. In the last planting season he had some losses, and he wants to recover. He will make a new investment, and for this he is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy seeds for corn, beans, and sorghum and insecticides, herbicides, etc. Milton Humberto has good payment references, and he affirms that he will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time he is confident that he will be able to bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds for corn, beans, and sorghum, insecticides, and herbicides

loans.name: Jacqueline Jeaneth

texts.es: Jacqueline Jeaneth de treinta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella  posee una sala de belleza, realiza cortes, peinados, maquillajes entre otros además vende cremas, perfumes y cosméticos, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, presta sus servicio desde un lugar que califico como muy bueno para realizar sus actividades, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren porque todo su trabajo es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además del servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Jacqueline es una mujer  activa, dedicada a su labor y muy luchadora todos los días se esfuerza por tratar de cumplir sus sueños sabe que solo con constancia y amor al trabajo podrá alcanzar ese éxito, en las ultimas semanas aumento la demanda del servicio y quiere invertir en herramienta de trabajo por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar plancha, tijeras, peines cremas, perfumes, cosméticos etc. Jacqueline Jeaneth  tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Jeaneth is 33 years old and lives with her husband and children.  She has a beauty salon and does haircuts, styles, makeovers, and other things.  She also sells creams, perfumes, and cosmetics.  She’s been doing this for several years and she has gained much experience that has allowed her to have better earnings.  Her business is in a good location and she has many customers who prefer her because of her quality service and good prices.  She also provides excellent service and meets her customers’ requests.

Jaqueline is an active woman dedicated to her work and who works hard all day to try to achieve her dreams.  She knows that this is the only way she can succeed.  Demand for her services has increased in the past weeks and she wants to buy work tools, so she is asking INTEGRAL for loan to buy an iron, scissors, combs, creams, perfumes, cosmetics, etc.  Jacqueline Jeaneth has good payment references, is very responsible, and is certain that she will be able to get out of debt and provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: José Ricardo de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su hijo en casa propia; el posee una panadería y vende pan en variedad francés y dulce,  quesadillas, salpores, pastelitos, tortas entre otros, es muy conocido en la zona pues elabora el pan más exquisito del lugar, el rico aroma que se siente cuando el pan está recién hecho atrae mucha clientela, esta muy satisfecho al ver que las personas se van contentas del lugar, todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente, José es un hombre visionario con muchas ganas de ganarse un futuro más próspero, piensa que si tiene un comienzo tendrá la lucha y si tiene la lucha lograra la victoria, ahora está buscando la lucha y quiere acrecentar el negocio pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina por mayor,  manteca, jaleas, azúcar, sal, bandejas, etc. José Ricardo es muy responsable y con un buen record crediticio tiene confianza que podrá saldar la deuda pero sobre todo tiene fe que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Ricardo is 47 years old and lives with his son in his own house. He owns a bread store and sells sweet bread, french loaves, quesadillas, pastries, cakes, and flatbreads. He is really well-known in the area because he makes the most exquisite bread around. The rich aroma that one smells when the bread is recently made attracts many customers. He is very satisfied to see that the people leave happy from the store. Everything that he sells is top quality and at accessible prices, and the service is excellent. José is a visionary man with the desire to earn a more prosperous future. He thinks that if he has a start, he will have the battle, and if he has the battle, he will achieve the victory. He is now looking for the fight and wants to increase his business but needs the resources. For that reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy flour in bulk, butter, jam, sugar, salt, baking trays, etc. José Ricardo is very responsible and with a good credit record. He has the confidence that he will be able to pay down the loan, but above all he has faith that he will be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk, butter, jam, sugar, salt, baking trays

loans.name: Bartolome

texts.es: Bartolome de setenta y dos años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia , él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, los años de trabajo en el rubro le han regalado experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, lo buenos precios y el excelente servicio; Bartolome es un hombre amable, honesto muy dedicado a su labor todos los días lucha por ganarse un futuro mejor sabe que con todo su esfuerzo y dedicación lograra el éxito que desea; en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, insecticida, herbicida, herramienta, etc. Bartolome buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene confianza que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bartolome is 72 years old and lives with his wife in a home of his own.  He is a farmer and raises corn.  His two years working in this field have given him much experience which has allowed him to obtain better harvests.  The farmland is located in a very agricultural zone near his home and he sells in the surrounding area.  He has many customers who prefer to buy from him because of the good prices and excellent service.

Bartolome is a friendly, honest man dedicated to his work.  He works every day to make a better future and knows that he will do it through hard work and dedication.  He had some losses during the last season and he wants to recover, so he has asked for a loan through INTEGRAL so he can buy corn seed, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc.  Bartolome has good payment reference and he is certain that he can get out of debt and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies.

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en: Ganhuyag, 37, lives with his wife and 2 sons in a small house in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife Gantuya, 33, works at a local company as an assistant worker. His sons Nyambayar, 8, and Lhagvabayar, 5, go to the local primary school. The borrower has been running a grocery store in his neighborhood for 6 years. He purchases inventory wholesale and brings it to his store with rented transportation. He is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase an eco-friendly hybrid car to reduce his transportation expenses. He is a well-experienced, hardworking and open-minded person.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly hybrid car to reduce his transportation expenses.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel de cincuenta y dos años de edad vive junto a sus hijos; ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene muchos años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de incidencia agrícola que es muy accesible a la carretera, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad, es muy conocida por su gran amabilidad y por su producto confiable, la gente la prefiere porque todo es de calidad, a precio accesible y con un excelente servicio; María es una mujer activa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, le gusta luchar por lo que desea y trabaja duro hasta lograrlo; en la temporada pasada tuvieron un gran margen de perdida, pero en esta cosecha decidió recuperarse, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, abono, insecticida, herbicida, etc. María Isabel tiene buenas referencias de pago y es muy responsable, asegura que cancelara la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria Isabel is 52 years old and lives with her children.  She raises corn and has been farming for many years.  This has given her much experience and she is able to obtain better harvests.  The farmland is in a very agricultural zone near her home and she sells her harvest in the surrounding community.
